#tr.en: received;

#tr.en: in Uruk 
#tr.en: via Lugal-amgal; 
#tr.en: year: “The Nanna-lord of Karzida was installed.” 
#tr.en: When the august Anu, 
#tr.en: king of the Anunnaku, 
#tr.en: and Enlil, 
#tr.en: lord of heaven 
#tr.en: and earth, 
#tr.en: who determines 
#tr.en: the destinies of the land, 
#tr.en: to Marduk, 
#tr.en: the firstborn son 
#tr.en: of Ea, 
#tr.en: supreme power 
#tr.en: over all peoples, 
#tr.en: allotted, 
#tr.en: among the Igigu, 
#tr.en: exalted him, 
#tr.en: Babylon 
#tr.en: with its august name named, 
#tr.en: and within the regions 
#tr.en: made it supreme; 
#tr.en: and within it 
#tr.en: eternal kingship 
#tr.en: whose, like heaven 
#tr.en: and earth,

#tr.en: The field, orchard, or house 
#tr.en: of a soldier, fisherman 
#tr.en: or carrier of a load, 
#tr.en: for silver 
#tr.en: shall not be given. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: a field, orchard, or house 
#tr.en: of a soldier, fisherman 
#tr.en: or carrier of a load, 
#tr.en: has purchased, 
#tr.en: his tablet 
#tr.en: shall be smashed 
#tr.en: and his silver 
#tr.en: he shall forfeit; 
#tr.en: the field, orchard, or house 
#tr.en: to its owner 
#tr.en: shall return. 
#tr.en: A soldier, fisherman 
#tr.en: or carrier of a load 
#tr.en: from a field, orchard, or house 
#tr.en: of his ilkum(-service) 
#tr.en: to his wife 
#tr.en: or his daughter 
#tr.en: shall not write over, 
#tr.en: or for his e’iltum(-debt) 
#tr.en: shall not give. 
#tr.en: From a field, orchard, or house 
#tr.en: that he purchases and 
#tr.en: owns 
#tr.en: to his wife 
#tr.en: or his daughter 
#tr.en: he shall write over, 
#tr.en: or for his e’iltum(-debt) 
#tr.en: shall give. 
#tr.en: A nadītum, a merchant 
#tr.en: or another ilkum(-service holder) 
#tr.en: his field, his orchard, 
#tr.en: or his house for silver 
#tr.en: shall sell; 
#tr.en: the buyer 
#tr.en: the ilkum(-service) of the field 
#tr.en: orchard, or house 
#tr.en: that he purchases 
#tr.en: shall perform. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: a field, orchard, or house, 
#tr.en: of a soldier, fisherman, 
#tr.en: or carrier of the burden 
#tr.en: accepted 
#tr.en: and compensatory (payment) 
#tr.en: gave; 
#tr.en: the footsoldier, fisherman, 
#tr.en: or carrier of the burden 
#tr.en: for his field, his orchard, or his house 
#tr.en: shall reclaim, 
#tr.en: and the compensatory (payment) 
#tr.en: that was given him 
#tr.en: shall carry away. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: a field for cultivation 
#tr.en: rented, and 
#tr.en: in the field grain has not caused to be present, 
#tr.en: of in the field his work 
#tr.en: not doing 
#tr.en: they shall prove, and 
#tr.en: grain like (that) of his neighbor 
#tr.en: to the owner of the field 
#tr.en: shall give. 
#tr.en: If the field he has not cultivated and 
#tr.en: has left fallow, 
#tr.en: grain like (that) of his neighbor 
#tr.en: to the owner of the field 
#tr.en: he shall give, 
#tr.en: and field that he left fallow 
#tr.en: with plow 
#tr.en: he shall strike 
#tr.en: and harrow, and 
#tr.en: to the owner of the field 
#tr.en: return. 
#tr.en: if a man 
#tr.en: a k.-(field) 
#tr.en: for 3 years 
#tr.en: for opening 
#tr.en: rented, and 
#tr.en: he was negligent, and 
#tr.en: the field has not opened 
#tr.en: in the fourth 
#tr.en: year 
#tr.en: field with plow 
#tr.en: he shall strike 
#tr.en: hoe 
#tr.en: and harrow, and 
#tr.en: to the owner of the field 
#tr.en: return 
#tr.en: and per bur3 
#tr.en: 10 kor grain 
#tr.en: measure out. 
#tr.en: if a man 
#tr.en: his field towards rent 
#tr.en: for cultivating 
#tr.en: gave 
#tr.en: and the load of his field 
#tr.en: has received, 
#tr.en: later the field 
#tr.en: Adad has devastated 
#tr.en: or a flood 
#tr.en: carried away, 
#tr.en: the loss 
#tr.en: is of the cultivator. 
#tr.en: If the rent for his field 
#tr.en: he has not received, 
#tr.en: or on terms of a half share 
#tr.en: or a third share 
#tr.en: the field he gave, 
#tr.en: whatever grain 
#tr.en: there is remaining 
#tr.en: the cultivator 
#tr.en: and the owner of the field 
#tr.en: in the agreed proportions 
#tr.en: shall divide. 
#tr.en: If the cultivator 
#tr.en: because in the year 
#tr.en: previous 
#tr.en: his expenses 
#tr.en: did not take, 
#tr.en: the field to cultivate has ordered, 
#tr.en: the owner of the field 
#tr.en: shall not object; 
#tr.en: his same cultivator 
#tr.en: his field shall cultivate, and 
#tr.en: at the harvest 
#tr.en: in accordance with his contract 
#tr.en: the grain shall take. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: a debt 
#tr.en: lodged against him 
#tr.en: has, and 
#tr.en: his field , 
#tr.en: Adad 
#tr.en: has devastated, 
#tr.en: or a flood 
#tr.en: sweeps away the crops 
#tr.en: or due to insufficient water 
#tr.en: grain grown in the field 
#tr.en: there is none, 
#tr.en: in that year 
#tr.en: grain to his creditor 
#tr.en: he shall not return; 
#tr.en: his tablet 
#tr.en: he shall suspend performance, 
#tr.en: interest 
#tr.en: for that year 
#tr.en: he shall not give. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: silver from a merchant 
#tr.en: took, and 
#tr.en: a field prepared for planting 
#tr.en: with either grain or sesame 
#tr.en: to the merchant gave, 
#tr.en: “The field cultivate and 
#tr.en: as much grain or sesame 
#tr.en: as will be grown 
#tr.en: collect and take away,” 
#tr.en: said to him; 
#tr.en: if the cultivator 
#tr.en: in the field grain 
#tr.en: or sesame 
#tr.en: has produced, 
#tr.en: at the harvest the grain or sesame 
#tr.en: that in the field is grown 
#tr.en: only the owner of the field 
#tr.en: shall take, and 
#tr.en: the grain (equivalent to) his silver 
#tr.en: and the interest on it 
#tr.en: that from the merchant 
#tr.en: he took, 
#tr.en: and the expenses 
#tr.en: of the cultivation 
#tr.en: to the merchant 
#tr.en: he shall give. 
#tr.en: If a field with barley 
#tr.en: or 
#tr.en: a field with sesame 
#tr.en: plowed and sown he gave, 
#tr.en: the barley or sesame 
#tr.en: that in the field 
#tr.en: is grown, 
#tr.en: only the owner of the field 
#tr.en: shall take, and 
#tr.en: the silver and its interest 
#tr.en: to the merchant shall return. 
#tr.en: If silver to repay 
#tr.en: to return 
#tr.en: he does not have, 
#tr.en: <either barley or> sesame 
#tr.en: according to their market value 
#tr.en: for his silver 
#tr.en: and its interest 
#tr.en: that from the merchant he took 
#tr.en: in accordance with the edict 
#tr.en: of the king 
#tr.en: to the merchant he shall give. 
#tr.en: If the cultivator 
#tr.en: in the field barley 
#tr.en: or sesame 
#tr.en: should not produce 
#tr.en: his contract 
#tr.en: he shall not alter. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: the embankment of (the irrigation canal of) his field 
#tr.en: to reinforce 
#tr.en: neglects, and 
#tr.en: its embankment 
#tr.en: does not reinforce, and 
#tr.en: in its embankment 
#tr.en: and then a breach opens 
#tr.en: and the common irrigated area the water to carry away allows, 
#tr.en: the man 
#tr.en: in whose embankment 
#tr.en: the breach opened 
#tr.en: the barley whose loss he caused 
#tr.en: shall replace. 
#tr.en: If the grain to replace 
#tr.en: he cannot replace 
#tr.en: xxx 
#tr.en: and his property 
#tr.en: for silver 
#tr.en: they shall give; 
#tr.en: and the residents of the common irrigated area 
#tr.en: whose barley crops 
#tr.en: the water carried away 
#tr.en: shall divide (the proceeds). 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: his branch of the canal neighbor’s field, 
#tr.en: for irrigation opened 
#tr.en: and negligently 
#tr.en: his neighbor’s field 
#tr.en: the water to carry away allowed, 
#tr.en: barley like that of his neighbor 
#tr.en: he shall measure out. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: water opened, and 
#tr.en: whatever work has been done in his neighbor’s field 
#tr.en: the water has let carry away, 
#tr.en: per bur3 or field 
#tr.en: 10 gur of barley 
#tr.en: he shall measure out. 
#tr.en: If a shepherd 
#tr.en: with plants 
#tr.en: sheep and goats to feed 
#tr.en: with the owner of the field 
#tr.en: has not agreed, and 
#tr.en: without the permission of the owner of the field 
#tr.en: on the field sheep and goats 
#tr.en: feeds, 
#tr.en: the owner of the field his field 
#tr.en: shall harvest 
#tr.en: and the shepherd who without (the permission) 
#tr.en: of the owner of the field 
#tr.en: on the field sheep and goats 
#tr.en: fed, 
#tr.en: in addition 
#tr.en: per bur3 or field 
#tr.en: 20 gur of barley 
#tr.en: to the owner of the field 
#tr.en: shall give. 
#tr.en: If, after the sheep and goats 
#tr.en: from the common irrigated area 
#tr.en: have come up 
#tr.en: when the pennants announcing the termination of pasturing 
#tr.en: around the main city-gate 
#tr.en: are wound 
#tr.en: the shepherd the sheep and goats 
#tr.en: into a field releases 
#tr.en: and in the field the sheep and goats 
#tr.en: has fed, 
#tr.en: the shepherd the field where he fed 
#tr.en: shall guard, and 
#tr.en: at the harvest 
#tr.en: per 1 bur3 of field 
#tr.en: 60 kur of barley 
#tr.en: to the owner of the field 
#tr.en: he shall measure out. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: without (the permission of) the owner of the date orchard 
#tr.en: in a date orchard of a man 
#tr.en: a tree cut down, 
#tr.en: 1/2 mina of silver 
#tr.en: he shall weigh out. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: a field as a date orchard to plant 
#tr.en: to an orchardist gave, 
#tr.en: and the orchardist 
#tr.en: the orchard planted, 
#tr.en: for 4 years 
#tr.en: the orchard he shall cultivate; 
#tr.en: in the fifth 
#tr.en: year, 
#tr.en: the owner of the orchard 
#tr.en: and the orchardist 
#tr.en: (the yield) equally 
#tr.en: shall divide; 
#tr.en: the owner of the orchard 
#tr.en: his share 
#tr.en: shall select and 
#tr.en: take. 
#tr.en: If the orchardist 
#tr.en: the planting of (the date orchard in) the field 
#tr.en: did not complete 
#tr.en: but an uncultivated area left, 
#tr.en: the uncultivated area 
#tr.en: in his share 
#tr.en: they shall set for him. 
#tr.en: If the field 
#tr.en: that was given to him 
#tr.en: as a date orchard 
#tr.en: if it is arable land, 
#tr.en: the yield of the field 
#tr.en: for the years 
#tr.en: it is left fallow 
#tr.en: the orchardist 
#tr.en: to the owner of the field 
#tr.en: shall measure out; 
#tr.en: furthermore the required field work 
#tr.en: he shall perform, and 
#tr.en: to the owner of the field return it. 
#tr.en: If it is fallow land, 
#tr.en: the required field work 
#tr.en: he shall perform, and 
#tr.en: to the owner of the field 
#tr.en: return it; 
#tr.en: and per bur3 of field 
#tr.en: 10 gur barley 
#tr.en: per year 
#tr.en: each 
#tr.en: he shall measure out. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: his orchard 
#tr.en: to a orchardist 
#tr.en: to pollinate (the date palms) 
#tr.en: gave, 
#tr.en: the orchardist 
#tr.en: as long as the orchard he holds, 
#tr.en: of the yield of the orchard 
#tr.en: two thirds 
#tr.en: to the owner of the orchard 
#tr.en: xxx 
#tr.en: and one third 
#tr.en: that one shall take. 
#tr.en: If the orchardist 
#tr.en: (date palms in the) orchard did not pollinate, and 
#tr.en: thus the yield diminished, 
#tr.en: the orchardist 
#tr.en: a yield for the orchard 
#tr.en: to <the owner of the orchard like that of> his neighbor 
#tr.en: he shall measure out. 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: interest of the silver, 
#tr.en: as much as he took, 
#tr.en: he shall go about and 
#tr.en: per his days 
#tr.en: he shall calculate, and 
#tr.en: his merchant 
#tr.en: he shall satisfy. 
#tr.en: If where he went 
#tr.en: profit 
#tr.en: he has not seen, 
#tr.en: the silver he took 
#tr.en: twofold 
#tr.en: the trading agent to the merchant 
#tr.en: shall give. 
#tr.en: If a merchant 
#tr.en: to a trading agent 
#tr.en: silver for an investment venture 
#tr.en: has given, and 
#tr.en: where he went 
#tr.en: a loss 
#tr.en: he has seen, 
#tr.en: the capital of silver 
#tr.en: to the merchant he shall return, 
#tr.en: If a trip 
#tr.en: in his going 
#tr.en: enemy forces 
#tr.en: whatever he is transporting 
#tr.en: have made him abandon, 
#tr.en: the trading agent by the life of a god 
#tr.en: shall swear, and 
#tr.en: he shall be released, 
#tr.en: If a merchant gives 
#tr.en: to a trading agent 
#tr.en: barley, wool, oil, 
#tr.en: or any other commodity 
#tr.en: for local transactions 
#tr.en: gave, 
#tr.en: the trading agent the silver 
#tr.en: shall up and 
#tr.en: to the merchant 
#tr.en: return; 
#tr.en: the trading agent a sealed document for (each payment in) silver 
#tr.en: that to the merchant 
#tr.en: he gives 
#tr.en: shall take. 
#tr.en: If the trading agent 
#tr.en: has been negligent, and 
#tr.en: a sealed document for (each payment in) silver 
#tr.en: that to the merchant 
#tr.en: he gave 
#tr.en: has not taken, 
#tr.en: any silver not of a sealed document 
#tr.en: in the account 
#tr.en: shall not be placed. 
#tr.en: If the trading agent 
#tr.en: silver from the merchant 
#tr.en: took, but 
#tr.en: then his merchant 
#tr.en: contradicts, 
#tr.en: that merchant 
#tr.en: before god and witnesses 
#tr.en: concerning the silver taken 
#tr.en: against the trading agent shall prove, and 
#tr.en: the trading agent of silver 
#tr.en: however much he took, 
#tr.en: 3-fold to the merchant 
#tr.en: shall give. 
#tr.en: If a merchant silver 
#tr.en: to a trading agent entrusted, and 
#tr.en: the trading agent everything 
#tr.en: that the merchant gave him 
#tr.en: to his merchant 
#tr.en: has returned, 
#tr.en: but the merchant everything 
#tr.en: that the trading agent 
#tr.en: gave him 
#tr.en: has contradicted, 
#tr.en: that trading agent 
#tr.en: before god and witnesses 
#tr.en: against the merchant shall prove, and 
#tr.en: the merchant, because his trading agent 
#tr.en: he contradicted, 
#tr.en: whatever he took 
#tr.en: 6-fold 
#tr.en: to the trading agent 
#tr.en: he shall give. 
#tr.en: If an alewife 
#tr.en: for the price of beer 
#tr.en: barley has not accepted, 
#tr.en: but by the large stone 
#tr.en: silver has accepted, 
#tr.en: and the market price of beer 
#tr.en: to the market price of barley has reduced, 
#tr.en: against that alewife 
#tr.en: they shall prove, and 
#tr.en: into the water 
#tr.en: they shall cast her. 
#tr.en: If an alewife: 
#tr.en: criminals 
#tr.en: in her house 
#tr.en: have gathered, and 
#tr.en: those criminals 
#tr.en: she has not seized 
#tr.en: to the palace 
#tr.en: led off, 
#tr.en: that alewife 
#tr.en: shall be killed. 
#tr.en: If a nadītu or an ugbabtu 
#tr.en: who within the cloister 
#tr.en: does not reside 
#tr.en: a tavern has opened 
#tr.en: for beer 
#tr.en: a tavern 
#tr.en: has entered, 
#tr.en: that woman 
#tr.en: they shall burn. 
#tr.en: If an alewife 
#tr.en: one vat of beer 
#tr.en: as a loan(?) gave, 
#tr.en: at the harvest 
#tr.en: 5 sūtu of barley she shall take. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: in a trading expedition 
#tr.en: is engaged, and 
#tr.en: silver, gold, precious stones 
#tr.en: or any other goods of his hand 
#tr.en: to a man 
#tr.en: gave, and 
#tr.en: under consignment 
#tr.en: caused him to transport, 
#tr.en: that man 
#tr.en: and that which was consigned 
#tr.en: where it was to be consigned 
#tr.en: did not give, but 
#tr.en: took away, 
#tr.en: the owner of the consigned property 
#tr.en: against that man 
#tr.en: of whatever 
#tr.en: consignment 
#tr.en: he did not give 
#tr.en: shall prove, and 
#tr.en: that man 
#tr.en: 5-fold the whatever 
#tr.en: had been given to him 
#tr.en: to the owner of the consigned property 
#tr.en: shall give. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: against a man 
#tr.en: of barley or silver has (a claim), 
#tr.en: without (obtaining permission from) the owner of the barley 
#tr.en: from the granary 
#tr.en: or from the threshing floor 
#tr.en: barley has taken, 
#tr.en: that man 
#tr.en: without (obtaining permission from) the owner of the barley 
#tr.en: from the granary 
#tr.en: or from the threshing floor 
#tr.en: of barley taking 
#tr.en: they shall prove, and 
#tr.en: as much barley as he took; 
#tr.en: he shall return; 
#tr.en: moreover, whatever 
#tr.en: he gave, 
#tr.en: xxx 
#tr.en: If a man . 
#tr.en: against a man 
#tr.en: of barley or silver 
#tr.en: (a claim) does not have, but 
#tr.en: but a member of his household has distrained, and 
#tr.en: for a distrainee, 
#tr.en: each one, 
#tr.en: 1/3 mina of silver 
#tr.en: he shall weigh out. 
#tr.en: If a man has , 
#tr.en: against a man 
#tr.en: of barley or silver 
#tr.en: (a claim) has, and 
#tr.en: a member of his household distrained, and 
#tr.en: the distrainee 
#tr.en: in the house of her distrainer 
#tr.en: to her destiny 
#tr.en: has died, , 
#tr.en: that case 
#tr.en: no claim 
#tr.en: has. 
#tr.en: If the distrainee 
#tr.en: in the house of her distrainer 
#tr.en: from beating 
#tr.en: or other physical abuse 
#tr.en: has died, 
#tr.en: the owner of the distrainee 
#tr.en: against his merchant 
#tr.en: shall prove, and 
#tr.en: if (the distrainee) is the son of a man, 
#tr.en: his (the distrainer’s) son they shall kill; 
#tr.en: if the slave of a man, 
#tr.en: 1/3 mina of silver 
#tr.en: he shall weigh out; 
#tr.en: moreover, whatever 
#tr.en: he gave, 
#tr.en: he shall forfeit. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: an obligation 
#tr.en: held, and 
#tr.en: his wife, his son, or his daughter 
#tr.en: for silver he sold 
#tr.en: or into debt service 
#tr.en: has given, 
#tr.en: three years 
#tr.en: in the house of their buyer 
#tr.en: or of the one who holds them 
#tr.en: they shall perform service; in the fourth 
#tr.en: year 
#tr.en: their release 
#tr.en: shall be secured 
#tr.en: If a male or female slave 
#tr.en: into debt service 
#tr.en: he has given, 
#tr.en: the merchant may extend the term (beyond three years), 
#tr.en: for silver may give; 
#tr.en: there are no grounds for a claim. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: an obligation 
#tr.en: held, and 
#tr.en: his slave woman who has borne him children 
#tr.en: for silver he has given, 
#tr.en: the silver that the merchant weighed out 
#tr.en: the owner of the slave woman shall weigh out; 
#tr.en: his slave woman he shall redeem. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: his barley for grain storage 
#tr.en: in the house of a man 
#tr.en: heaped up, and 
#tr.en: in the storage bin 
#tr.en: a loss has occured, 
#tr.en: or the owner of the house 
#tr.en: the granary opened, and 
#tr.en: the barley took, 
#tr.en: or the barley that in his house 
#tr.en: was heaped up 
#tr.en: completely 
#tr.en: has contradicted, 
#tr.en: the owner of the barley before the god 
#tr.en: his barley shall prove, and 
#tr.en: the owner of the house 
#tr.en: the barley that he took (in storage) 
#tr.en: he shall double, and 
#tr.en: to the owner of the barley 
#tr.en: give. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: in the house of a man 
#tr.en: barley heaped up, 
#tr.en: per annum 
#tr.en: and 1 kor of barley, 5 silas of barley 
#tr.en: as rent of the granary 
#tr.en: he shall give. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: to a man 
#tr.en: silver, gold, 
#tr.en: or anything else 
#tr.en: for safekeeping 
#tr.en: is giving, 
#tr.en: anything 
#tr.en: that he is giving 
#tr.en: before witnesses he shall uncover, 
#tr.en: a contract, 
#tr.en: he shall place, and 
#tr.en: for safekeeping 
#tr.en: he shall give. 
#tr.en: If without witnesses, 
#tr.en: or contract 
#tr.en: for safekeeping 
#tr.en: he gave, and 
#tr.en: where he gave 
#tr.en: they have contradicted, 
#tr.en: that case 
#tr.en: a claim 
#tr.en: has none. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: to a man 
#tr.en: silver, gold, 
#tr.en: or anything else 
#tr.en: before witnesses 
#tr.en: for safekeeping 
#tr.en: gave, and 
#tr.en: he contradicted him, 
#tr.en: against that man 
#tr.en: they shall prove, and 
#tr.en: that which he contradicted 
#tr.en: he shall double, and 
#tr.en: give. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: his property 
#tr.en: for safekeeping gave, and 
#tr.en: where he gave 
#tr.en: either by through a breach 
#tr.en: or by scaling 
#tr.en: his property 
#tr.en: together with the property 
#tr.en: of the owner of the house has been lost, the owner of the house who was careless 
#tr.en: that which 
#tr.en: for safekeeping was given to him and 
#tr.en: was lost, 
#tr.en: shall make whole, and 
#tr.en: to the owner of the property 
#tr.en: shall restore; 
#tr.en: the owner of the house 
#tr.en: for his own lost property 
#tr.en: shall continue to search, and 
#tr.en: from the one who stole it from him 
#tr.en: shall take. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: whose property 
#tr.en: is not lost, and 
#tr.en: “My property 
#tr.en: is lost” has declared, 
#tr.en: his city quarter 
#tr.en: has accused, 
#tr.en: that his property 
#tr.en: was not lost 
#tr.en: his city quarter 
#tr.en: before the god 
#tr.en: shall prove against him, and 
#tr.en: whatever 
#tr.en: he claimed 
#tr.en: he shall double, and 
#tr.en: to his city quarter 
#tr.en: give. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: against an ugbabtu 
#tr.en: or against the wife of a man 
#tr.en: causes a finger to be pointed in accusation, but 
#tr.en: has not proven it, 
#tr.en: that man 
#tr.en: before the judges 
#tr.en: they shall flog; 
#tr.en: further, half of his hair 
#tr.en: they shall shave off. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: a wife 
#tr.en: married, but 
#tr.en: a contract for her 
#tr.en: did not draw up , 
#tr.en: that woman 
#tr.en: is not a wife. 
#tr.en: If the wife of a man 
#tr.en: with a male, 
#tr.en: a second one, 
#tr.en: lying 
#tr.en: has been seized 
#tr.en: they shall bind them and 
#tr.en: into the water 
#tr.en: throw them; 
#tr.en: if the owner of the wife 
#tr.en: his wife lets live, 
#tr.en: then the king 
#tr.en: his subject shall let live. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: the wife of a man 
#tr.en: whom a male 
#tr.en: has not known, and 
#tr.en: who in the house of her father 
#tr.en: was residing, 
#tr.en: pinned down, and 
#tr.en: in her lap 
#tr.en: has lain, and 
#tr.en: they have seized him: 
#tr.en: that man 
#tr.en: shall be killed; 
#tr.en: that woman 
#tr.en: shall be released. 
#tr.en: If the wife 
#tr.en: of a man 
#tr.en: her husband accused (of adultery), but 
#tr.en: with another male 
#tr.en: lying 
#tr.en: she has not been seized, 
#tr.en: by the life of the god 
#tr.en: she shall swear, and 
#tr.en: to her house return. 
#tr.en: If the wife 
#tr.en: of a man 
#tr.en: involving another male, 
#tr.en: a finger 
#tr.en: against her 
#tr.en: has been pointed, but 
#tr.en: with a male, 
#tr.en: a second one, 
#tr.en: lying 
#tr.en: she has not been seized 
#tr.en: for her husband. 
#tr.en: into Id 
#tr.en: she shall plunge. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: was captured, and 
#tr.en: in his house 
#tr.en: provisions 
#tr.en: exist, 
#tr.en: his wife 
#tr.en: until her husband was seized 
#tr.en: her body 
#tr.en: shall guard, 
#tr.en: to the house of another 
#tr.en: she shall not enter; 
#tr.en: if that woman 
#tr.en: her body 
#tr.en: did not guard, but 
#tr.en: to the house of another 
#tr.en: has entered, 
#tr.en: against that woman 
#tr.en: they shall prove, and 
#tr.en: into the water 
#tr.en: cast her.

#tr.en: in his house 
#tr.en: provisions 
#tr.en: ther are none, 
#tr.en: his wife 
#tr.en: the house of another 
#tr.en: shall enter; 
#tr.en: that woman 
#tr.en: a penalty will not receive. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: was captured and 
#tr.en: in his house, children, 
#tr.en: provisions 
#tr.en: are non, 
#tr.en: before his return 
#tr.en: his wife 
#tr.en: the house of another 
#tr.en: has entered, and 
#tr.en: sons has born, 
#tr.en: and afterwards 
#tr.en: her husband has returned and 
#tr.en: his city 
#tr.en: has reached 
#tr.en: that woman 
#tr.en: to her first husband 
#tr.en: shall return; 
#tr.en: the children the estate 
#tr.en: of their father 
#tr.en: shall inherit. 
#tr.en: If a man and , and 
#tr.en: his city deserted and 
#tr.en: has flown, 
#tr.en: after his departure 
#tr.en: his wife 
#tr.en: another’s house 
#tr.en: has entered: 
#tr.en: if that man 
#tr.en: then has returned and 
#tr.en: his wife 
#tr.en: seized, 
#tr.en: because his city 
#tr.en: he hated, and 
#tr.en: fled, 
#tr.en: the wife of the deserter 
#tr.en: to her husband 
#tr.en: shall not return. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: a šugītu 
#tr.en: who bore him children or a nadītu who with children 
#tr.en: provided him, 
#tr.en: to divorce 
#tr.en: his face 
#tr.en: has set, 
#tr.en: to that woman 
#tr.en: her dowry 
#tr.en: they shall return 
#tr.en: and one half 
#tr.en: of (her husband’s) field, orchard, and property 
#tr.en: they shall give her, and 
#tr.en: her children 
#tr.en: she shall raise 
#tr.en: after her children 
#tr.en: she has raised, 
#tr.en: from whatever 
#tr.en: that to her sons 
#tr.en: is given, 
#tr.en: a share 
#tr.en: like that of one heir 
#tr.en: they shall give her, and 
#tr.en: a husband of her choice 
#tr.en: shall marry her. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: his first-ranking wife 
#tr.en: who children did not bear him, 
#tr.en: is divorcing, 
#tr.en: silver as much as 
#tr.en: was her bridewealth 
#tr.en: he shall give her; 
#tr.en: and the dowry 
#tr.en: that from the house of her father she brought 
#tr.en: restore to her, and 
#tr.en: he shall divorce her. 
#tr.en: If there is no bridewealth, 
#tr.en: xxx 
#tr.en: 1 mina of silver 
#tr.en: as a divorce settlement 
#tr.en: he shall give her. 
#tr.en: If he is an m., 
#tr.en: 1/3 mina of silver 
#tr.en: he shall give her. 
#tr.en: If the wife of a man 
#tr.en: who in the house of the man 
#tr.en: is residing 
#tr.en: to leaving 
#tr.en: her face 
#tr.en: has set, and 
#tr.en: goods 
#tr.en: she appropriates, 
#tr.en: her household possessions squanders, 
#tr.en: her husband disparages, 
#tr.en: they prove it against her; 
#tr.en: and if her husband 
#tr.en: of divorcing her 
#tr.en: has spoken, 
#tr.en: he shall divorce her; 
#tr.en: her travel expenses, 
#tr.en: her divorce settlement, 
#tr.en: or anything else 
#tr.en: shall not be given to her; 
#tr.en: if her husband 
#tr.en: of not divorcing her has spoken, 
#tr.en: then her husband another woman 
#tr.en: may marry; 
#tr.en: that (first) woman 
#tr.en: as a slave woman 
#tr.en: in the house of her husband 
#tr.en: shall reside. 
#tr.en: If a woman her husband hated, and 
#tr.en: “You will not have marry me” 
#tr.en: has stated, 
#tr.en: her circumstances 
#tr.en: of her city quarter 
#tr.en: shall be investigated, and 
#tr.en: if she is circumspect and 
#tr.en: fault 
#tr.en: has none, 
#tr.en: but her husband 
#tr.en: is wayward and 
#tr.en: greatly 
#tr.en: disparages her 
#tr.en: that woman 
#tr.en: has no penalty; 
#tr.en: her dowry 
#tr.en: she shall take, and 
#tr.en: for the house of her father 
#tr.en: shall depart.

#tr.en: is wayward,

#tr.en: her husband disparages, 
#tr.en: that woman 
#tr.en: into the water 
#tr.en: they shall cast

#tr.en: to her child

#tr.en: and the marriage settlement 
#tr.en: which her husband 
#tr.en: gave to her 
#tr.en: as in a document 
#tr.en: he wrote for her,

#tr.en: in her the dwelling

#tr.en: as long as she is alive she shall eat, 
#tr.en: for silver to her own sons 
#tr.en: she will not give it; 
#tr.en: her estate 
#tr.en: is that of her sons only.

#tr.en: a marriage settlement 
#tr.en: does not make for her, 
#tr.en: her dowry

#tr.en: of her husband’s estate 
#tr.en: a share 
#tr.en: like that of one heir 
#tr.en: she shall take;

#tr.en: her case

#tr.en: on the sons a penalty 
#tr.en: shall impose;

#tr.en: from the household of her husband 
#tr.en: will not depart; 
#tr.en: if that woman 
#tr.en: to departing

#tr.en: to her husband 
#tr.en: the later one, 
#tr.en: sons has borne, 
#tr.en: after that woman dies, 
#tr.en: her dowry.

#tr.en: her dowry.

#tr.en: shall take. 
#tr.en: If a slave of the palace 
#tr.en: or a slave 
#tr.en: of a commoner 
#tr.en: a daughter of an awīlum 
#tr.en: married, and 
#tr.en: sons 
#tr.en: she has borne, 
#tr.en: the owner of the slave 
#tr.en: against the sons 
#tr.en: of the daughter of an awīlum 
#tr.en: of slavery 
#tr.en: will have no claims. 
#tr.en: And if a slave of the palace 
#tr.en: or a slave of a commoner 
#tr.en: a daughter of an awīlum 
#tr.en: married, and 
#tr.en: when he married her 
#tr.en: together 
#tr.en: with the dowry 
#tr.en: from the household of her father

#tr.en: entered, and 
#tr.en: subsequent to the time that they move in together 
#tr.en: a household they established, 
#tr.en: possessions accumulated 
#tr.en: after which 
#tr.en: either the slave of the palace 
#tr.en: or the slave of the commoner 
#tr.en: to his fate 
#tr.en: has gone,

#tr.en: her dowry 
#tr.en: shall take; 
#tr.en: furthermore, everything 
#tr.en: that her husband and she 
#tr.en: subsequent to the time that they moved in together 
#tr.en: accumulated 
#tr.en: into two parts 
#tr.en: they shall divide, and 
#tr.en: half the owner of the slave 
#tr.en: shall take, 
#tr.en: half 
#tr.en: the daughter of an awīlum 
#tr.en: for her sons shall take. 
#tr.en: If the daughter of an awīlum 
#tr.en: a dowry does not have, 
#tr.en: everything that her husband and she 
#tr.en: subsequent to the time that they moved in together 
#tr.en: accumulated,

#tr.en: they shall divide, and 
#tr.en: half the owner of the slave 
#tr.en: shall take,

#tr.en: 4 kor barley, 
#tr.en: as the hire of an ox for the middle (of the team) 
#tr.en: 3 kor barley to its owner 
#tr.en: he shall give. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: an ox or a donkey rented, and 
#tr.en: in the open country 
#tr.en: a lion has killed it, 
#tr.en: it is on its owner. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: an ox rented, and

#tr.en: or by striking 
#tr.en: has caused it to die, 
#tr.en: an ox like the ox 
#tr.en: for the owner of the ox 
#tr.en: he shall replace.

#tr.en: has injured,

#tr.en: he shall give.

#tr.en: an ox rented, and

#tr.en: and it has died 
#tr.en: the man who the ox rented 
#tr.en: by the life of the god 
#tr.en: shall swear and 
#tr.en: he shall be released. 
#tr.en: If an ox while through the streets
#tr.en: is passing 
#tr.en: a man 
#tr.en: gored, and 
#tr.en: has caused him to die, 
#tr.en: that case 
#tr.en: a basis for a claim 
#tr.en: has none. 
#tr.en: If a man’s ox 
#tr.en: is a known gorer, and 
#tr.en: that it is a gorer 
#tr.en: his city quarter 
#tr.en: let him know, but 
#tr.en: its horns 
#tr.en: he did not blunt(?) 
#tr.en: or his ox did not control, and 
#tr.en: that ox 
#tr.en: a son of a man 
#tr.en: gored and
#tr.en: it caused him to die, 
#tr.en: a half mina of silver 
#tr.en: he (the owner) shall give. 
#tr.en: If it is the slave of a man, 
#tr.en: 1/3 mina of silver 
#tr.en: he shall give. 
#tr.en: If a man a man 
#tr.en: at the face of his field 
#tr.en: to stand 
#tr.en: hired, and 
#tr.en: with the stored barley 
#tr.en: entrusted him, 
#tr.en: the cattle handed over to him, 
#tr.en: and for the cultivation of the field contracted with him— 
#tr.en: if that man 
#tr.en: the seed or fodder 
#tr.en: stole, and 
#tr.en: in his possession, 
#tr.en: it has been seized, 
#tr.en: his hand they shall cut off. 
#tr.en: If the stored barley 
#tr.en: he took, and the cattle 
#tr.en: has weakened, 
#tr.en: twofold the barley that he received 
#tr.en: he shall replace. 
#tr.en: If cattle 
#tr.en: of the man for hire 
#tr.en: he has given, 
#tr.en: or seed grain stole and 
#tr.en: in the field has not caused (a harvest) to be, 
#tr.en: that man 
#tr.en: they shall convict and 
#tr.en: at the harvest per bur3
#tr.en: 60 kor barley he shall measure out. 
#tr.en: If his obligation 
#tr.en: to satisfy he is not able,
#tr.en: through that field by the cattle 
#tr.en: they shall have him dragged around. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: an agricultural laborer hired, 
#tr.en: 8 kor of barley 
#tr.en: per year 
#tr.en: he shall give him. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: an ox driver hired, 
#tr.en: 6 kor of barley 
#tr.en: per year 
#tr.en: he shall give him. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: a plow from the common irrigated area 
#tr.en: stole, 
#tr.en: 5 shekels of silver 
#tr.en: to the owner of the plow 
#tr.en: he shall give. 
#tr.en: a clod-breaking plow 
#tr.en: or a harrow 
#tr.en: he has stolen, 
#tr.en: 3 shekels of silver 
#tr.en: he shall give. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: a herdsman the cattle 
#tr.en: and the sheep and goats 
#tr.en: to herd hired, 
#tr.en: 8 kor of barley 
#tr.en: per year 
#tr.en: he shall give him 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: an ox or a sheep 
#tr.en: to ... 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: xxx 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: If the ox or sheep 
#tr.en: that were given to him 
#tr.en: he has caused to be lost, 
#tr.en: an ox like the ox of comparable value 
#tr.en: or a sheep like the sheep 
#tr.en: for its owner 
#tr.en: he shall replace. 
#tr.en: If a shepherd, 
#tr.en: to whom cattle 
#tr.en: or sheep and goats 
#tr.en: for shepherding 
#tr.en: were given, 
#tr.en: his complete hire 
#tr.en: was received 
#tr.en: to his satisfation, 
#tr.en: cattle 
#tr.en: has let decrease in number,
#tr.en: or the sheep and goats 
#tr.en: has let decrease in number, 
#tr.en: or the offspring has let diminsh in number, 
#tr.en: as per the terms of his contract 
#tr.en: for the (loss of) offspring 
#tr.en: and load (by-products) 
#tr.en: he shall give. 
#tr.en: If a shepherd, 
#tr.en: to whom cattle 
#tr.en: or sheep and goats 
#tr.en: for shepherding
#tr.en: were given 
#tr.en: acted criminally and 
#tr.en: the brand has changed, 
#tr.en: and for silver 
#tr.en: has given, 
#tr.en: they shall convict him and 
#tr.en: tenfold that that he stole 
#tr.en: cattle 
#tr.en: or sheep and goats 
#tr.en: for their owner 
#tr.en: he shall replace 
#tr.en: If, in an enclosure, 
#tr.en: an epidemic has broken out, 
#tr.en: or a lion made a kill, the shepherd before the god 
#tr.en: shall clear himself, and 
#tr.en: the losses of the enclosure 
#tr.en: the owner of the enclosure shall accept. 
#tr.en: If the shepherd is negligent and 
#tr.en: in the enclosure mange(?) has caused to spread, 
#tr.en: the shepherd the damage of the mange(?) 
#tr.en: that in the enclosure has caused to spread 
#tr.en: in cattle or in sheep and goats 
#tr.en: shall make good, and 
#tr.en: to their owner. 
#tr.en: shall give. 
#tr.en: If a man an ox 
#tr.en: for threshing rented,
#tr.en: 2 ban2 of barley is its hire. 
#tr.en: If he a donkey 
#tr.en: for threshing rented, 
#tr.en: 1 ban2 of barley is its hire. 
#tr.en: If he a goat 
#tr.en: for threshing rented, 
#tr.en: 1 qa of barley is its hire. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: cattle, a wagon, 
#tr.en: and its driver rented, 
#tr.en: per day 3 parsiktu of barley 
#tr.en: he shall give. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: only the wagon
#tr.en: for himself rented, 
#tr.en: per day 4 sutu of barley 
#tr.en: he shall give 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: a laborer hired, 
#tr.en: from the beginning of the year 
#tr.en: until (the end of) the fifth month 
#tr.en: 6 barleycorns of silver 
#tr.en: per day 
#tr.en: he shall give; 
#tr.en: from the sixth month 
#tr.en: until the end of the year 
#tr.en: 5 barleycorns of silver 
#tr.en: per day 
#tr.en: he shall give. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: a craftsman 
#tr.en: is hiring, 
#tr.en: as wage of the hireling 
#tr.en: : 5 barleycorns of silver; 
#tr.en: as wage of a woven-textile worker, 
#tr.en: 5 barleycorns of silver; 
#tr.en: as wage of a linen-worker(?), 
#tr.en: n barleycorns of silver; 
#tr.en: as wage of a stone-cutter, 
#tr.en: n barleycorns of silver; 
#tr.en: as wage of a bow-maker, 
#tr.en: n barleycorns of silver; 
#tr.en: as wage of a smith, 
#tr.en: n barleycorns of silver; 
#tr.en: as wage of a carpenter, 
#tr.en: 4(?) barleycorns of silver; 
#tr.en: as wage of a leatherworker, 
#tr.en: n barleycorns of silver; 
#tr.en: as wage of a reedworker, 
#tr.en: n barleycorns of silver; 
#tr.en: as wage of a builder, 
#tr.en: n barleycorns of silver 
#tr.en: per day 
#tr.en: he shall give. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: a ...-boat rented, 
#tr.en: ina ūmim ištēn 
#tr.en: 3 barleycorns of silver is its hire. 
#tr.en: If a boat for traveling upstream he rented, 
#tr.en: 2 1/2 barleycorns of silver as his wage 
#tr.en: per day 
#tr.en: he shall give. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: rents a boat of 60-kor capacity, 
#tr.en: per day 
#tr.en: one sixth (of a shekel) of silver as its hire 
#tr.en: he shall give. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: a slave or slave woman purchased, and 
#tr.en: within his one-month period 
#tr.en: epilepsy over him 
#tr.en: has descended, to his seller 
#tr.en: he shall return him, and 
#tr.en: the buyer 
#tr.en: the silver that he weighed out 
#tr.en: shall take back. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: a slave or slave woman purchased, and 
#tr.en: then claims have arisen, 
#tr.en: his seller 
#tr.en: the claims shall satisfy. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: in a country 
#tr.en: foreign 
#tr.en: a slave or slave woman of a man 
#tr.en: has purchased, 
#tr.en: and while 
#tr.en: within the (i.e., his own) country 
#tr.en: he has been travelling about, 
#tr.en: and the owner of the slave or slave woman 
#tr.en: his slave or slave woman 
#tr.en: has identified— 
#tr.en: if the slave and slave woman 
#tr.en: are natives of the country, 
#tr.en: without any payment 
#tr.en: their release 
#tr.en: shall be secured. 
#tr.en: If they are natives of another country, 
#tr.en: the buyer 
#tr.en: before the god 
#tr.en: the silver that he paid 
#tr.en: shall declare, and 
#tr.en: the owner of the slave or slave woman 
#tr.en: the silver that he paid to the merchant 
#tr.en: shall give, and 
#tr.en: and his slave or slavewoman he shall redeem. 
#tr.en: If a slave to his owner 
#tr.en: “You are not my owner,” 
#tr.en: has declared, 
#tr.en: that he is indeed his slave 
#tr.en: (the owner) shall bring proof against him, and 
#tr.en: his owner his ear shall cut off. 
#tr.en: These are the decisions 
#tr.en: of justice 
#tr.en: that Hammurapi, 
#tr.en: the able king, 
#tr.en: established, and 
#tr.en: the land along the course of truth 
#tr.en: and the correct way of life 
#tr.en: has directed. 
#tr.en: Hammurapi, 
#tr.en: noble king, am I. 
#tr.en: toward the black-headed ones 
#tr.en: whom Enlil presented to me, 
#tr.en: whose shepherding 
#tr.en: Marduk gave me, 
#tr.en: I have not been careless 
#tr.en: or negligent; 
#tr.en: peaceful places
#tr.en: I have sought for them 
#tr.en: serious difficulties 
#tr.en: I removed; 
#tr.en: light over them I spread. 
#tr.en: With the mighty weapon 
#tr.en: that Zababa 
#tr.en: and Ishtar 
#tr.en: bestowed upon me, 
#tr.en: with the wisdom 
#tr.en: that Ea allotted to me, 
#tr.en: with the ability 
#tr.en: that Marduk gave me, 
#tr.en: enemies above 
#tr.en: and below I annihilated, 
#tr.en: wars I ended, 
#tr.en: the well-being of the land 
#tr.en: I enhanced, 
#tr.en: the people of all settlements 
#tr.en: in safe pastures 
#tr.en: I made lie down, 
#tr.en: intimidation 
#tr.en: I did not let them suffer. 
#tr.en: The great gods 
#tr.en: having chosen me, 
#tr.en: I am indeed 
#tr.en: the shepherd who brings peace, 
#tr.en: whose scepter 
#tr.en: is just. 
#tr.en: My benevolent shade 
#tr.en: over my city 
#tr.en: is spread, 
#tr.en: on my lap 
#tr.en: the people of the lands of Sumer 
#tr.en: and Akkad 
#tr.en: I kept. 
#tr.en: Under my protective spirit, 
#tr.en: they prospered; 
#tr.en: in peace 
#tr.en: I maintained them, 
#tr.en: with my skillful wisdom 
#tr.en: I sheltered them. 
#tr.en: That the mighty the weak 
#tr.en: not wrong, 
#tr.en: for the waif and the widow 
#tr.en: to provide just ways. 
#tr.en: in Babylon, 
#tr.en: the city of which Anu and Enlil 
#tr.en: the head 
#tr.en: raised, 
#tr.en: within the Esagila, 
#tr.en: the house of which like heaven 
#tr.en: and earth the foundations are fixed, 
#tr.en: the judgments of the land to render,
#tr.en: the verdicts of the land
#tr.en: to give, 
#tr.en: for the wronged to provide just ways, 
#tr.en: my precious pronouncements 
#tr.en: upon my stela I have inscribed, and 
#tr.en: before the statue of me, 
#tr.en: the king of justice, 
#tr.en: I set it up. 
#tr.en: King among kings 
#tr.en: preeminent am I. 
#tr.en: My pronouncements are choice, 
#tr.en: my ability rivalry. 
#tr.en: has none. 
#tr.en: By the command of Šamaš, 
#tr.en: the great judge 
#tr.en: of heaven and earth, 
#tr.en: may my justice in the land 
#tr.en: prevail. 
#tr.en: By the order 
#tr.en: of Marduk, my lord, 
#tr.en: may my engraved image 
#tr.en: by someone who would remove it not be confronted. 
#tr.en: In the Esagil ly 
#tr.en: that I love may my name favorably 
#tr.en: always 
#tr.en: be remembered. 
#tr.en: Let any wronged man 
#tr.en: who a lawsuit 
#tr.en: has 
#tr.en: before the statue of me, 
#tr.en: the king of justice, 
#tr.en: come and 
#tr.en: my stela 
#tr.en: inscribed 
#tr.en: let him have read aloud to him, 
#tr.en: my pronouncements 
#tr.en: precious 
#tr.en: may he hear and 
#tr.en: my stela the lawsuit 
#tr.en: let reveal for him; 
#tr.en: his case may he examine, 
#tr.en: his (troubled) heart 
#tr.en: may he calm, and 
#tr.en: “Ḫammurabi,
#tr.en: the lord, who like a father 
#tr.en: and begetter 
#tr.en: to his people, 
#tr.en: is, 
#tr.en: to the command 
#tr.en: of Marduk, his lord, 
#tr.en: submitted himself 
#tr.en: and victory for Marduk 
#tr.en: above 
#tr.en: and below 
#tr.en: achieved. 
#tr.en: the stomach of Marduk, 
#tr.en: his lord, he gladdened 
#tr.en: and the well-being 
#tr.en: of the people 
#tr.en: eternally he secured,
#tr.en: and for the land 
#tr.en: provided just ways.” 
#tr.en: This 
#tr.en: may he say, and 
#tr.en: before 
#tr.en: Marduk, my lord, 
#tr.en: and Ṣarpānītu, 
#tr.en: my lady 
#tr.en: with his stomach 
#tr.en: whole 
#tr.en: may he pray for me. 
#tr.en: May the protective spirits, 
#tr.en: the gods who enter 
#tr.en: the Esagila, 
#tr.en: the brickwork of the Esagila, 
#tr.en: my portents 
#tr.en: daily 
#tr.en: before 
#tr.en: Marduk, my lord, 
#tr.en: and Ṣarpānītu, 
#tr.en: my lady 
#tr.en: make auspicious. 
#tr.en: In the future 
#tr.en: days 
#tr.en: at any time 
#tr.en: may any king who in the land 
#tr.en: should appear 
#tr.en: the pronouncements 
#tr.en: of justice 
#tr.en: that upon my stela 
#tr.en: I inscribed, observe.
#tr.en: the judgments 
#tr.en: that I rendered 
#tr.en: and the verdicts of the land 
#tr.en: that I gave, 
#tr.en: may he not alter, 
#tr.en: nor my engraved image 
#tr.en: remove. 
#tr.en: If that man 
#tr.en: has discernment, and 
#tr.en: of providing just ways for his land is capable, 
#tr.en: the pronouncements 
#tr.en: I have inscribed upon my stela may he heed, and
#tr.en: the traditions, the proper conduct, 
#tr.en: the judgments of the land that I judged, 
#tr.en: the decisions of the land 
#tr.en: that I rendered, 
#tr.en: may that stela 
#tr.en: reveal for him, and 
#tr.en: for his black-headed ones 
#tr.en: may he provide just ways. 
#tr.en: May he their judgments render, 
#tr.en: may he their verdicts 
#tr.en: give 
#tr.en: from his land the wicked 
#tr.en: and the evil may he eradicate
#tr.en: the well-being of his people 
#tr.en: may he enhance. 
#tr.en: Hammurapi, . 
#tr.en: king of justice, 
#tr.en: to whom Šamaš (insight into) the truth 
#tr.en: has granted, am I. 
#tr.en: My pronouncements are choice, 
#tr.en: and my achievements 
#tr.en: a rival 
#tr.en: have none; 
#tr.en: only to the fool, 
#tr.en: are they meaningless, 
#tr.en: but to the wise 
#tr.en: they are praiseworthy. 
#tr.en: If that man (a future ruler) 
#tr.en: my pronouncements 
#tr.en: that upon my stela I have inscribed 
#tr.en: heeds, and 
#tr.en: my judgments does not reject, 
#tr.en: my pronouncements
#tr.en: does not change, 
#tr.en: my engraved image 
#tr.en: does not alter, 
#tr.en: that man, 
#tr.en: just as (he has done) for me, 
#tr.en: the king of justice, 
#tr.en: may Šamaš his staff (reign)
#tr.en: lengthen; 
#tr.en: and his people 
#tr.en: with justice may he shepherd. 
#tr.en: (But) should that man 
#tr.en: my pronouncements, 
#tr.en: that upon my stela 
#tr.en: I have inscribed 
#tr.en: not heed 
#tr.en: and should he my curses 
#tr.en: slight, and 
#tr.en: the curses of the gods 
#tr.en: not fear and 
#tr.en: thus the judgments that I judged 
#tr.en: overturn 
#tr.en: my pronouncements 
#tr.en: change 
#tr.en: my engraved image 
#tr.en: alter 
#tr.en: my inscribed name 
#tr.en: erase and 
#tr.en: and his own name (in its place) inscribe— 
#tr.en: or should he, because of fear of these curses, 
#tr.en: have someone else 
#tr.en: do so— 
#tr.en: that man, 
#tr.en: whether a king, 
#tr.en: a lord, 
#tr.en: a governor, 
#tr.en: or a human 
#tr.en: called by any name, 
#tr.en: may the great Anu, 
#tr.en: father of the gods, 
#tr.en: who has proclaimed my reign, 
#tr.en: of the sheen of royalty 
#tr.en: deprive him 
#tr.en: his staff 
#tr.en: break, 
#tr.en: and his destiny curse. 
#tr.en: May Enlil, the lord, 
#tr.en: who determines destinies, 
#tr.en: whose utterance 
#tr.en: cannot be countermanded, 
#tr.en: who magnifies 
#tr.en: my kingship, 
#tr.en: disorder that cannot be quelled 
#tr.en: and a rebellion 
#tr.en: of his obliteration 
#tr.en: even in his own residence 
#tr.en: incite against him; 
#tr.en: a reign of groaning, 
#tr.en: of few days, 
#tr.en: of years 
#tr.en: of famine, 
#tr.en: of darkness 
#tr.en: without illumination, 
#tr.en: and of sudden death 
#tr.en: as his fate 
#tr.en: may he cast; 
#tr.en: the obliteration of his city, 
#tr.en: the dispersion of his people, 
#tr.en: the supplanting of his dynasty, 
#tr.en: and that his name and his memory 
#tr.en: from the land 
#tr.en: be blotted out, 
#tr.en: with his venerable speech 
#tr.en: may he declare. 
#tr.en: May Ninlil, 
#tr.en: the great mother, 
#tr.en: whose utterance 
#tr.en: in the Ekur is honored, 
#tr.en: the mistress who makes auspicious 
#tr.en: my portents 
#tr.en: at the place of litigation 
#tr.en: and verdict 
#tr.en: before Enlil 
#tr.en: his case denounce; 
#tr.en: the destruction of his land, 
#tr.en: the obliteration of his people, 
#tr.en: and the spilling of his life force 
#tr.en: like water 
#tr.en: by the pronouncement of Enlil 
#tr.en: king 
#tr.en: may she induce. 
#tr.en: May Ea, the great prince, 
#tr.en: whose destinies 
#tr.en: take precedence, 
#tr.en: the sage among the gods, 
#tr.en: all-knowing, 
#tr.en: who lengthens 
#tr.en: the days of my life, 
#tr.en: of all understanding 
#tr.en: and wisdom 
#tr.en: deprive him, and 
#tr.en: and into confusion 
#tr.en: may he lead him; 
#tr.en: his rivers 
#tr.en: at the source 
#tr.en: may he dam up; 
#tr.en: in his land 
#tr.en: barley, 
#tr.en: life of the people, 
#tr.en: may he not allow. 
#tr.en: May Šamaš, the great judge 
#tr.en: of heaven 
#tr.en: and earth, 
#tr.en: who provides just ways 
#tr.en: for all living creatures, 
#tr.en: the lord, my trust, 
#tr.en: his kingship overturn; 
#tr.en: his judgments 
#tr.en: may he not render; 
#tr.en: his path may he confuse 
#tr.en: and the morale of his army 
#tr.en: undermine; 
#tr.en: when divination is performed for him, 
#tr.en: an inauspicious omen 
#tr.en: of the uprooting 
#tr.en: of the foundations of his kingship 
#tr.en: and the obliteration of his land may he provide;
#tr.en: may the malevolent word 
#tr.en: of Šamaš swiftly 
#tr.en: overtake him, 
#tr.en: above 
#tr.en: from among the living 
#tr.en: may he uproot him 
#tr.en: and below 
#tr.en: in the nether world 
#tr.en: his ghost 
#tr.en: for water make thirst. 
#tr.en: May Sîn, lord of heaven, 
#tr.en: my creator god 
#tr.en: whose oracular decision 
#tr.en: among the gods prevails, 
#tr.en: of the crown and throne of kingship 
#tr.en: deprive him 
#tr.en: and an onerous punishment, 
#tr.en: a great penalty for him, 
#tr.en: that from his body 
#tr.en: will not depart 
#tr.en: impose upon him; 
#tr.en: every day, month, 
#tr.en: and year of his reign 
#tr.en: with groaning 
#tr.en: and mourning 
#tr.en: may he conclude; 
#tr.en: a contender for the kingship 
#tr.en: may he unveil before him; 
#tr.en: a life 
#tr.en: that with death 
#tr.en: is equal 
#tr.en: as fate 
#tr.en: may he decree for him; 
#tr.en: May Adad, lord of abundance, 
#tr.en: the canal-inspector of heaven 
#tr.en: and earth, 
#tr.en: my helper, 
#tr.en: of the benefits of rain from heaven 
#tr.en: and flood 
#tr.en: from the springs 
#tr.en: deprive him, 
#tr.en: and his land 
#tr.en: through destitution 
#tr.en: and famine 
#tr.en: may he obliterate; 
#tr.en: over his city 
#tr.en: fiercely 
#tr.en: may he roar, 
#tr.en: and his land into the abandoned hills left by flood 
#tr.en: may he turn; 
#tr.en: May Zababa, 
#tr.en: the great warrior, 
#tr.en: the first-born son 
#tr.en: of the Ekur, 
#tr.en: who travels at my right side, 
#tr.en: upon the field of battle 
#tr.en: his weapon smash;
#tr.en: day into night 
#tr.en: may he turn for him, and 
#tr.en: his enemy over him 
#tr.en: make triumph; 
#tr.en: May Ishtar, mistress 
#tr.en: of battle and warfare, 
#tr.en: who bares 
#tr.en: my weapon, 
#tr.en: my protective spirit 
#tr.en: benevolent, 
#tr.en: who loves my reign, 
#tr.en: with her stomach 
#tr.en: angry 
#tr.en: and fury 
#tr.en: great, 
#tr.en: his kingship curse; 
#tr.en: his auspicious omens 
#tr.en: into calamities 
#tr.en: may she turn; 
#tr.en: on the field of war and battle 
#tr.en: his weapon 
#tr.en: may she break; 
#tr.en: into confusion 
#tr.en: and rebellion 
#tr.en: plunge him, 
#tr.en: his warriors, 
#tr.en: strike down, 
#tr.en: with their blood 
#tr.en: the earth drench, 
#tr.en: a heap 
#tr.en: of the corpses 
#tr.en: of his soldiers 
#tr.en: upon the plain 
#tr.en: make, 
#tr.en: and his soldiers mercy 
#tr.en: may she not show; 
#tr.en: as for him, 
#tr.en: into the hand of his enemies 
#tr.en: may she deliver him, 
#tr.en: and to the land of his enemy 
#tr.en: may she lead him bound captive. 
#tr.en: May Nergal, 
#tr.en: the mighty one among the gods, 
#tr.en: the irresistible onslaught, 
#tr.en: who enables me 
#tr.en: to achieve my triumphs, 
#tr.en: with his overpowering weapon 
#tr.en: great, 
#tr.en: like a fire 
#tr.en: raging in a reed thicket 
#tr.en: his people 
#tr.en: burn; 
#tr.en: with his mighty weapon 
#tr.en: may he have him beaten, 
#tr.en: and his limbs 
#tr.en: like (those of) a statue of clay 
#tr.en: shatter. 
#tr.en: May Nintu, 
#tr.en: august mistress 
#tr.en: of the lands, 
#tr.en: the mother, my creator, 
#tr.en: of an heir deprive him 
#tr.en: and offspring 
#tr.en: not let him have; 
#tr.en: among his people 
#tr.en: a human seed 
#tr.en: may she not allow. 
#tr.en: May Ninkarrak, 
#tr.en: daughter of Anu, 
#tr.en: who promotes 
#tr.en: my cause 
#tr.en: in the Ekur, 
#tr.en: cause a grievous malady, 
#tr.en: an evil demonic disease, 
#tr.en: a serious carbuncle 
#tr.en: that cannot be soothed, 
#tr.en: that a physician the cause 
#tr.en: cannot learn, 
#tr.en: that with bandages 
#tr.en: he cannot ease, 
#tr.en: that, like the bite of death, cannot be expunged, 
#tr.en: upon his limbs 
#tr.en: cause to break out, 
#tr.en: until his life 
#tr.en: comes to an end 
#tr.en: his lost virility 
#tr.en: may he bewail. 
#tr.en: May the great gods 
#tr.en: of heaven 
#tr.en: and earth, 
#tr.en: all the Anunnaku 
#tr.en: in their totality, 
#tr.en: the protective spirit of the house, 
#tr.en: the very brickwork of the Ebabbar, 
#tr.en: that one, 
#tr.en: his seed, 
#tr.en: his land, his troops, 
#tr.en: his people, 
#tr.en: and his army 
#tr.en: with a curse 
#tr.en: terrible curse. 
#tr.en: With the curses, 
#tr.en: these, 
#tr.en: may Enlil, 
#tr.en: whose command 
#tr.en: cannot be countermanded, 
#tr.en: curse him, and 
#tr.en: may they swiftly 
#tr.en: overtake him!

#tr.en: (for) Ninḫursag-nubanda,

#tr.en: for the kitchen on account of the messengers,

#tr.en: A man a snake struck, a scorpion struck, a rabid dog struck, 
#tr.en: their spittle gave. 
#tr.en: Asarluḫi 
#tr.en: to his father Enki a messenger sends: 
#tr.en: “My father, a man a snake struck, a scorpion struck, a rabid dog struck,
#tr.en: their spittle gave; 
#tr.en: what to do about it, I don't know.” 
#tr.en: “My son, what don't you know? 
#tr.en: What can I add? 
#tr.en: His silver ala is purified; 
#tr.en: once to the water the incantation is given, 
#tr.en: the water the ‘foreigner’ made to drink, 
#tr.en: may the spittle on its own go out!” 
#tr.en: A man by a snake bitten: the water the ‘foreigner’ is to be given to drink.

#tr.en: 1 shekel silver, 
#tr.en: labor of Ur-Iškur, 
#tr.en: from Lugal-azida 
#tr.en: did Geme-Nungal 
#tr.en: and Šu-durul, her son, 
#tr.en: receive; 
#tr.en: before Ur-Iškur, 
#tr.en: before the son of Ur-Suen, 
#tr.en: before Lu-Iškur, 
#tr.en: before Tulta, son of Lugal-ḫegal 
#tr.en: if 
#tr.en: there is a work loss, 
#tr.en: barley, 6 sila3 per (day) will be measured out, 
#tr.en: did he the royal name invoke; 
#tr.en: month: “Harvest,” 
#tr.en: year: “The Big-Barge of Enlil was caulked.” 
#tr.en: Šutul, 
#tr.en: son of Geme-Nungal. 
#tr.en: Geme-Ningal, 
#tr.en: son of Bagina. 
#tr.en: ... gur barley 
#tr.en: barley for (the temple household) of Enlil, 
#tr.en: to be stored in that place, 
#tr.en: from Lugal-namtare 
#tr.en: did Ur-Ḫaya 
#tr.en: receive; 
#tr.en: the extra month “Harvest,” 
#tr.en: year: “En-maḫgal-ana as en priestess of Innana was installed.” 
#tr.en: the harvest will remit this barley (debt) 
#tr.en: into the household of Enlil 
#tr.en: which he is entering; 
#tr.en: That “My field by the storm was ruined!”, or 
#tr.en: “by flood water was ruined!” 
#tr.en: to the king or to the chief administrator he will not say, 
#tr.en: by the royal name he swore.

#tr.en: If (there is) a mole is on . . . 
#tr.en: If (there is) a mole on the nape of (his neck) . . . 
#tr.en: If (there is) a mole on the middle of the nape (of his neck), the man . . . 
#tr.en: If (there is) a mole on the forehead of a man . . . on the right . . . 
#tr.en: If (there is) a mole on the left side of a man’s forehead, he will be . . . by hardship. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on his forehead, he will not be . . . by hardship, which will seize (him)  
#tr.en: If there is a mole on the right side of his eyebrow, he will not . . . what he has in mind. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on the left side of his eyebrow, he will achieve what he has in mind.  
#tr.en: If there is a mole at the mid-line of his eyebrows, he will achieve what he is pursuing within a year or two. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on his right eyelid, his first-born son will . . . in the house. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on his left eyelid, his first-born son will be healthy and . . . 
#tr.en: If there is a mole under the right side of DITTO, his sons will not have a protective deity. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole under the left side of DITTO, his sons will have a (personal) god and . . . 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on his nose, an utterance of evil will constantly chase after him. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole in the corner of his right eye, his profits will turn toward his legal adversary. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole in the corner of his left eye, the wedding gift of the street (?) will be given to . . . as a gift. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on his right cheek, his merchandise will be disparaged, lit. will be mentioned for evil.  
#tr.en: If there is a mole on his left cheek, his merchandise will be confirmed in court (?). 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on the bottom of his nose, the name of (his) offspring will come into existence during the night watch. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on his right cheekbone, one of his sons will constantly not act in a regal way. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on his left cheekbone, one of his sons will constantly act in a regal way. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on the right side of his tongue, that man will be seized by an . . . 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on the left side of his tongue, that man will be subjected to blasphemy.

#tr.en: IF there is a mole on the left side of his tonuge, that man . . . . 
#tr.en: If there is a mole in the middle of the tongue, . . . .

#tr.en: If there is a mole in the middle of his chin, living in a prison . . .

#tr.en: . . .

#tr.en: If there is a mole on the left hand, . . .

#tr.en: If there is a mole at the top of his genital region, sexual desire for his wife . . . 
#tr.en: If there is a mole in his genital region, he will be continually depressed due to anxiety. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on the middle of his penis, death and illness will seize him . . ., death . . . 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on the underside of his penis, someone he doesn't know will discuss the invocation of his name. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on his right testicle, he will not understand an (ominous) word that comes into existence for his benefit. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on his left testicle, the defeat of his legal opponent at the palace. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on his thigh, that man constantly trembles. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on his buttocks, an epidemic will occur among the animals in his house. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on his right upper thigh, a strongman will consume his fortune and he will be upset. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on his left upper thigh, he will take away something of importance to him and he will discover an ancient treasure. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on his lower right hip, an important person or the palace will discover his treasure. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on the lower left hip, the palace will praise him, he will find a treasure, and his name will be invoked. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on the . . . of his right upper thigh, his reputation will be tarnished through his actions. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on the . . . of his left upper thigh, he will get rich through his actions and his speech will be prized in his city. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on his right shin, . . . he will be hungry, his . . . will be weighty. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on his left shin, . . . he will travel a . . . whose foundation is solid. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on the bottom of his right shin, day and night sighs and murmurs will be bound to him. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on the bottom of his left shin, he will be given such as joyous heart that he will not (be able to) bear it. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on the . . . of his right foot, imprisoned by the palace, which will cause him distress. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on the . . . of his left foot, imprisoned by the palace, which the invocation of his name . . ., he will invoke his own name. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on his right ankle, the one who sits before him will . . . his words. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on his left ankle, . . . his legal adversary . . . .

#tr.en: If there is a mole inside his left ear, the denunciation from his own mouth will grow numerous. 
#tr.en: If there is a mole on his . . ., . . . will regularly be to him.

#tr.en: (To the) generals 
#tr.en: say 
#tr.en: what Dudu, the overseer of oxen 
#tr.en: says: 
#tr.en: “As to the bank of the Euphrates 
#tr.en: toward the Tummal canal—
#tr.en: the bridge Kabkumaḫe 
#tr.en: has been washed away. 
#tr.en: The true water 
#tr.en: has risen 1 1/2 cubits. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: the sun has not come out, 
#tr.en: ... will be stationed. 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: in 1 bur3 field, 90 gur stand(?). 
#tr.en: 30 silos may pour out,
#tr.en: but not water(?).” 
#tr.en: Bahar-ri (and) 
#tr.en: Ur-am-NE 
#tr.en: dedicated it (this vase).
#tr.en: (the Lower and) the Upper (Sea),
#tr.en: the people
#tr.en: and
#tr.en: the mountain lands,
#tr.en: all of them,
#tr.en: for (Enlil he smote),
#tr.en: (their kings in fetters) he brought in
#tr.en: before
#tr.en: Enlil.
#tr.en: Šar-kali-šarri
#tr.en: the mighty,
#tr.en: because of the evil offenses
#tr.en: against Enlil
#tr.en: in battles
#tr.en: Hašlahaš,
#tr.en: the source
#tr.en: of the Tigris,
#tr.en: and
#tr.en: cedars
#tr.en: in the Amanus (mountains)
#tr.en: For ... 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: did Lu-Ningirsu, 
#tr.en: the scribe, 
#tr.en: child of Luba, 
#tr.en: for (his) life, 
#tr.en: and for the life 
#tr.en: of his wife and child (or children), 
#tr.en: dedicate it; 
#tr.en: of this bowl, “My lady, 
#tr.en: ...”, 
#tr.en: is its name. 
#tr.en: Naram-Sin, 
#tr.en: builder 
#tr.en: of the temple of the goddess Ištar. 
#tr.en: To Yaḫdu-Lim 
#tr.en: speak! 
#tr.en: Thus Abī-Samar: 
#tr.en: I concluded peace. 
#tr.en: Since a safeguarder I don’t have, 
#tr.en: the peace that I concluded, 
#tr.en: I did not conclude: peace 
#tr.en: was not peace, and ... 
#tr.en: where a safeguarder I don’t have, 
#tr.en: my cities, that they did not seize, 
#tr.en: they now seized; 
#tr.en: in hostilities with the Man of Haššum, 
#tr.en: Ursum, the Man of Carchemish 
#tr.en: or Yamḫad, 
#tr.en: those cities were not lost; 
#tr.en: in hostilities with Samsī-Addu 
#tr.en: they were lost! 
#tr.en: And the cities, those left, I safeguarded 
#tr.en: and my life preserved. 
#tr.en: Maybe you are the savior! 
#tr.en: That your cities 
#tr.en: and your sons are well, 
#tr.en: to life returned me. 
#tr.en: To Yasmaḫ-Addu, 
#tr.en: speak; 
#tr.en: thus, Šamši-Addu, your father: 
#tr.en: As to Yašub-El who in Tuttul died, 
#tr.en: as his replacement, Abduma-Dagan 
#tr.en: in Tuttul to place 
#tr.en: you wrote to me. 
#tr.en: His dispatch, what is it? Your tablet is unclear; 
#tr.en: there finally 
#tr.en: did you install him? 
#tr.en: or another overseer will you install? 
#tr.en: And Abduma-Dagan there to install 
#tr.en: will they lead? He is trustworthy 
#tr.en: and ..., and I have been watching him: 
#tr.en: no sin or shortfall has he, 
#tr.en: he is attentive and trustworthy; 
#tr.en: so now in Tuttul install! 
#tr.en: And say to him 
#tr.en: thusly: “Why in the nests 
#tr.en: of not being made, and in a heavy (rocky) field 
#tr.en: in Zibnātum do you live? 
#tr.en: In Tuttul 
#tr.en: where a nest you will nest-build 
#tr.en: and a household you will make, dwell! 
#tr.en: Arable land is plentiful; 
#tr.en: that land like the land of Šubartu 
#tr.en: is, arable land is plentiful; 
#tr.en: there dwell! Make a household of men, 
#tr.en: and a nest nest-build! 
#tr.en: city and land for its lord make safe!” 
#tr.en: These things say to him! 
#tr.en: set him at ease, in Tuttul 
#tr.en: install him! 
#tr.en: at his side a reliable majordomo, 
#tr.en: a reliable surveyor 
#tr.en: install! And in Zibnātum 
#tr.en: as replacement for Abduma-Dagan, 
#tr.en: from the sons of that land 
#tr.en: either a man from the sons of the palace who at your head 
#tr.en: server, or 1 reliable ušmûm 
#tr.en: in Zibnātum as his replacement 
#tr.en: install. 
#tr.en: Another thing: about the coming of La’um 
#tr.en: from today, the 20th day, 
#tr.en: he has been held back. Why until now 
#tr.en: have you held him back? Now quickly 
#tr.en: that man dispatch here. 
#tr.en: To Yasmaḫ-Addu 
#tr.en: speak! 
#tr.en: Thus Šamšī-Addu, 
#tr.en: your father. 
#tr.en: This month is the month of Addarum. 
#tr.en: When the sixteenth day arrives, 
#tr.en: the Akitu festival will be established. 
#tr.en: The messengers of the man of Ešnunna 
#tr.en: are here;   
#tr.en: Concerning ...  
#tr.en: your teams of draft donkeys  
#tr.en: and your horses  
#tr.en: for the Akītum may they drive here. 
#tr.en: The chariots and equipment should be made new again; 
#tr.en: during the Akītum ...,
#tr.en: to you 
#tr.en: may they return. 
#tr.en: The day you hear this tablet, 
#tr.en: your donkeys should not be stabled! 
#tr.en: Let them quickly come! 
#tr.en: To Yasmaḫ-Addu 
#tr.en: speak! 
#tr.en: Thus Šamšī-Addu 
#tr.en: your father: 
#tr.en: when the armies in Qabraya 
#tr.en: gathered. Išme-Dagan with the armies 
#tr.en: to the land of Aḫāzum I dispatched. 
#tr.en: And as for me, I came to the city. 
#tr.en: And when the armies 
#tr.en: in Qabraya were assembling, 
#tr.en: the assembling of the armies in Qabraya 
#tr.en: the land of Ahāzum heard and its report seized. 
#tr.en: The troops of that entire land 
#tr.en: and the Turukkian men who with them 
#tr.en: were gathered together and 
#tr.en: in the city of Ikkallim 
#tr.en: of the land of Aḫāzum 
#tr.en: were positioned. 
#tr.en: Išme-Dagan, his face 
#tr.en: to that city he set and 
#tr.en: to a field of 5 sixties (cubits) not approaching, 
#tr.en: the troops of that entire land 
#tr.en: and the Turukkian men 
#tr.en: who with them assembled 
#tr.en: before Išme-Dagan to do weapons 
#tr.en: weapons raised ...
#tr.en: … that one ... 
#tr.en: the mass of the that land and the Turukkian men 
#tr.en: who with them assembled, he captured. 
#tr.en: not 1 man escaped and as of this time 
#tr.en: the entire land of Aḫāzum 
#tr.en: he has seized. That victory 
#tr.en: for the land is great. 
#tr.en: Rejoice! Your brother here 
#tr.en: the victory killed. And you, 
#tr.en: there among the women 
#tr.en: are lying. Now 
#tr.en: when with the armies to Qaṭanum 
#tr.en: you go, be a man! 
#tr.en: Just as your brother a great name 
#tr.en: has established, you in the land of Qaṭanum 
#tr.en: a great name establish for yourself! 
#tr.en: To Yasmaḫ-Addu 
#tr.en: speak; 
#tr.en: thus Šamšī-Addu, 
#tr.en: your father: 
#tr.en: Now the tablets that Yarim-..., trade agent 
#tr.en: of Ḫabānim—that for Hammurapi, 
#tr.en: the man of Babylon were written down for me— 
#tr.en: sent to you, 
#tr.en: those tablets 
#tr.en: to Yabliya 
#tr.en: let couriers 
#tr.en: carry. 
#tr.en: From Yabliya 
#tr.en: let two couriers 
#tr.en: the tablet, that for Hammurapi, 
#tr.en: to one the inhabitant of Rapīqum, 
#tr.en: bring on my account. 
#tr.en: The inhabitant of Rapīqum 
#tr.en: that tablet let him send. 
#tr.en: To Addaya, 
#tr.en: speak; 
#tr.en: thus Yasmaḫ-Addu, 
#tr.en: your son: 
#tr.en: As to Mērānum the physician’s 
#tr.en: coming, 
#tr.en: previously 
#tr.en: to Addaya I spoke. 
#tr.en: As of now 
#tr.en: he has not arrived, and 
#tr.en: Rīšiya 
#tr.en: in his life 
#tr.en: is threatened—he is very 
#tr.en: sick! If it is the heart of 
#tr.en: Addaya, Mērānum 
#tr.en: quickly should arrive, and 
#tr.en: the life of Rīšiya 
#tr.en: save! 
#tr.en: May he not die! 
#tr.en: If (somebody) so asks you, saying this one:
#tr.en: At a market rate of 1 ban2 5 sila3 of lard, 1 ban2 of plant oil,
#tr.en: two-thirds the traded amount of lard plus <the oil surplus was the traded amount of oil. 6 barleycorns was the silver>? of the oil
#tr.en: surplus. 1? shekel# of silver I was carrying (could spend).
#tr.en: Lard and oil buy [me]! When you work it out:
#tr.en: The reciprocal of 15 solve (compute), then [4 will come up].
#tr.en: 4 to 1 raise, then 4 will come up for you.
#tr.en: Come again: the reciprocal of 10 solve:
#tr.en: 6 will come up. 6 to 40 lift, then 4 will come up.
#tr.en: Come again: the market value of the oil surplus,
#tr.en: from 1 shekel of silver 6 barleycorns of silver
#tr.en: break off, 58 is the remainder.
#tr.en: Come again: 4 and 4 heap, then
#tr.en: 8 will come up. 8 that came up for you, its reciprocal solve (compute):
#tr.en: 7 30 will come up. 7 30 that came up for you
#tr.en: to 58 raise, the silver: n 7 15 will come up.
#tr.en: 7 15 that came up for you to 4 raise, then
#tr.en: 29 it will give you. Come again:
#tr.en: 7 15 to 4 raise, then 29 will come up.
#tr.en: 6 barleycorns of silver that you from the silver tore out
#tr.en: to one double (add!).
#tr.en: One is 29, one is 31.
#tr.en: Buy of one 7 15,
#tr.en: of one 5 10.
#tr.en: (Problem 1:) (When the principal in) grain (is) as much as 1 gur of grain, 
#tr.en: 1 barig of grain as the interest I give. 
#tr.en: The grain and the interest are how much? 
#tr.en: (Problem 2:) (When the principal in) grain (is) as much as 1 gur of grain, 
#tr.en: 1 barig 4 ban2 as the interest I give. 
#tr.en: The grain and the interest are how much? 
#tr.en: (Problem 3:) (Rates in-kind are) 3 sila3 of first quality oil per (gin2) 
#tr.en: (and) 1 ban2 2 sila3 of common oil per (gin2). 
#tr.en: 1 gin2 of silver I gave. 
#tr.en: Common oil and first quality oil 
#tr.en: I made equal and I bought. 
#tr.en: (Problem 4:) 90 DUG of iron 
#tr.en: 9? DUG of gold, 
#tr.en: 1 mana silver I gave. 
#tr.en: The iron and gold 
#tr.en: (is) 1 gin2 and I bought. 
#tr.en: (Problem 5:) 1/2 mana of silver I gave. 
#tr.en: 1 gur per (gin2) I bought. 
#tr.en: (Problem 6:) 30 gur grain 
#tr.en: 1 gur of grain per (gin2) I bought, 
#tr.en: 4 barig of grain per (gin2) I sold. 
#tr.en: The profit in silver is how much? 
#tr.en: 7 1/2 gin2 of silver is the profit. 
#tr.en: (Problem 7:) The initial price is how much? 
#tr.en: (Problem 8:) 1 gur of common oil. 
#tr.en: 1 ban2 per (gin2) I bought and, 
#tr.en: 8 sila3 per (gin2) I sold. 
#tr.en: The profit is how much? 
#tr.en: 7 1/2 gin2 is the profit. 
#tr.en: (Problem 9:) 1 gur of common oil. 
#tr.en: When the purchase is 1! (text: 2) gin2, 
#tr.en: 2 sila3 I cut. 
#tr.en: 7 1/2 gin2 is the profit. 
#tr.en: How much did I buy? 
#tr.en: How much did I sell? 
#tr.en: 1 ban2 I bought and 
#tr.en: 8 sila3 I sold. 
#tr.en: (Problem 10:) 1 gur of common oil. 
#tr.en: 9 sila3 per (gin2) I bought, 
#tr.en: 7 1/2 sila3 per (gin2) I sold. 
#tr.en: The profit is how much? 
#tr.en: 6 2/3 gin2 is the profit 
#tr.en: (Problem 11:) 1 gur of common oil. 
#tr.en: When the purchase is 1 gin2, 1 1/2 sila3 I cut. 
#tr.en: 6 2/3 gin2 is the profit. 
#tr.en: How much did I buy? How much did I sell? 
#tr.en: 9 sila3 I bought, and 7 1/2 sila3 is sold. 
#tr.en: (Problem 12:) (Per) 7 mana and 11 mana of ... wool 
#tr.en: 1(disz) gin2 I paid. I made equal and I bought. 
#tr.en: 4.16.40 I bought. 
#tr.en: (Problem 13:) Per 7 sila3 of common oil 
#tr.en: per 1 ban2 2 sila3 of lard, 
#tr.en: 1 gin2 I gave. I made equal and I bought: 2 ban2 3 1/3 sila3. 
#tr.en: (Problem 14:) (When) rates (in-kind are) as much as 1 2 3 4 5 
#tr.en: 6 7 8 9, the rate (in grain) 
#tr.en: 1 barig I give. Let the grain rise 
#tr.en: or fall so that 
#tr.en: the rates in-kind are equal. 
#tr.en: (Problem 15:) Rate in-kind for 3 fish, 5 sila3 
#tr.en: for 5 fish, fish ... 
#tr.en: The grain I added: 4 (gur) 1 barig 4 ban2 5 (2?) (sila3) 
#tr.en: The fish I added. Let the fish 
#tr.en: and the grain rise or fall 
#tr.en: so that the fish are equal. 
#tr.en: (Problem 16:) As much as the rates in-kind of the lead 
#tr.en: silver I weighed and 
#tr.en: lead I bought. 
#tr.en: The silver and the lead I added: 
#tr.en: 7 mana. The silver and the lead 
#tr.en: are how much? 
#tr.en: (Problem 17:) Stones I received and 
#tr.en: their weight I don’t know. 
#tr.en: 6 (stones) per (gin2) I bought. 
#tr.en: 6 gold inlaid (stones) per (gin2 I bought). 
#tr.en: Gold inlaid (stones), 
#tr.en: as much as 6 (stones) per (gin2) I bought. 
#tr.en: The stone, the silver how much 
#tr.en: did I add? 1/2 mana 1 1/2 gin2 
#tr.en: ... I added and 
#tr.en: 1 mana 3 gin2. 
#tr.en: 3rd tablet. 
#tr.en: For 
#tr.en: Inanna: 
#tr.en: Maništušu, 
#tr.en: king 
#tr.en: of Kiš.

#tr.en: When the city of Inab already existed, but the city of Kiritab did not yet exist;
#tr.en: When the holy crown already existed, but the holy tiara did not yet exist;

#tr.en: When intercourse and kissing already existed,
#tr.en: When giving birth in the fields already existed -
#tr.en: I was the grandfather of the holy cedar, I was the ancestor of the mesh tree;
#tr.en: I was the mother and father of the white cedar, I was the relative of the hashur cedar.
#tr.en: At that time there was a princely land among the cities;
#tr.en: Inab was this princely land among the cities.
#tr.en: The ruler of Inab was Tigi-shem-ala.
#tr.en: Now, he had a wife whose name was Shage-gur (Desired-by-the-heart);
#tr.en: and a child, who ..., 
#tr.en: and her name was ...
#tr.en: The people living around the city hung up nets;
#tr.en: the people living around Inab hung up nets,
#tr.en: hung up nets, chased gazelles;
#tr.en: killed the gazelles as one kills humans.
#tr.en: One day, as the evening came, when they had reached
#tr.en: when they have reached the place of rations,
#tr.en: they established the rations before the god ...
#tr.en: The ration of a married man was established as double;
#tr.en: the ration of a man with a child was established as triple;
#tr.en: the ration of a single man was established as single;
#tr.en: but the ration of Martu, though being single, was also established as double.
#tr.en: Martu (went home) to his own mother,
#tr.en: He entered the house before her and spoke to her:
#tr.en: "In my city I am among my friends and they all have already married wives;
#tr.en: I am there among my mates, and they all have already married wives.
#tr.en: Unlike my friends in my city I am single,
#tr.en: I am single and I have no children.
#tr.en: Yet the imposed share exceeds that of my friends;
#tr.en: over and above that of my mates, I received half of theirs."
#tr.en: One day, as the evening came, and they had reached again
#tr.en: the place of rations, when they had reached it,
#tr.en: they established the rations before the god ...
#tr.en: The ration of a married man was established as double;
#tr.en: the ration of a man with a child was established as triple;
#tr.en: the ration of a single man was established as single;
#tr.en: but the ration of Martu, though he was single, was also established as double.
#tr.en: Martu, to his own mother,
#tr.en: he entered the house before her and spoke to her
#tr.en: "My mother, find me a wife to marry and I will bring you my ration."
#tr.en: His own mother replied to Martu:
#tr.en: "Su-ḫenuna, my son, I will give you advice; may my advice be heeded.
#tr.en: I shall say a word to you; you should pay attention to it.
#tr.en: [Marry] a wife of your choice,
#tr.en: marry a wife of your heart's desire,
#tr.en: give me thus a companion, ... me a slave-girl.

#tr.en: For Numušda, because he was holy (?),

#tr.en: "Where does your silver lead? Where do your jewels lead?

#tr.en: (Adgar-kidug's girlfriend speaks to her:) "Now listen, their hands are destructive and their features are those of monkeys;
#tr.en: he is one who eats what Nanna forbids and does not show reverence.
#tr.en: They never stop roaming about ...,
#tr.en: they are an abomination to the gods' dwellings.
#tr.en: Their ideas are confused; they cause only disturbance.
#tr.en: He is clothed in sack-leather ...;
#tr.en: He lives in a tent, exposed to wind and rain, and cannot properly recite prayers.

#tr.en: He digs up truffles in the foothills, does not know how to bend the knee;
#tr.en: He eats raw flesh.
#tr.en: He has no house during his life,
#tr.en: and when he dies he will not be carried to a burial-place.

#tr.en: they cannot do; 
#tr.en: the grain of giving 
#tr.en: let my lord give; 
#tr.en: an order let him set. 
#tr.en: (Befitting) that of my servitude,

#tr.en: My lord, (befitting) that of his kingship, 
#tr.en: let him reflect, and act! 
#tr.en: From Qaṭṭunan 
#tr.en: may they not cross over! 
#tr.en: Another thing: as for my arrival 
#tr.en: to the Terqaites 
#tr.en: I made a statement in the following way, thus I: 
#tr.en: “Fields add, so that 
#tr.en: the plows of the palace I may cause to be seized (for use).” 
#tr.en: And they answered me in following way, 
#tr.en: thus they: “Once our provenience fields 
#tr.en: we seize, the field of the palace inspect and take!”

#tr.en: for 2 ploughs are not (even) sufficient.
