#tr.en: and plane trees, mountain trees, 
#tr.en: he made into planks, 
#tr.en: and in the Eninnu 
#tr.en: he set them as roof-beams for him. 
#tr.en: From Umanum, 
#tr.en: the mountain range of Menua, 
#tr.en: and from Busala, 
#tr.en: the mountain range of the Martu, 
#tr.en: big stones 
#tr.en: he brought down. 
#tr.en: Into steles 
#tr.en: he fashioned them, 
#tr.en: and in the courtyard of the Eninnu 
#tr.en: he erected them for him. 
#tr.en: From Tidanum, 
#tr.en: the mountain range of the Martu, 
#tr.en: alabaster in blocks 
#tr.en: he brought in, 
#tr.en: and into destroying lions 
#tr.en: he fashioned them, 
#tr.en: and as gate bolts 
#tr.en: he mounted them in the temple. 
#tr.en: In Abullat, 
#tr.en: the mountain range of Kimaš, 
#tr.en: he mined copper, 
#tr.en: and into the Mace Which the World Quarters Cannot Bear 
#tr.en: he fashioned it for him. 
#tr.en: From the land of Meluhha 
#tr.en: he brought down ebony, 
#tr.en: and erected(?) it for him. 
#tr.en: A block of nir-stone 
#tr.en: he brought down, 
#tr.en: and into a mace with three lion heads 
#tr.en: he fashioned it for him. 
#tr.en: Gold in its ore 
#tr.en: from the land of Hahum 
#tr.en: he brought down, 
#tr.en: and onto the mace with three lion heads 
#tr.en: he overlaid it for him. 
#tr.en: Gold in its ore 
#tr.en: from the land of Meluhha 
#tr.en: he brought down, 
#tr.en: and into a quiver 
#tr.en: he fashioned it for him. 
#tr.en: Zebus 
#tr.en: he brought down. 
#tr.en: From Gubin 
#tr.en: the land of oak(?) trees, 
#tr.en: oak(?) 
#tr.en: he brought down, 
#tr.en: and into the bird (named) Levels the Multitudes 
#tr.en: he fashioned it. 
#tr.en: From Madga, 
#tr.en: the mountain range of the ordeal river, 
#tr.en: a myriad of talents of bitumen 
#tr.en: he brought down, 
#tr.en: and in the platform of the Eninnu 
#tr.en: he used it for construction. 
#tr.en: Ha'um-clay 
#tr.en: be brought down. 
#tr.en: From the mountain range of Barme 
#tr.en: many stones 
#tr.en: into big boats 
#tr.en: he loaded, 
#tr.en: and he placed them around the base of the Eninnu. 
#tr.en: The cities of Anšan and Elam with weapons 
#tr.en: he smote, 
#tr.en: and the booty from them 
#tr.en: to Ningirsu 
#tr.en: into the Eninnu 
#tr.en: he had brought in. 
#tr.en: Gudea, 
#tr.en: the ruler 
#tr.en: of Lagash, 
#tr.en: when the Eninnu 
#tr.en: he had built for Ningirsu, 
#tr.en: he made it as a (lasting) treasure. 
#tr.en: A temple fashioned like this 
#tr.en: not a single ruler 
#tr.en: for Ningirsu 
#tr.en: had ever built. 
#tr.en: But he (Gudea) did indeed build it. 
#tr.en: He inscribed (his) name, 
#tr.en: and made (this) fitting thing come forth resplendently. 
#tr.en: To the commands 
#tr.en: of Ningirsu 
#tr.en: he set forth a faithful hand. 
#tr.en: From the land of Magan 
#tr.en: he brought down diorite 
#tr.en: and into (this) stone figure 
#tr.en: he formed it. 
#tr.en: For my master 
#tr.en: his temple 
#tr.en: I built, 
#tr.en: (so) life is my reward, 
#tr.en: (was how) he named it for him, 
#tr.en: and into the Eninnu 
#tr.en: he had it brought to him. 
#tr.en: Gudea 
#tr.en: to the statue 
#tr.en: gives (these) words: 
#tr.en: Statue, to my master 
#tr.en: do say thus: 
#tr.en: When the Eninnu, 
#tr.en: his beloved temple, 
#tr.en: I built for him, 
#tr.en: I had debts remitted and I washed all hands. 
#tr.en: For seven days no barley was ground. 
#tr.en: The slave woman was made equal with her mistress, 
#tr.en: and by the slave 
#tr.en: his master stood side by side. 
#tr.en: In my city the sexually impure with respect to him (Ningirsu) 
#tr.en: I made to go out to sleep at the edge of it. 
#tr.en: Evil to its house 
#tr.en: I made go back. 
#tr.en: To the laws 
#tr.en: of Nanše 
#tr.en: and Ningirsu 
#tr.en: I attended. 
#tr.en: An orphan I did not let be put under the control of a rich person. 
#tr.en: and a widow I did not let be put under the control of a powerful person. 
#tr.en: For an estate not having a son, 
#tr.en: a daughter of it its heir 
#tr.en: I made become. 
#tr.en: The stone statue 
#tr.en: he made receptive to messages. 
#tr.en: This statue 
#tr.en: is neither of silver, nor is it of lapis lazuli. 
#tr.en: It is neither of copper nor of tin, 
#tr.en: nor is it of bronze. 
#tr.en: No one must put it to any other use, 
#tr.en: and so it is (made only of) diorite. 
#tr.en: Let it stand at the place of libations. 
#tr.en: By an act of force 
#tr.en: let no one destroy it. 
#tr.en: O statue, before you 
#tr.en: is (standing a statue) of Ningirsu! 
#tr.en: The statue 
#tr.en: of Gudea, 
#tr.en: the ruler 
#tr.en: of Lagash, 
#tr.en: the man by whom the Eninnu 
#tr.en: of Ningirsu 
#tr.en: was built-
#tr.en: any person who from the Eninnu 
#tr.en: shall remove it, 
#tr.en: or its inscription 
#tr.en: shall erase from it, 
#tr.en: or any person who shall destroy it; 
#tr.en: at the beginning of a good year, 
#tr.en: a (future) person whom, as did my god, 
#tr.en: his (own) god 
#tr.en: Ningirsu, 
#tr.en: my master, 
#tr.en: has called to from among all the people, 
#tr.en: who (then) my judgments 
#tr.en: shall overturn, 
#tr.en: my gifts 
#tr.en: would revoke, 
#tr.en: and from my collected songs 
#tr.en: having displaced my name 
#tr.en: shall set his own name on them; 
#tr.en: who in the courtyard of Ningirsu my master 
#tr.en: shall abandon its established shrines, 
#tr.en: without having kept before his eyes 
#tr.en: that since days of old, 
#tr.en: since the seed (first) emerged, 
#tr.en: when a ruler 
#tr.en: of Lagash, 
#tr.en: the Eninnu 
#tr.en: for Ningirsu 
#tr.en: my master 
#tr.en: had built-
#tr.en: being a person who had made a fitting thing come forth resplendently-
#tr.en: his words 
#tr.en: no one shall ever alter, 
#tr.en: nor ever overturn his judgments. 
#tr.en: Therefore regarding Gudea, 
#tr.en: the ruler 
#tr.en: of Lagash, 
#tr.en: anyone who shall alter his word, 
#tr.en: or shall overturn his judgments, 
#tr.en: may An, 
#tr.en: Enlil, 
#tr.en: Ninhursaga, 
#tr.en: Enki, he of the righteous utterance, 
#tr.en: Suen, whose name no one can explain, 
#tr.en: Ningirsu, 
#tr.en: the king of weaponry, 
#tr.en: Nanše, 
#tr.en: the mistress of the boundary marker, 
#tr.en: Nindara, 
#tr.en: the king and warrior, 
#tr.en: the mother of Lagash 
#tr.en: the holy Gatumdu, 
#tr.en: Baba, 
#tr.en: the lady, the eldest daughter of An, 
#tr.en: Inanna, 
#tr.en: the lady of battle, 
#tr.en: Utu, 
#tr.en: the king of greenery, 
#tr.en: Hendursag, 
#tr.en: the herald of the nation, 
#tr.en: Igalima 
#tr.en: and Šulšagana, 
#tr.en: Ninmar, 
#tr.en: the eldest daughter of Nanše, 
#tr.en: Dumuzi'abzu, 
#tr.en: the mistress of Kinunir, 
#tr.en: and my (personal) god Ningešzida, 
#tr.en: may they all change his fate. 
#tr.en: Like an ox 
#tr.en: may he be slaughtered in his noonday (prime). 
#tr.en: Like an aurochs 
#tr.en: may he be seized by his fierce horns. 
#tr.en: May his throne which people had set up for him 
#tr.en: be made to sit out in the dust. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: to erasing this inscription 
#tr.en: he should set his mind, 
#tr.en: let his own name in the house of his god 
#tr.en: from the tablets be removed. 
#tr.en: May his own god 
#tr.en: not look upon the settled(?) people. 
#tr.en: May he hold back the rain in the sky 
#tr.en: and hold back the waters upon the earth. 
#tr.en: May years of dearth stretch out for him, 
#tr.en: and may there be famine during his reign. 
#tr.en: That person, 
#tr.en: like a man who does evil to a righteous person, 
#tr.en: may that one’s end produce a shutting(?) in heaven, 
#tr.en: and may it not be released. 
#tr.en: Of the most forceful of all the gods, 
#tr.en: of lord Ningirsu, 
#tr.en: may his greatness 
#tr.en: be known by the nation. 
#tr.en: Ningešzida 
#tr.en: is the (personal) god of Gudea, 
#tr.en: the ruler 
#tr.en: of Lagash, 
#tr.en: the man by whom the Eanna (temple) 
#tr.en: was built. 
#tr.en: For Inana, 
#tr.en: the mistress of all the lands, 
#tr.en: his mistress, 
#tr.en: Gudea, 
#tr.en: he of lasting fame, 
#tr.en: the ruler 
#tr.en: of Lagash, 
#tr.en: the man by whom the Eninnu 
#tr.en: of Ningirsu 
#tr.en: was built-
#tr.en: when Inana 
#tr.en: her eye of life 
#tr.en: she had sent out towards him, 
#tr.en: Gudea, 
#tr.en: the ruler 
#tr.en: of Lagash, 
#tr.en: being of broad intelligence 
#tr.en: and a slave by his mistress 
#tr.en: beloved, 
#tr.en: in the shed of the brick mold 
#tr.en: he made the design, 
#tr.en: and by the excavation 
#tr.en: he made the standards gleam. 
#tr.en: The clay for it on a pure place 
#tr.en: he mixed together, 
#tr.en: and the bricks for it 
#tr.en: onto a clean place 
#tr.en: he let fall out. 
#tr.en: Its foundation plot he sanctified 
#tr.en: and refined with fire. 
#tr.en: Its foundation pegs 
#tr.en: with oil of princely scent 
#tr.en: he adorned. 
#tr.en: Her beloved temple, 
#tr.en: the Eanna, in the center of Girsu 
#tr.en: he built for her. 
#tr.en: From the mountains of Magan 
#tr.en: he brought down diorite 
#tr.en: and into (this) his stone figure 
#tr.en: he formed it. 
#tr.en: Gudea, 
#tr.en: the temple builder, 
#tr.en: may his life be long! 
#tr.en: he named it for her, 
#tr.en: and into the Eanna 
#tr.en: he had it brought to her. 
#tr.en: A person who from the Eanna 
#tr.en: shall remove it, 
#tr.en: or who shall destroy it, 
#tr.en: or erase its inscription, 
#tr.en: Inana, 
#tr.en: the mistress of all the lands, 
#tr.en: his head in the assembly 
#tr.en: may she curse. 
#tr.en: The throne that he has erected, 
#tr.en: its foundations 
#tr.en: may she not keep secure. 
#tr.en: May she make his seed come to an end 
#tr.en: and cut short his reign. 
#tr.en: For Ningirsu, 
#tr.en: the mighty warrior 
#tr.en: of Enlil, 
#tr.en: his master. 
#tr.en: Gudea, 
#tr.en: ruler 
#tr.en: of Lagash, 
#tr.en: he of lasting fame, 
#tr.en: who tows the boat 
#tr.en: of Enlil, 
#tr.en: shepherd chosen by the heart 
#tr.en: of Ningirsu, 
#tr.en: the strong steward 
#tr.en: of Nanše, 
#tr.en: a man subject to the word 
#tr.en: of Baba, 
#tr.en: child born 
#tr.en: by Gatumdu, 
#tr.en: given authority and a great scepter 
#tr.en: by Igalima, 
#tr.en: broadly provided with encouragement 
#tr.en: by Šulšagana, 
#tr.en: a righteous man 
#tr.en: wbo loves his city, 
#tr.en: he made a fitting thing come forth resplendently for him, 
#tr.en: (namely) his Eninnu temple with the white eagle 
#tr.en: he built for him. 
#tr.en: In the middle of it his beloved high terrace 
#tr.en: he built for him with aromatic cedar, 
#tr.en: and his E-PA, the temple with seven corners, 
#tr.en: he built for him. 
#tr.en: Within it, the bridal gifts 
#tr.en: for Baba, 
#tr.en: his mistress, 
#tr.en: he provided in proper fashion. 
#tr.en: His beloved procession barge, 
#tr.en: Gone Forth from the Princely Quay, 
#tr.en: he constructed for him (Ningirsu), 
#tr.en: and at the Lapis Lazuli Quay of the Kasura gate 
#tr.en: he moored it for him. 
#tr.en: Its boatmen 
#tr.en: and their captain 
#tr.en: he assembled for him, 
#tr.en: and to the temple of his master 
#tr.en: he presented them. 
#tr.en: For Baba, 
#tr.en: the beautiful woman, 
#tr.en: the daughter of An, 
#tr.en: his mistress, 
#tr.en: her temple of the Holy City 
#tr.en: he built. 
#tr.en: By the power of Nanše, 
#tr.en: and by the power of Ningirsu, 
#tr.en: to Gudea, 
#tr.en: given the scepter 
#tr.en: by Ningirsu, 
#tr.en: Magan, 
#tr.en: Meluhha, 
#tr.en: Gubin, 
#tr.en: and the land Dilmun, 
#tr.en: (lands) which had produced loads of timber for him, 
#tr.en: their boats built of (these) timbers 
#tr.en: to Lagash 
#tr.en: they brought to him. 
#tr.en: From the mountain range of Magan 
#tr.en: he brought down diorite, 
#tr.en: and into (this) stone figure 
#tr.en: he formed it. 
#tr.en: The king whose heavy arm 
#tr.en: the foreign lands cannot bear, 
#tr.en: Ningirsu, 
#tr.en: for Gudea 
#tr.en: the man of the temple building, 
#tr.en: has decreed regarding him a good fate, 
#tr.en: (so) he named it, 
#tr.en: and into the Eninnu 
#tr.en: he had it brought to him. 
#tr.en: (This is a statue of) Gudea, 
#tr.en: the ruler 
#tr.en: of Lagash. 
#tr.en: For Baba, 
#tr.en: the beautiful woman, 
#tr.en: daughter of An, 
#tr.en: queen of the Holy City, 
#tr.en: lady of abundance, 
#tr.en: lady who decrees the fates in Girsu, 
#tr.en: lady who is the judge of her city, 
#tr.en: lady who loves (her) servants, 
#tr.en: lady of things that have been lost, 
#tr.en: his mistress, 
#tr.en: Gudea, 
#tr.en: ruler 
#tr.en: of Lagash, 
#tr.en: the man by whom the Eninnu (temple) 
#tr.en: of Ningirsu 
#tr.en: and the PA-house, the seven-corner house, 
#tr.en: was built-
#tr.en: When Baba, 
#tr.en: his mistress, 
#tr.en: had chosen him by her sacred heart, 
#tr.en: being a slave who reveres 
#tr.en: his mistress, 
#tr.en: the greatness of his mistress 
#tr.en: he did proclaim. 
#tr.en: To the cultic practices 
#tr.en: of Baba, 
#tr.en: his mistress, 
#tr.en: he did attend. 
#tr.en: Like the things (he had done) when the Eninnu, 
#tr.en: his beloved temple, 
#tr.en: for Ningirsu 
#tr.en: his master 
#tr.en: he had built, 
#tr.en: when for Baba, 
#tr.en: the daughter of An, 
#tr.en: the queen of the Holy City, 
#tr.en: his mistress, 
#tr.en: the Etarsirsir, 
#tr.en: her beloved temple, 
#tr.en: he built, 
#tr.en: he sanctified the city 
#tr.en: and refined it with fire. 
#tr.en: In the shed of the brick mold 
#tr.en: he drew the design. 
#tr.en: and by the excavation 
#tr.en: he made the standards gleam. 
#tr.en: The clay for it in a pure place 
#tr.en: he mixed, 
#tr.en: and its (first) brick onto a clean place 
#tr.en: he let fall out. 
#tr.en: He put bricks into the molds, 
#tr.en: and made a fitting thing come forth resplendently. 
#tr.en: He sanctified its foundation plot 
#tr.en: and refined it with fire. 
#tr.en: Its foundation pegs 
#tr.en: with oil of princely scent 
#tr.en: he adorned. 
#tr.en: For Baba, 
#tr.en: his mistress, 
#tr.en: the queen of the Holy City, 
#tr.en: she who inspires with awe, 
#tr.en: in the Holy City, 
#tr.en: on a pure place, 
#tr.en: he built the temple. 
#tr.en: Her great throne 
#tr.en: of queenship 
#tr.en: he fashioned for her, 
#tr.en: and in her place of rendering judgment 
#tr.en: he set it up for her. 
#tr.en: Her sacred treasure chest 
#tr.en: he fashioned for her, 
#tr.en: and for her Exalted House 
#tr.en: he had in brought in for her. 
#tr.en: The harp (named) The Lady Excels with An 
#tr.en: he fashioned for her, 
#tr.en: and in her exalted courtyard 
#tr.en: he set it up for her. 
#tr.en: On New Year's Day, 
#tr.en: the festival of Baba, 
#tr.en: when the bridal gifts are to be performed, 
#tr.en: 1 grain-fed ox, 
#tr.en: 1 tallow sheep, 
#tr.en: 3 grain-fed sheep, 
#tr.en: 6 rams, 
#tr.en: 2 lambs, 
#tr.en: 7 kur-measures of dates, 
#tr.en: 7 jars of butter oil, 
#tr.en: 7 hearts of palm, 
#tr.en: 7 [...] of figs, 
#tr.en: 7 baskets (of dates?) 
#tr.en: 1 [...]-bird 
#tr.en: 7 cranes 
#tr.en: 15 geese, 
#tr.en: 60 small birds 
#tr.en: whose strings are 15, 
#tr.en: 60 crates of fresh carp 
#tr.en: their strings being 30, 
#tr.en: 30 talents of turnips, 
#tr.en: 7 talents of [...]-grain 
#tr.en: 60 talents of willow sticks-
#tr.en: (all these) were the bridal gifts for Baba 
#tr.en: in the old temple 
#tr.en: of former days. 
#tr.en: Gudea, 
#tr.en: the ruler 
#tr.en: of Lagash, 
#tr.en: when for Ningirsu, 
#tr.en: his master, 
#tr.en: his beloved temple 
#tr.en: the Eninnu 
#tr.en: he had built, 
#tr.en: and for Baba, 
#tr.en: his mistress, 
#tr.en: her beloved temple 
#tr.en: the Etarsirsir 
#tr.en: he had built, 
#tr.en: 2 grain-fed oxen, 
#tr.en: 2 tallow sheep, 
#tr.en: 10 grain-fed sheep, 
#tr.en: 2 lambs, 
#tr.en: 7 kur-measures of dates 
#tr.en: 7 jars of butter oil, 
#tr.en: 7 hearts of palm, 
#tr.en: 7 [...] of figs, 
#tr.en: 7 baskets (of dates?) 
#tr.en: 14 date palm spadixes, 
#tr.en: 14 earth-baskets of cucumbers, 
#tr.en: 1 [...]-bird, 
#tr.en: 7 cranes, 
#tr.en: 15 geese, 
#tr.en: 7 [...]-birds, 
#tr.en: 60 small birds, 
#tr.en: their strings being 15, 
#tr.en: 60 crates of fresh carp,
#tr.en: their strings being 30, 
#tr.en: 40 talents of turnips, 
#tr.en: 7 talents of [...]-grain 
#tr.en: 1 talent of willow sticks, 
#tr.en: (all these) were the bridal gifts for Baba 
#tr.en: in the new temple 
#tr.en: which Gudea, 
#tr.en: the ruler 
#tr.en: of Lagash, 
#tr.en: the man of the temple building, 
#tr.en: has added to them. 
#tr.en: With the temple of Baba 
#tr.en: having been restored, 
#tr.en: with its abundance 
#tr.en: having been made to come forth resplendently, 
#tr.en: with the throne of Lagash's 
#tr.en: foundation having been made secure, 
#tr.en: with Gudea 
#tr.en: the ruler 
#tr.en: of Lagash's 
#tr.en: scepter of true words 
#tr.en: resting in his hand, 
#tr.en: and his life's 
#tr.en: days having been extended, 
#tr.en: together with his (personal) god 
#tr.en: Ningešzida 
#tr.en: to Baba 
#tr.en: into her temple of the Holy City 
#tr.en: he entered with all this to her. 
#tr.en: In the middle of that year, 
#tr.en: from the mountains of Magan 
#tr.en: he brought down diorite, 
#tr.en: and into (this) stone figure 
#tr.en: he formed it. 
#tr.en: My lady, you raised me up for it. 
#tr.en: Grant life! 
#tr.en: On the day commanded for it I did build it! 
#tr.en: (so) he named it for her, 
#tr.en: and into the temple he had it brought to her. 
#tr.en: (This) is a statue 
#tr.en: of the man by whom the temple of Baba 
#tr.en: was built. 
#tr.en: From its standing-place 
#tr.en: no one shall remove it! 
#tr.en: The regular offerings for it 
#tr.en: no one shall reduce! 
#tr.en: (This is a statue of) Gudea, 
#tr.en: the ruler 
#tr.en: of Lagash. 
#tr.en: For Gatumdu, 
#tr.en: the mother of Lagash, 
#tr.en: Gudea, 
#tr.en: the ruler 
#tr.en: of Lagash, 
#tr.en: the dog of Gatumdu, 
#tr.en: your beloved slave, 
#tr.en: the man who made a fitting thing come forth resplendently, 
#tr.en: (namely) by whom the Eninnu with the white eagle 
#tr.en: of Ningirsu 
#tr.en: was built, 
#tr.en: to whom Gatumdu, 
#tr.en: his mistress, 
#tr.en: within Lagash 
#tr.en: her beloved city, 
#tr.en: in the bright private chamber 
#tr.en: gave birth-
#tr.en: In order the temple of Gatumdu 
#tr.en: his mistress 
#tr.en: to build, 
#tr.en: he did not sleep. 
#tr.en: Gudea, 
#tr.en: the ruler 
#tr.en: of Lagash, 
#tr.en: being of broad intelligence 
#tr.en: and a slave who reveres 
#tr.en: his mistress, 
#tr.en: in the shed of the brick mold 
#tr.en: he drew the design, 
#tr.en: and by the excavation 
#tr.en: he made the standards gleam. 
#tr.en: The clay for it on a holy place 
#tr.en: he mixed, 
#tr.en: and its (first) brick on a clean place 
#tr.en: he let fall out. 
#tr.en: Its foundation plot he sanctified 
#tr.en: and refined with fire. 
#tr.en: Its foundation pegs 
#tr.en: with oil of princely scent 
#tr.en: he adorned. 
#tr.en: In the Holy City in a pure place 
#tr.en: he built the temple for her. 
#tr.en: Her great throne of queenship 
#tr.en: he fashioned for her. 
#tr.en: Her sacred treasure chest 
#tr.en: he fashioned for her. 
#tr.en: Oxen in the yokes 
#tr.en: he correctly prepared, 
#tr.en: and their ox-(driving) farmers 
#tr.en: he made follow out after them. 
#tr.en: In fine cows 
#tr.en: he made fine calves to multiply, 
#tr.en: and their cowherds 
#tr.en: he made follow after them. 
#tr.en: In fine ewes 
#tr.en: he made fine lambs to multiply, 
#tr.en: and their shepherds 
#tr.en: he made follow out after them. 
#tr.en: In fine goats 
#tr.en: he made fine kids to multiply, 
#tr.en: and their shepherds 
#tr.en: he made follow out after them. 
#tr.en: Among the jennies 
#tr.en: the swift jackasses 
#tr.en: he set free, 
#tr.en: and their herdsmen 
#tr.en: he made follow after them. 
#tr.en: Gudea, 
#tr.en: the ruler 
#tr.en: of Lagash, 
#tr.en: the dog of Gatumdu. 
#tr.en: For Ningirsu, 
#tr.en: the mighty warrior 
#tr.en: of Enlil, 
#tr.en: his master-
#tr.en: Gudea, 
#tr.en: ruler 
#tr.en: of Lagash, 
#tr.en: the man by whom the Eninnu 
#tr.en: of Ningirsu 
#tr.en: was built, 
#tr.en: for Ningirsu, 
#tr.en: his master, 
#tr.en: the PA-house, the seven-corner house, 
#tr.en: the temple whose [...] 
#tr.en: is the most excellent, 
#tr.en: and for which Ningirsu 
#tr.en: has decreed a good fate, 
#tr.en: he built for him. 
#tr.en: The bridal gifts 
#tr.en: which gladden the heart, 
#tr.en: Ningirsu, 
#tr.en: for Baba, 
#tr.en: the daughter of An, 
#tr.en: his beloved wife, 
#tr.en: he performs therein, 
#tr.en: while his (Gudea's personal) god 
#tr.en: Ningešzida 
#tr.en: followed after them. 
#tr.en: Gudea, 
#tr.en: the ruler 
#tr.en: of Lagash, 
#tr.en: from Girsu 
#tr.en: to the Holy City 
#tr.en: constantly spoke greetings. 
#tr.en: In the middle of that year, 
#tr.en: from the mountains of Magan 
#tr.en: he brought down diorite, 
#tr.en: and into (this) stone figure 
#tr.en: he formed it. 
#tr.en: When at the New Year, 
#tr.en: the festival of Baba, 
#tr.en: the bridal gifts were to be performed, 
#tr.en: 1 grain-fed ox, 
#tr.en: 1 tallow sheep, 
#tr.en: 3 grain-fed sheep, 
#tr.en: 6 rams, 
#tr.en: 2 lambs, 
#tr.en: 7 kur-measures of dates, 
#tr.en: 7 jars of butter oil,

#tr.en: 60 small birds, 
#tr.en: whose strings are 15, 
#tr.en: 60 lip(?) carp 
#tr.en: whose strings are 30, 
#tr.en: 30 talents of turnips,

#tr.en: 1 talent of willow sticks, 
#tr.en: (all these) were the bridal gifts for Baba 
#tr.en: of the old temple 
#tr.en: in former days.

#tr.en: ruler 
#tr.en: of Lagash, 
#tr.en: when for Ningirsu, 
#tr.en: his master,

#tr.en: the Eninnu

#tr.en: which Gudea, 
#tr.en: the ruler 
#tr.en: of Lagash, 
#tr.en: the man of the temple building, 
#tr.en: added to them. 
#tr.en: For Baba, 
#tr.en: the beautiful woman, 
#tr.en: the daughter of An 
#tr.en: mistress of the Holy City, 
#tr.en: lady of abundance, child of holy An, 
#tr.en: his mistress, 
#tr.en: Gudea, 
#tr.en: ruler 
#tr.en: of Lagash, 
#tr.en: when the Etarsirsir, 
#tr.en: her beloved temple, 
#tr.en: the temple of lintels(?) of the Holy City 
#tr.en: he had built for her, 
#tr.en: from the mountains of Magan 
#tr.en: he brought down diorite, 
#tr.en: and into (this) his stone figure 
#tr.en: he formed it. 
#tr.en: The lady, the beloved daughter of holy An, 
#tr.en: mother Baba, 
#tr.en: from within the Etarsirsir 
#tr.en: to Gudea 
#tr.en: she has given life, 
#tr.en: he named it for her, 
#tr.en: and into the temple of the Holy City 
#tr.en: he had it brought to her. 
#tr.en: When Ningirsu, 
#tr.en: the mighty warrior 
#tr.en: of Enlil, 
#tr.en: for Ningešzida, 
#tr.en: the son of Ninazu 
#tr.en: and the beloved of the gods, 
#tr.en: level places in the cities 
#tr.en: had established, 
#tr.en: and agricultural tracts and canals among the fields 
#tr.en: had established; 
#tr.en: and when Gudea, 
#tr.en: the ruler 
#tr.en: of Lagash, 
#tr.en: the righteous man 
#tr.en: who by his (personal) god 
#tr.en: is beloved, 
#tr.en: for Ningirsu, 
#tr.en: his master, 
#tr.en: his Eninnu (temple) with the white eagle, 
#tr.en: and his E-PA, the temple with seven corners, 
#tr.en: he had built for him, 
#tr.en: (then) for Nanše, 
#tr.en: the powerful lady, 
#tr.en: his mistress, 
#tr.en: the Sirara Temple, 
#tr.en: her mountain lifted up out of the water, 
#tr.en: he built for her, 
#tr.en: and (also) for the (other) great gods of Lagash 
#tr.en: their temples 
#tr.en: he built for them. 
#tr.en: For Ningešzida, 
#tr.en: his (personal) god, 
#tr.en: his Girsu temple 
#tr.en: he built.

#tr.en: I, Ur-Baba — 
#tr.en: for Ningirsu my master 
#tr.en: an area of [n] cubits (deep) I dug out, 
#tr.en: its earth like gems I stacked up,  
#tr.en: as if it were silver I refined it with fire, 
#tr.en: as with a seeding funnel into a wide area I brought it out, 
#tr.en: and (then) that earth into it I returned .

#tr.en: shall alter,

#tr.en: the king ...,

#tr.en: he made for him.

#tr.en: he made it.

#tr.en: in the country I did indeed establish. 
#tr.en: ...

#tr.en: Long-distance trade 
#tr.en: (independent? from) the chief sea-captains, 
#tr.en: the chief herdsmen, 
#tr.en: (independent? from) those who take cattle, take sheep, 
#tr.en: or take donkeys, 
#tr.en: and the Akkadians and foreigners 
#tr.en: in Sumer and Akkad, 
#tr.en: I returned to their own control. 
#tr.en: At that time, 
#tr.en: Umma, 
#tr.en: Marad, 
#tr.en: GIRkal, 
#tr.en: Kazallu 
#tr.en: and Maškan-pî, 
#tr.en: and Uṣarum, 
#tr.en: upon which in Anšan 
#tr.en: servitude was being imposed, 
#tr.en: by the might of Nanna 
#tr.en: my master, 
#tr.en: their freedom 
#tr.en: I established. 
#tr.en: A copper bariga vessel 
#tr.en: I set up, 
#tr.en: and as 60 sila3 I standardized it. 
#tr.en: A copper ban2 vessel I fashioned, 
#tr.en: and as 10 sila3 I standardized it. 
#tr.en: A just royal ban2 
#tr.en: I fashioned, 
#tr.en: and as 6 (ban2, in a barig measure) I standardized it. 
#tr.en: A 1 sila3 bronze (measure) 
#tr.en: I fashioned, 
#tr.en: and as 1 mina 
#tr.en: I standardized it. 
#tr.en: A 1 shekel of silver stone (weight) 
#tr.en: all the way up to a 1 mina (weight) 
#tr.en: I standardized. 
#tr.en: At that time, 
#tr.en: on the banks of the Tigris, 
#tr.en: on the banks of the Euphrates, 
#tr.en: and on the banks of all the rivers, 
#tr.en: nidba offerings, ..., 
#tr.en: and first-fruits and heart’s-desire offerings 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: I offered there. 
#tr.en: Orchards 
#tr.en: I planted there, 
#tr.en: ... (vacat) 
#tr.en: and royal gardeners had charge of them. 
#tr.en: The orphan to the rich man 
#tr.en: should not be made subordinate; 
#tr.en: the widow to the powerful man 
#tr.en: should not be made subordinate; 
#tr.en: the man of 1 shekel 
#tr.en: to the man of 1 mina 
#tr.en: should not be made subordinate; 
#tr.en: the man of 1 sheep 
#tr.en: to the man of 1 ox 
#tr.en: should not be made subordinate. 
#tr.en: All my generals, 
#tr.en: my mother, my sister(s) and brothers, 
#tr.en: and all my relatives 
#tr.en: did indeed advise me. 
#tr.en: Upon their orders 
#tr.en: I do not tread, 
#tr.en: and toil I did not set upon them. 
#tr.en: Evil, 
#tr.en: violence, 
#tr.en: and complaint I made disappear; 
#tr.en: justice 
#tr.en: I established in the country. 
#tr.en: At that time: If a man 
#tr.en: has committed murder, 
#tr.en: that man is to be killed. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: has acted like a robber, he shall be killed. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: has made someone into a captive, 
#tr.en: that man shall stay in jail 
#tr.en: and pay 15 shekels of silver. 
#tr.en: If a male slave 
#tr.en: has married a female slave whom he desires, 
#tr.en: and that male slave is set free, 
#tr.en: she may not leave the household. 
#tr.en: If a slave 
#tr.en: has married a free(d) citizen, 
#tr.en: and 1 son under his master 
#tr.en: he makes serve, 
#tr.en: the son which under his master 
#tr.en: he had to make serve: 
#tr.en: of the goods of his father’s estate 
#tr.en: 1/2 of them, and his father’s physical house he shall share. 
#tr.en: A son of a free(d) (female) citizen without a master’s agreement 
#tr.en: into one of his slaves 
#tr.en: shall not be made. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: a young man’s (prospective) wife, not yet brought into a household, 
#tr.en: has been treated deceitfully by someone, 
#tr.en: and he has brought her into (his) household, 
#tr.en: that man shall be killed. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: a young man’s (prospective) wife 
#tr.en: of her own free will 
#tr.en: has gone after another man 
#tr.en: and he has lain in her lap, 
#tr.en: and that woman 
#tr.en: is killed by the man (her fiancé), 
#tr.en: that man’s 
#tr.en: freedom 
#tr.en: shall be established. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: a man’s female slave 
#tr.en: not yet brought into a household 
#tr.en: has been seductively(?) 
#tr.en: treated by (another) man, 
#tr.en: and he has brought her into a household, 
#tr.en: that man 
#tr.en: 5 shekels of silver 
#tr.en: shall pay. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: his equal-ranking wife 
#tr.en: divorces, 
#tr.en: 1 mina of silver 
#tr.en: he shall pay. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: a (previous) widow 
#tr.en: he divorces, 
#tr.en: 1/2 mina of silver 
#tr.en: he shall pay. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: for the widow 
#tr.en: a contractual document 
#tr.en: is lacking, 
#tr.en: and the man in her lap 
#tr.en: has lain, 
#tr.en: he shall not pay any silver. 
#tr.en: ... (vacat) 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: an eriš-dingir priestess 
#tr.en: in ... a man in the lap 
#tr.en: ... has lain, 
#tr.en: but he did not know(?) it, that man 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: of witchcraft(?) 
#tr.en: one man has another man 
#tr.en: accused, 
#tr.en: and to the Ordeal River 
#tr.en: he has the man brought, 
#tr.en: and the Ordeal River 
#tr.en: has then cleared him, 
#tr.en: the man who brings him 
#tr.en: 3 shekels of silver 
#tr.en: shall pay. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: a young man’s wife 
#tr.en: of in a lap 
#tr.en: having lain 
#tr.en: a man has accused, 
#tr.en: but the River 
#tr.en: having cleared him, 
#tr.en: the man who accused her 
#tr.en: 1/3rd mina of silver 
#tr.en: shall pay. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: a son-in-law 
#tr.en: into the house of his father-in-law 
#tr.en: has entered, 
#tr.en: but the father-in-law 
#tr.en: afterwards 
#tr.en: to another man ... 
#tr.en: has given her away, 
#tr.en: the wedding gifts, 
#tr.en: twofold, 
#tr.en: he shall give to him. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: a female or male slave 
#tr.en: has escaped, 
#tr.en: and the border of her town 
#tr.en: she has crossed over, 
#tr.en: and someone has turned her in, 
#tr.en: the owner of the slave 
#tr.en: to the man who turned her in 
#tr.en: 2 shekels of silver 
#tr.en: he shall pay. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: a bone 
#tr.en: his ... 
#tr.en: a man has cut, 
#tr.en: 10 shekels of silver 
#tr.en: he shall pay. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: one man against another 
#tr.en: with a weapon 
#tr.en: his ... bone 
#tr.en: has broken, 
#tr.en: 1 mina of silver 
#tr.en: he shall pay. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: one man against another 
#tr.en: through a fistfight 
#tr.en: has cut off his nose, 
#tr.en: 2/3rd mina of silver 
#tr.en: he shall pay. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: with a ... 
#tr.en: a bone 
#tr.en: he has ..., 
#tr.en: 2 shekels of silver 
#tr.en: he shall pay. 
#tr.en: If through a fistfight 
#tr.en: one man the skull of another man 
#tr.en: has split open 
#tr.en: with something like a weapon, 1/3rd mina 
#tr.en: he shall pay. 
#tr.en: If through a fistfight 
#tr.en: one man the skull of another man 
#tr.en: has split open, 
#tr.en: he shall be beaten with 180 lashes. 
#tr.en: If someone’s eye 
#tr.en: a man makes fall out, 
#tr.en: he shall pay 1/2 mina. 
#tr.en: If a man 
#tr.en: breaks another man’s tooth, 
#tr.en: he shall pay 1/2 mina. 
#tr.en: If a slave 
#tr.en: has struck a free(d) citizen, 
#tr.en: when half his head hair has been shaved off, 
#tr.en: he shall be paraded around the town. 
#tr.en: If a free(d) citizen 
#tr.en: has beaten a slave, 
#tr.en: 60 (times) with a strap and 60 (times) with a belt 
#tr.en: he shall be beaten. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: a man has died, 
#tr.en: and his wife to her father-in-law’s (house) 
#tr.en: has gone to reside, 
#tr.en: the slaves 
#tr.en: of her legacy 
#tr.en: and the marriage gifts 
#tr.en: she may take away. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: she has no female slaves, 
#tr.en: 10 shekels of silver 
#tr.en: let her pay him. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: she has no silver, 
#tr.en: nothing 
#tr.en: shall she give to him. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: a female slave a person who as her mistress 
#tr.en: is acting 
#tr.en: has cursed, 
#tr.en: indeed 1 sila3 of salt 
#tr.en: onto her mouth 
#tr.en: shall be rubbed. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: a female slave a person who as her mistress 
#tr.en: is acting 
#tr.en: has struck, 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ... he shall pay. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: with a forearm 
#tr.en: the daughter 
#tr.en: of a man he has hit, 
#tr.en: and the thing of her womb 
#tr.en: he has caused her to miscarry, 
#tr.en: 1/2 mina of silver 
#tr.en: he shall pay. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: she has died, 
#tr.en: that man 
#tr.en: shall be killed. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: with a forearm 
#tr.en: a man’s female slave 
#tr.en: he has hit, 
#tr.en: and an ‘it-has-hurt-me’ (~miscarriage) 
#tr.en: he has done to her, 
#tr.en: 5 shekels of silver 
#tr.en: he shall pay. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: the female slave has died, 
#tr.en: ... (vacat) 
#tr.en: a slave for a slave shall serve. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: a man as a witness 
#tr.en: came forth, 
#tr.en: and a thief 
#tr.en: he was made out to be, 
#tr.en: 15 shekels of silver 
#tr.en: he shall pay. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: a man as a witness 
#tr.en: came forth, 
#tr.en: but turned away from (taking) an oath, 
#tr.en: the concern of that suit, as much as there be, 
#tr.en: he will compensate. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: a man’s field 
#tr.en: by deception 
#tr.en: another man has worked, 
#tr.en: and he has plowed it, 
#tr.en: and a trial has been held regarding it, 
#tr.en: and it was put to another’s account, 
#tr.en: that man 
#tr.en: shall be forced to forfeit his labor. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: a man’s field 
#tr.en: another man has flooded with water, 
#tr.en: per 1 iku of field 
#tr.en: 3 gur of barley 
#tr.en: he shall measure out. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: a man to another man 
#tr.en: a field for cultivation 
#tr.en: has given, 
#tr.en: but he did not plow it, 
#tr.en: and empty land 
#tr.en: he has left, 
#tr.en: per 1 iku 
#tr.en: 3 gur of barley 
#tr.en: he shall measure out. 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: a man to another man a field on irrigable land 
#tr.en: for cultivation 
#tr.en: has given, 
#tr.en: per 1 bur3 of field 2 shekels as its interest 
#tr.en: the field will generate from him. 
#tr.en: If a man has given to another man a ... field for cultivation, 
#tr.en: per ... n shekels 
#tr.en: he shall pay him. 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: If 
#tr.en: a man has hired oxen or cows for harrowing, 
#tr.en: for a 2 year’s hire of it 
#tr.en: he shall measure out to him 8 gur of barley; 
#tr.en: for the hire of oxen or cows for lead or middle (?), 
#tr.en: he shall measure out to him 6 gur of barley. 
#tr.en: If a man has died 
#tr.en: and has no sons, 
#tr.en: an umarried daughter 
#tr.en: shall become his heir. 
#tr.en: If a man has died, 
#tr.en: and his daughter ..., 
#tr.en: she shall inherit the goods of her father’s estate. 
#tr.en: A younger sister should share the inheritance of the estate, 
#tr.en: but the father’s subsistance allotments shall be shared by the (estate’s) workers. 
#tr.en: If a man has put barley into another man’s house, 
#tr.en: and that house has been broken into, 
#tr.en: when the owner of the barley has taken an oath, 
#tr.en: the owner of the house shall replace it. 
#tr.en: If a man has put barley into another man’s house, 
#tr.en: and the owner of the house has changed, 
#tr.en: after it has been verified, 
#tr.en: he shall put in for him twice as much barley as was therein. 
#tr.en: If a man has put barley into another man’s house, 
#tr.en: per 1 gur barley ... will be its nig2-diri levy. 
#tr.en: If a man who married a wife 
#tr.en: has left his wife behind, 
#tr.en: when she has stayed (waiting) 6 months for him 
#tr.en: the woman may be married by a husband of her choice. 
#tr.en: If a man married a wife, 
#tr.en: and his wife died, 
#tr.en: the man, until he remarries, 
#tr.en: his wife’s marriage gifts should be brought to him; 
#tr.en: but when the man marries a (new) wife, 
#tr.en: the marriage gifts should return to her people’s household. 
#tr.en: If a man has died, 
#tr.en: his wife, until she remarries, 
#tr.en: the house ... 
#tr.en: in/of her ... will not be put. 
#tr.en: If the father has died, 
#tr.en: ... of his sons 
#tr.en: will be ...; 
#tr.en: ... the physical house is the elder brother’s. 
#tr.en: If an ox has been lost in its cattle pen, 
#tr.en: the cowherds 
#tr.en: shall replace it. 
#tr.en: If a sheep has been lost in its sheepfold, 
#tr.en: the shepherds 
#tr.en: shall replace it. 
#tr.en: If an ox, a sheep, a donkey, or a pig has been lost among the houses or in a well-pit of a city, 
#tr.en: the district (authorities) 
#tr.en: shall replace it. 
#tr.en: If a man has not lost anything, 
#tr.en: but he has declared: “I have lost something of mine;” 
#tr.en: when by the district 
#tr.en: it has been proved, 
#tr.en: that man shall be killed; 
#tr.en: the district shall take away his inheritance. 
#tr.en: The nig2-diri levy for 1 stolen ox is 1 barig; 
#tr.en: the nig-diri levy for 1 stolen donkey is 3 ban2; 
#tr.en: the nig-diri levy for 1 stolen sheep is 1 ban2, (due) at the new year. 
#tr.en: If a man takes another man to court, 
#tr.en: after he has made him proceed through (court) appearances regarding it for the 3rd time, the suit shall be ended. 
#tr.en: If in winter 
#tr.en: a man has hired a 60-gur boat, 
#tr.en: its nig2-diri levy will be 1 ban2, 
#tr.en: its hire rate for 1 day will be (blank). 
#tr.en: If a man has hired a 60-gur boat: for 30 double-miles, its nig2-diri levy will be 3 ban2 per 1 gur; 
#tr.en: for 20 double-miles its nig2-diri levy will be 2 ban2 per 1 gur; 
#tr.en: for 10 double-miles the nig2-diri levy will be 1 ban2 per 1 gur. 
#tr.en: It is of barley; its silver is 1/3rd shekel. 
#tr.en: 1 day’s wages of a house-builder will be 3 ban2. 
#tr.en: For a carpenter, leatherworker, reed-mat maker, felt maker, metalsmith, fuller, goldsmith, or stone-cutter, 
#tr.en: their harvest-time wages will be 3 ban2 each; 
#tr.en: their winter ones will be 2 ban2 each. 
#tr.en: The barley for 3 ...-pots will be 1 ban2; 
#tr.en: the barley for 1 kurdu pot will be 1 ban2; 
#tr.en: for 1 lahtan pot of 1 gur (capacity) it will be 3 ban2; 
#tr.en: the barley for 1 oven will be 5 sila3. 
#tr.en: If a man has broken a leg bone, 
#tr.en: and a physician has made him well, 
#tr.en: the silver for that will be 5 shekels. 
#tr.en: If a man has been mauled by a lion, 
#tr.en: and a physician has made him well, 
#tr.en: the silver for that will be 5 shekels. 
#tr.en: If a physician has taken out a ‘stone,’ 
#tr.en: the silver for that will be 5 shekels. 
#tr.en: If a physician has healed the eyesight, 
#tr.en: the silver for that will be 2 shekels. 
#tr.en: If a physician ... a man, 
#tr.en: the silver for that will be n shekels. 
#tr.en: The harvest-time wages of a ... will be 3 ban2; 
#tr.en: his winter ones will be 2 ban2. 
#tr.en: The harvest-time wages of the ... persons will be 1 ban2; the nig2-diri levy will be 1 barig; 
#tr.en: their winter ones will be ... and ... will be the nig2-diri levy. 
#tr.en: The daily wages of a female weaver when washing (fibers) will be n ban2; 
#tr.en: the daily wages of a senior female weaver will be 2 ban2; 
#tr.en: the daily wages of a female weaver of šudur-garments will be 2 ban2. 
#tr.en: The wages of the ... persons will be 6 sila3 of barley. 
#tr.en: The wages of the doorman’s helpers ... will be 1 sila3 of barley. 
#tr.en: If a female tavern-keeper in the harvest season 
#tr.en: has given 1 beer-jar to a person on credit, 
#tr.en: at the harvest season 5 ban2 of barley ..., 
#tr.en: and its nig2-diri levy will be ...; 
#tr.en: the winter’s will be ... 
#tr.en: If a man to another man 
#tr.en: has given 1 gur of barley as a loan, 
#tr.en: its interest for 1 year shall be 1 barig and 4 ban2 of barley. 
#tr.en: If a man to another man 
#tr.en: has given 10 shekels of silver as a loan, 
#tr.en: its interest for 1 year shall be 2 shekels. 
#tr.en: If a man to another man ..., 
#tr.en: and a robber in the house ..., 
#tr.en: a robber in the house ..., 
#tr.en: he need not replace it. 
#tr.en: If a person has fed another person’s child milk, 
#tr.en: for 3 years her barley shall be 6 gur, 
#tr.en: her wool 30 minas, 
#tr.en: and her oil 30 sila3; 
#tr.en: it is a thing of the office of the nugig-women. 
#tr.en: The fee per year of a hired wet-nurse shall be 1 shekel. 
#tr.en: If, during the term of Gutium, 
#tr.en: a man sold a slave, 
#tr.en: but that slave someone detained, 
#tr.en: when the owner of the slave has taken an oath, 
#tr.en: he may take away the slave. 
#tr.en: If the man who did the selling has died, 
#tr.en: (only) when that man’s wife, or his son, or his witness 
#tr.en: has taken an oath 
#tr.en: may he take away the slave. 
#tr.en: During the reign of Ur-Namma, the king of the nig2-diri levy, 
#tr.en: after he had been elevated by Nanna over the people, 
#tr.en: at that time, if the man who had sold the slave 
#tr.en: be he the slave’s owner or ..., 
#tr.en: or be he its ..., the (relevant) ginabtum-officer 
#tr.en: if he has not brought in, 
#tr.en: that man is a thief. 
#tr.en: If a man has died, his equal-ranking wife should act as the 1st heir in the house. 
#tr.en: If a man marries the wife of his older brother, 
#tr.en: he shall be killed. 
#tr.en: If a slave marries his female owner, he shall be killed. 
#tr.en: If a man ... another man, 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ... which is equivalent to the house ... 
#tr.en: If a man has bought 1 sar of a built house, 
#tr.en: its silver shall be n shekels. 
#tr.en: If a vacant lot of 1 sar 
#tr.en: a man has bought, its silver shall be 1 shekel. 
#tr.en: If 1 sar of a built house 
#tr.en: a man has rented for ..., he shall pay 1 shekel of silver. 
#tr.en: A person who erases this inscription and writes his own name on it, 
#tr.en: or because of this curse he incites another to do it, 
#tr.en: and the person who erases this inscription and has written for him a name which should not be written, 
#tr.en: whether that person be a king, or an en, or a governor, ..., 
#tr.en: may he who was seated on a throne sit down in the dust. 
#tr.en: May his people roam about among reed huts(?).

#tr.en: whose name is Nanna the Canal Inspector, 
#tr.en: which is the boundary canal, 
#tr.en: he dug. 
#tr.en: Its mouth he extended into the sea. 
#tr.en: By a rightful decision 
#tr.en: of Utu, 
#tr.en: he chose it 
#tr.en: and confirmed it. 
#tr.en: A person who 
#tr.en: to Nanna 
#tr.en: has become hostile, 
#tr.en: whether he be a king 
#tr.en: or whether he be a governor, 
#tr.en: as a person cursed 
#tr.en: by Nanna 
#tr.en: may he become. 
#tr.en: Within the residence of Nanna 
#tr.en: may he be defiled. 
#tr.en: May his city out among the reed huts(?) 
#tr.en: roam around.

#tr.en: indeed be.

#tr.en: For Ningal, 
#tr.en: his mistress, 
#tr.en: Šulgi, 
#tr.en: the mighty man, 
#tr.en: king of Ur 
#tr.en: and king of the four world quarters. 
#tr.en: Enlil, ... towards the east, 
#tr.en: great north-wind of the Anunna gods ..., 
#tr.en: (for) Šulgi, the serpent bearing fearsomeness ..., 
#tr.en: for the king, whom he had wrought, he ... the eye. 
#tr.en: Very great strength he ... 
#tr.en: His noise ... heaven and earth, 
#tr.en: (in) the Ekur temple, a fierce snake which ... divine power, 
#tr.en: (in) Duranki a joy (where) the ancient divine attributes ..., 
#tr.en: within the brickwork founded by the prince, whose young shoot's days are prolonged, 
#tr.en: for Šulgi, born for a prosperous reign, from the womb on he was destined for greatness. 
#tr.en: Unifier of the people, 
#tr.en: (you) who unto distant (time) is king of multitudes! 
#tr.en: A runner, a tempestuous storm, whose loins keep going, 
#tr.en: a runner who leaves behind all the settlements, 
#tr.en: a frightening force, fiercest of all racers, 
#tr.en: chosen from all the people, their strength, who ... the head. 
#tr.en: when (his) tall arms are spread wide, toward his back ... 
#tr.en: Šulgi, whose speeding has been repeatedly set(? from the horizon(?), 
#tr.en: Because of his great strength, in his arms ever-expanding(?) ..., 
#tr.en: tirelessly traveling powerfully(?) upon the road. 
#tr.en: Among the Black Headed People no king had dared so much; he reached a great decision. 
#tr.en: On a day that broke joyously, with clouds set for rain, 
#tr.en: from the Ki'ur terrace of Nippur he decided to run 
#tr.en: to the shrine of Ur, the Etemenniguru. 
#tr.en: For Nanna in the morning dining hall where stood his princely bowl he provided the fitting regular offerings. 
#tr.en: On this day he determined abundance as its fate. 
#tr.en: A storm wind from the south(?), a whirlwind, broke out. 
#tr.en: The sun dipped low in parallel, 
#tr.en: but he arrived(?) back at the lapis lazuli Ekur. 
#tr.en: That heroes for (future) lifetimes 
#tr.en: would reveal in praise the very great magnificence of Šulgi, 
#tr.en: his statue of distant days and eternal fame, 
#tr.en: like the heavenly stars he colored it, 
#tr.en: and by exalted father Enlil, him with unalterable verdicts, 
#tr.en: with his good eyes, filled with delight, (clothed) with a princely garment, he set it up.

#tr.en: for when the boat is taken to the outer district, 
#tr.en: these requisitions were owed to no person.

#tr.en: the Dublamah,
#tr.en: since ancient days
#tr.en: though not an offering(?) place   
#tr.en: where daily rations had been withdrawn   
#tr.en: having become,   
#tr.en: since its temple had not been rebuilt 
#tr.en: Amar-Suena, 
#tr.en: beloved by Nanna, 
#tr.en: whom, in Nippur, 
#tr.en: Enlil 
#tr.en: chose by name, 
#tr.en: the constant supporter 
#tr.en: of the temple of Enlil, 
#tr.en: the mighty man, 
#tr.en: king of Ur 
#tr.en: and king of the four world quarters, 
#tr.en: the Dublamah, 
#tr.en: the temple which is the wonder of the country, 
#tr.en: his place of judgment, 
#tr.en: where from his net 
#tr.en: the enemies 
#tr.en: of Amar-Suena 
#tr.en: do not escape, 
#tr.en: that temple he rebuilt 
#tr.en: and made resplendent for him. 
#tr.en: With gold, silver and lapis lazuli 
#tr.en: he decorated it for him. 
#tr.en: Amar-Suen 
#tr.en: shall therewith prolong his life. 
#tr.en: A person who, when the temple has become old, 
#tr.en: having rebuilt it, 
#tr.en: but this inscription  
#tr.en: and its utensils  
#tr.en: from its standing-place 
#tr.en: does not change,  
#tr.en: in the eyes of Nanna 
#tr.en: may he find favor. 
#tr.en: But a person who this inscription 
#tr.en: shall erase 
#tr.en: and its utensils 
#tr.en: to its standing-place 
#tr.en: shall not return, 
#tr.en: may the serpent of Nanna 
#tr.en: be set upon him,  
#tr.en: and to his descendants  
#tr.en: may Nanna 
#tr.en: make an end. 
#tr.en: Amar-Suena, 
#tr.en: whom in Nippur 
#tr.en: Enlil 
#tr.en: chose by name, 
#tr.en: the constant supporter 
#tr.en: of the temple of Enlil,

#tr.en: and king of the four world quarters - 
#tr.en: of this statue: 
#tr.en: Amar-Suena is the Beloved of Ur
#tr.en: is its name. 
#tr.en: Of this statue, 
#tr.en: a person who its standing-place 
#tr.en: shall change, 
#tr.en: and its socle 
#tr.en: shall rip out, 
#tr.en: may Nanna

#tr.en: and Ningal 
#tr.en: the mother of Ur 
#tr.en: curse him,  
#tr.en: and his seed 
#tr.en: may they bring to an end.

#tr.en: Copy of a baked brick 
#tr.en: from the debris of Ur, 
#tr.en: the work of Amar-Suena the king of Ur, 
#tr.en: which, while searching for the ground-plans 
#tr.en: of the Egišznugal, Sîn-balāssu-iqbi, 
#tr.en: the viceroy of Ur, found.

#tr.en: Of my statue: 
#tr.en: if off its standing place 
#tr.en: one removes it, 
#tr.en: and a stone statue of himself

#tr.en: or he who my handiwork

#tr.en: king of all the lands,

#tr.en: When Enlil 
#tr.en: life

#tr.en: with a secure foundation,

#tr.en: all is created,

#tr.en: with their war and battle

#tr.en: Šū-Sîn, 
#tr.en: the mighty king, 
#tr.en: king of Ur 
#tr.en: and king of the four world quarters, 
#tr.en: by the power of Enlil 
#tr.en: his master, 
#tr.en: and by the command of Ninlil, 
#tr.en: his beloved mistress, 
#tr.en: in those wars and battles 
#tr.en: he was repeatedly victorious. 
#tr.en: Their head warriors 
#tr.en: he mowed down. 
#tr.en: Their runners 
#tr.en: he weakened(?). 
#tr.en: Their strong and weak 
#tr.en: he killed like dogs. 
#tr.en: The heads of their righteous and treacherous ones (alike) 
#tr.en: he strewed like seeds. 
#tr.en: Their human corpses 
#tr.en: he piled up like sheaves. 
#tr.en: All their lords and enthroned ones 
#tr.en: he took into capitivity. 
#tr.en: All the great governors 
#tr.en: of the territories 
#tr.en: of Zabšali 
#tr.en: and 
#tr.en: all the governors 
#tr.en: of the cites 
#tr.en: whom he had brought back from the wars, 
#tr.en: their governors and enthroned ones 
#tr.en: when he had taken them prisoner, 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: before Enlil 
#tr.en: and Ninlil 
#tr.en: he did ... 
#tr.en: The young men 
#tr.en: who from the grasp of battle 
#tr.en: had fallen out, 
#tr.en: and to their cities 
#tr.en: like (fleeing) birds had saved their lives, 
#tr.en: did not escape his hand. 
#tr.en: Towards their cities 
#tr.en: like an Anzu-eagle he himself 
#tr.en: screeched. 
#tr.en: Their settled cities and towns 
#tr.en: he made into ruined mounds, 
#tr.en: and their walls 
#tr.en: he demolished. 
#tr.en: The young men of their cities 
#tr.en: which he had conquered 
#tr.en: he removed their eyes, 
#tr.en: and in the orchards of Enlil 
#tr.en: and Ninlil 
#tr.en: and 
#tr.en: in the orchards of the great gods 
#tr.en: he made them into domestic servants. 
#tr.en: Further, the young women 
#tr.en: of those cities 
#tr.en: which he had conquered 
#tr.en: in the weaving-houses 
#tr.en: of Enlil 
#tr.en: and Ninlil 
#tr.en: and 
#tr.en: the temples of the great gods 
#tr.en: he offered as gifts. 
#tr.en: Their cattle, sheep, goats and donkeys 
#tr.en: which he brought in 
#tr.en: and in the temples of Enlil 
#tr.en: and Ninlil 
#tr.en: and 
#tr.en: the temples of the great gods 
#tr.en: he sacrificed them. 
#tr.en: Gold and silver 
#tr.en: and things fashioned (from them) 
#tr.en: into big sacks 
#tr.en: he filled. 
#tr.en: Copper, 
#tr.en: and tin, 
#tr.en: bronze, 
#tr.en: and things fashioned from them 
#tr.en: he tied onto the backs of donkeys, 
#tr.en: and for the temples of Enlil, 
#tr.en: Ninlil, 
#tr.en: and 
#tr.en: the temples of the great gods 
#tr.en: into treasures 
#tr.en: he made them. 
#tr.en: Šū-Sîn, 
#tr.en: the king nominated by An, 
#tr.en: given supreme power 
#tr.en: by Enlil, 
#tr.en: that from this day foreward 
#tr.en: the praise of them 
#tr.en: should not fall from the lips, 
#tr.en: but should (rather) be handed down - 
#tr.en: Bulma, 
#tr.en: in the land of Šimaški, 
#tr.en: like ... 
#tr.en: he cast down. 
#tr.en: The population, 
#tr.en: females and males, 
#tr.en: those living beings having names 
#tr.en: he ... with weapons. 
#tr.en: He having revealed it to ... 
#tr.en: for the ... 
#tr.en: that his might 
#tr.en: and power 
#tr.en: shall unto distant times 
#tr.en: not be erased, 
#tr.en: he ... it to their farthest reaches(?). 
#tr.en: ... Habūra 
#tr.en: and 
#tr.en: Mardama 
#tr.en: Šū-Sîn, 
#tr.en: the king and shepherd of the Black-Headed Folk 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: he raised there 
#tr.en: and covered them with the garment of it. 
#tr.en: Gold and silver 
#tr.en: to mine 
#tr.en: he set them (to work). 
#tr.en: At that time, 
#tr.en: Šū-Sîn,

#tr.en: his master, 
#tr.en: for his life 
#tr.en: he dedicated it.

#tr.en: shall issue against it,

#tr.en: shall erase

#tr.en: Enbi-Ištar, 
#tr.en: the king of Kiš, 
#tr.en: he captured.
#tr.en: This statue,
#tr.en: its silver and lapis lazuli 
#tr.en: Envoys of Aga, the son of Enmebaragesi, 
#tr.en: from Kish to Gilgamesh in Uruk came. 
#tr.en: Gilgamesh before the elders of his city, 
#tr.en: presented the issue, carefully choosing his words: 
#tr.en: There are wells to be finished, wells of the Land yet to be finished; 
#tr.en: there are shallow wells of the Land yet to be finished, 
#tr.en: there are wells to deepen and hoisting gear to be completed. 
#tr.en: To the house of Kish We should not submit! Should we not smite it with weapons? 
#tr.en: In the convened assembly, the elders of his city 
#tr.en: answer Gilgamesh: 
#tr.en: “There are indeed wells to be finished, wells of the Land yet to be finished; 
#tr.en: there are shallow wells of the Land yet to be finished, 
#tr.en: there are wells to deepen and hoisting gear to be completed. 
#tr.en: So we should submit to the house of Kish. We should not smite it with weapons! 
#tr.en: Gilgamesh, the lord of Kulaba, 
#tr.en: in Inanna placing his trust 
#tr.en: the advice of the elders of his city did not take seriously. 
#tr.en: a second time Gilgamesh before the able-bodied men of his city 
#tr.en: presented the issue, carefully choosing his words: 
#tr.en: “There are wells to be finished, wells of the Land yet to be finished; 
#tr.en: there are shallow wells of the Land yet to be finished, 
#tr.en: there are wells to deepen and hoisting gear to be completed. 
#tr.en: Never before have you submitted to the house of Kish. Should you not smite it with weapons? 
#tr.en: In the convened assembly, the able-bodied men of his city answer Gilgamesh: 
#tr.en: “Standing on duty and sitting in attendance, 
#tr.en: the son of the king escorting, 
#tr.en: the reins of the donkey always grasping, 
#tr.en: who has the breath?,” as the saying goes. 
#tr.en: To the house of Kish you all should not submit! With weapons should we not smite it?” 
#tr.en: “The structure of Uruk, the handiwork of the gods, 
#tr.en: and of Eanna, the house from heaven lowered down, 
#tr.en: the great gods created. 
#tr.en: The great wall, the wall which An founded, 
#tr.en: the majestic residence which An established, 
#tr.en: you watch over. You are its king and warrior, 
#tr.en: an exuberant person, a prince by An beloved. 
#tr.en: When Aga comes, what terror he will experience! 
#tr.en: That army is small, at the rear scattered. 
#tr.en: Its men will be incapable of confronting us.” 
#tr.en: Then Gilgamesh, the lord of Kulaba, 
#tr.en: at the advice of the able-bodied men of his city rejoiced and his spirit brightened. 
#tr.en: His servant Enkidu he addressed: 
#tr.en: “On this account let the weaponry and arms of battle be made ready. 
#tr.en: Let the battle mace to your side return. 
#tr.en: A great terror and radiance may they create. 
#tr.en: When he comes, my great fearsomeness will overwhelm him. 
#tr.en: His reasoning will become confused, his judgment disarrayed.” 
#tr.en: Not 5 days, not 10 days had passed 
#tr.en: when Aga, the son of Enmebaragesi, to Uruk with his men laid siege . 
#tr.en: Uruk’s reasoning became confused. 
#tr.en: Gilgamesh, the lord of Kulaba, 
#tr.en: to its warriors speaks: 
#tr.en: “My warriors shall have the choice. 
#tr.en: Let someone with courage rise up, “I shall go against Aga” 
#tr.en: Birḫurtura, his royal guard, 
#tr.en: in admiration to his king says: 
#tr.en: I shall go against Aga. 
#tr.en: so that his reasoning will become confused, his judgment disarrayed.” 
#tr.en: Birḫurtura through the city gate went out. 
#tr.en: As soon as Birḫurtura went out through the city gate, 
#tr.en: at the gate of the city gate they captured him, 
#tr.en: Birḫurtura’s entire length beating. 
#tr.en: Into the presence of Aga he came 
#tr.en: speaking to Aga. 
#tr.en: His words were not done, a “mirror-holder” of Uruk, on the wall climbing up, 
#tr.en: out over the wall leaned. 
#tr.en: Aga trained his eyes, 
#tr.en: to Birḫurtura speaking: 
#tr.en: “Slave, is that man your king?” 
#tr.en: “That man is not my king! 
#tr.en: Were that man my king, 
#tr.en: were that his angry brow, 
#tr.en: were those his bison eyes, 
#tr.en: were that his lapis lazuli beard, 
#tr.en: were those his elegant fingers, 
#tr.en: would he not cast down multitudes? Would he not raise up multitudes? 
#tr.en: Would multitudes not be smeared with dust? 
#tr.en: Would not all the nations be overwhelmed? 
#tr.en: Would not the (canal-)mouths of the land be filled with silt? 
#tr.en: Would not the horns of the barges be broken? 
#tr.en: Would he not take captive Aga, the king of Kish, in the midst of his army?” 
#tr.en: Hitting him, striking him, 
#tr.en: Birḫurtura’s entire length they were beating. 
#tr.en: After the “mirror-holder” of Uruk, Gilgamesh climbs up on the wall. 
#tr.en: the young and old of Kulaba his radiance overwhelms. 
#tr.en: The able-bodied men of Uruk with battle maces he armed, 
#tr.en: on the causeway at the door of the city gate stationed. 
#tr.en: Enkidu through the city gate alone went out. 
#tr.en: Gilgamesh out over the wall leaned. 
#tr.en: Looking up, Aga opened his eyes: 
#tr.en: “Slave, is that man your king?” 
#tr.en: “That man is indeed my king.” 
#tr.en: It was just as he had said: 
#tr.en: Multitudes fell, multitudes rose up, 
#tr.en: multitudes with dust were smeared, 
#tr.en: all the nations were overwhelmed, 
#tr.en: the (canal-)mouths of the land with silt were filled, 
#tr.en: the horns of the barges were broken, 
#tr.en: Aga, the king of Kish, in the midst of his army he took captive 
#tr.en: Gilgamesh, the lord of Kulaba, 
#tr.en: to Aga speaks: 
#tr.en: “Aga my foreman, Aga my lieutenant, 
#tr.en: Aga my commander of the troops! 
#tr.en: Aga gave me breath, Aga gave me life: 
#tr.en: Aga a fugitive into his embrace took, 
#tr.en: Aga the fleeing bird with grain provided.” 
#tr.en: “Uruk, the handiwork of the gods, 
#tr.en: the great wall, the wall which An founded, 
#tr.en: the majestic residence which An established, 
#tr.en: you watch over. You are its king and warrior, 
#tr.en: an exuberant person, a prince beloved of An.” 
#tr.en: “Before Utu, your former kindness is hereby repaid to you.” 
#tr.en: Aga to Kish he set free. 
#tr.en: As to Gilgamesh, lord of Kulaba, 
#tr.en: your praise is sweet. 
#tr.en: Enlil! Gutium, 
#tr.en: the fanged snake of the mountain ranges, 
#tr.en: a people who acted violently against the gods, 
#tr.en: people who the kingship 
#tr.en: of Sumer 
#tr.en: to the mountains took away, 
#tr.en: who Sumer 
#tr.en: with wickedness filled, 
#tr.en: who from one with a wife his wife 
#tr.en: took away from him, 
#tr.en: who from one with a child his child 
#tr.en: took away from him, 
#tr.en: who wickedness and violence 
#tr.en: produced within the country— 
#tr.en: Enlil, the king of all the lands, 
#tr.en: to obliterate its name, 
#tr.en: Utuḫegal, 
#tr.en: the mighty man, 
#tr.en: the king of Uruk, 
#tr.en: the king of the four world quarters, 
#tr.en: the king whose utterances cannot be countermanded, 
#tr.en: Enlil, the king of all the lands, 
#tr.en: issued to him a command about this. 
#tr.en: To Inanna his lady 
#tr.en: he went 
#tr.en: and prayed to her, (saying) 
#tr.en: “My lady, lioness of battle, 
#tr.en: who the foreign lands batters, 
#tr.en: Enlil, the kingship of Sumer 
#tr.en: to return to its own control 
#tr.en: he commanded me. 
#tr.en: May you be my ally.” 
#tr.en: An army of many foreigners 
#tr.en: bore down upon the land everywhere. 
#tr.en: Tirigan, 
#tr.en: the king of Gutium, 
#tr.en: opened its (canal?) mouths, 
#tr.en: but no one came out against him. 
#tr.en: Both banks of the Tigris 
#tr.en: he had seized. 
#tr.en: To the south, in Sumer, 
#tr.en: the cultivated land he tied up, 
#tr.en: to the north, the roads he tied up. 
#tr.en: On the highways of the country 
#tr.en: he made tall grasses grow. 
#tr.en: But the king to whom Enlil 
#tr.en: had given power, 
#tr.en: whom Inanna by (her own) heart had chosen, 
#tr.en: Utuḫegal, the mighty man, 
#tr.en: from Uruk went out against him. 
#tr.en: In the temple of Iškur 
#tr.en: he made an offering. 
#tr.en: To the citizens of his city 
#tr.en: he was calling out, (saying) 
#tr.en: “Gutium 
#tr.en: Enlil has given to me. 
#tr.en: My mistress Inanna 
#tr.en: is my ally. 
#tr.en: Dumuzi-Ama’ušumgalana 
#tr.en: has declared ‛It is something that concerns me,’ 
#tr.en: and Gilgameš, 
#tr.en: the son of Ninsun, 
#tr.en: as bailiff he has given to me.” 
#tr.en: The citizens of Uruk 
#tr.en: and the citizens of Kullab 
#tr.en: he caused to rejoice at this. 
#tr.en: His city, as one man, 
#tr.en: followed after him. 
#tr.en: The military contingents and scouts 
#tr.en: he put in good order. 
#tr.en: After having departed from the temple of Iškur, 
#tr.en: on the 4th day in Nagsu on the Enurigal canal 
#tr.en: he made an offering. 
#tr.en: On the 5th day at Bara-Ilitappe 
#tr.en: he made an offering. 
#tr.en: Ur-Ninazu 
#tr.en: and Nabi-Enlil, 
#tr.en: generals of Tirigan 
#tr.en: who to Sumer as envoys 
#tr.en: had been sent, 
#tr.en: he captured and put fetters on their hands. 
#tr.en: Having departed from Bara-Ilitappe, 
#tr.en: on the 6th day at Karkar 
#tr.en: he made an offering. 
#tr.en: He went in to Iškur 
#tr.en: and prayed to him. 
#tr.en: “O Iškur, Enlil has given me the weapons, 
#tr.en: may you be my ally.” 
#tr.en: In the middle of that night he arose, 
#tr.en: and north of Adab, 
#tr.en: when Utu had risen, 
#tr.en: he went 
#tr.en: and prayed to him, (saying) 
#tr.en: “O Utu, Gutium 
#tr.en: Enlil has given to me, 
#tr.en: may you be my ally.” 
#tr.en: At that place, (just) beyond Gutium, 
#tr.en: he laid a trap(?) for him, 
#tr.en: and the troops he drove to him. 
#tr.en: Utuḫegal, the mighty man, 
#tr.en: defeated 
#tr.en: their generals. Whereupon, Tirigan, 
#tr.en: king of Gutium, 
#tr.en: fled all alone from there. 
#tr.en: The place where to save his life 
#tr.en: he had fled, 
#tr.en: in Dabrum, they (at first) were good to him. 
#tr.en: (But) the people of Dabrum, 
#tr.en: Utuḫegal, 
#tr.en: because, he a king to whom Enlil had given power 
#tr.en: he was, they had realized, 
#tr.en: Tirigan 
#tr.en: they did not let go. 
#tr.en: By the envoys of Utuḫegal 
#tr.en: Tirigan 
#tr.en: and his wife and children 
#tr.en: in Dabrum were captured. 
#tr.en: They placed fetters on his hands  
#tr.en: and put a cloth (blindfold) over his eyes. 
#tr.en: Utuḫegal before Utu 
#tr.en: made him lie at his (Utu’s) feet, 
#tr.en: and on his neck he set his foot. 
#tr.en: Gutium, the fanged snake of the mountain ranges, 
#tr.en: he made drink from the cracks in the earth. 
#tr.en: At ... 
#tr.en: he made an offering. 
#tr.en: The tow-boats he dispatched from its borders, 
#tr.en: and the kingship of Sumer to its control he returned. 
#tr.en: Artaxerxes, the king. 
#tr.en: Artaxerxes, the king. 
#tr.en: Artaxerxes, the king. 
#tr.en: Artaxerxes, the king. 
#tr.en: (Property) of Bēl-ušallim, 
#tr.en: offspring of Dābibi the exorcist.
#tr.en: 5 sila3 of beer, 3 sila3 of bread, 5 shekels of leeks, 3 shekels of oil, 2 shekels of potash, 
#tr.en: (to) Puzur-Mama; 
#tr.en: 5 sila3 of beer, 3 sila3 of bread, 5 shekels of leeks, 3 shekels of oil, 2 shekels of potash,

#tr.en: 2 ban2 of beer, 2 ban2 of bread, 1/3 sila3 of oil, (to) Idissu; 
#tr.en: 3 ban2 of beer, the jug of fine-quality sweet wort (containing) 2 ban2, 7 jugs of sweet wort, normal quality (containing) 3 ban2; 
#tr.en: 2 ban2 of fine-quality pea-flour, 4 barig 4 ban2 of semolina, 2 sila3 of oil 
#tr.en: (for) the messengers that have come from Ḫuḫnuri. 
#tr.en: Total: 1 barig 2 ban2 9 sila3 of beer, 1 jug of fine-quality sweet wort (of the strength:) 2 ban2 (barley per jug), 7 jugs of regular-quality sweet wort (of the strength:) 3 ban2 (barley per jug); 
#tr.en: total: 4 ban2 4 sila3 of bread, 2 ban2 of fine-quality pea-flour, 4 barig 4 ban2 of semolina; 
#tr.en: total: 2/3 sila3 5 shekels of leeks; total: 2 2/3 sila3 7 shekels of oil; 
#tr.en: total: 18 shekels of potash. 
#tr.en: 2nd day, 
#tr.en: month: “pa’u’e,” 
#tr.en: year: “Simanum was destroyed.” 
#tr.en: For Enlil, 
#tr.en: king of all the lands, 
#tr.en: his master, 
#tr.en: Išbi-Erra, 
#tr.en: the mighty king, 
#tr.en: king of his country, 
#tr.en: a great harp 
#tr.en: which ... the heart, 
#tr.en: he had constructed for him, 
#tr.en: and for his life  
#tr.en: he dedicated it to him. 
#tr.en: That harp - 
#tr.en: 'Išbi-Erra 
#tr.en: trusts in Enlil' 
#tr.en: is its name. 
#tr.en: For Nanna, 
#tr.en: exalted proud one
#tr.en: of the Anuna gods,
#tr.en: his master,
#tr.en: Šu-ilišu,
#tr.en: the mighty man,
#tr.en: king of Ur,
#tr.en: when Nanna
#tr.en: from Anšan
#tr.en: to Ur
#tr.en: he brought,
#tr.en: the Dublamah (gate structure)
#tr.en: his place of judgment,
#tr.en: he built for him,
#tr.en: and a door decorated colorfully with lyres
#tr.en: he set up for him,
#tr.en: and for his life
#tr.en: he dedicated it to him.

#tr.en: against it shall issue
#tr.en: and into a storehouse
#tr.en: shall have it brought,
#tr.en: or because of this curse
#tr.en: another person
#tr.en: he shall incite for this,
#tr.en: that person
#tr.en: may Nanna

#tr.en: sovereign in heaven and earth,

#tr.en: of Enlil,
#tr.en: lord who alone over heaven and earth
#tr.en: surpasses all gods,
#tr.en: his master,
#tr.en: Šu-ilišu,
#tr.en: god of his country,
#tr.en: strong king,
#tr.en: king of Ur, 
#tr.en: beloved by An,
#tr.en: Enlil 
#tr.en: and Nanna,
#tr.en: a great divine standard,
#tr.en: a tree fit for harvest,
#tr.en: an ornament to marvel at,
#tr.en: with gold,
#tr.en: silver, and lapis lazuli made colorful,
#tr.en: a woman(?) green with flower buds(?),
#tr.en: a silver figure
#tr.en: ...
#tr.en: (the people) which had been scattered to the border of Anšan,
#tr.en: having secured them in their dwelling places,
#tr.en: he fashioned it for him,
#tr.en: and for his life
#tr.en: he dedicated it to him.

#tr.en: shall order against it,
#tr.en: or its inscription 
#tr.en: shall erase
#tr.en: and write his own name upon it,
#tr.en: ...
#tr.en: may his throne's
#tr.en: foundation not be kept secure for him, 
#tr.en: and may it sit in the dust.
#tr.en: May laments echo off the walls of his cult daises. 
#tr.en: May his cattle pens ...,
#tr.en: and may his sheepfolds ...

#tr.en: (the water), the abundance of heaven and earth
#tr.en: has revoked,
#tr.en: his Imah canal that brought the early flooding
#tr.en: may he fill with silt.  
#tr.en: ... forever.

#tr.en: 'Its divine prince is the ... of heaven and earth'
#tr.en: is its name.

#tr.en: Nanna,
#tr.en: great head of the Anuna gods, 
#tr.en: the most authoritative one of the Ekur,
#tr.en: whose divine powers embrace heaven and earth
#tr.en: and which no storm can dissipate,
#tr.en: the lord who alone is a god who comes forth resplendentdly, 
#tr.en: the first-born son of Enlil,
#tr.en: in order to restore the ancient divine attributes, 
#tr.en: and the divine plans of Ur
#tr.en: to set right,

#tr.en: brought forth the exalted divine powers,
#tr.en: and to Iddin-Dagan,
#tr.en: given wisdom by Enki,
#tr.en: to the leader who reveals the matter,
#tr.en: who knows everything well,
#tr.en: to the righteous shepherd whom he loves,
#tr.en: he (Nanna) put them into his hands. 
#tr.en: Iddin-Dagan,
#tr.en: the strong king, king of Ur 
#tr.en: and king of Sumer and Akkad,
#tr.en: beloved of Nanna and Ningal,
#tr.en: he fashioned (this) for him, and for his life 
#tr.en: he dedicated it to him.
#tr.en: A person who a wicked command
#tr.en: shall issue against it, and that which I have fashioned
#tr.en: shall efface,
#tr.en: or shall erase its inscription  
#tr.en: and write his own name upon it,
#tr.en: or, because of the curse, another person
#tr.en: he shall get to raise a hand against it,
#tr.en: that person, whether a king,
#tr.en: an en-priest, or an ordinary living person
#tr.en: called by name,  
#tr.en: may that person not acquire a name
#tr.en: and may he not produce progeny.  
#tr.en: That person may Nanna my master
#tr.en: and Ningal my mistress
#tr.en: curse,
#tr.en: and may Utu and Inanna be it's unstoppable enforcer 
#tr.en: forever.

#tr.en: and set it up before her.  
#tr.en: For his life he dedicated it to her.

#tr.en: ...

#tr.en: To the shrine of Nippur, 
#tr.en: the Bond of Heaven and Earth, 
#tr.en: he truly called me. 
#tr.en: His pure brow 
#tr.en: he directed towards me, 
#tr.en: and a good fate he determined for me: 
#tr.en: Enlilbani, 
#tr.en: my accomplishment, you are. 
#tr.en: Princely power 
#tr.en: there shall be with you.

#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: I have produced for you. 
#tr.en: In the four world quarters 
#tr.en: a rival 
#tr.en: may you not have. 
#tr.en: To the Black Headed People 
#tr.en: you are the one who is pleasing. 
#tr.en: Their sun god 
#tr.en: may you be. 
#tr.en: Years of life 
#tr.en: and a reign whose days 
#tr.en: are very long 
#tr.en: as a gift 
#tr.en: I have presented.

#tr.en: your neck towards heaven 
#tr.en: may you raise up.

#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: Its furrows 
#tr.en: you have made broad. 
#tr.en: ...

#tr.en: and most holy, 
#tr.en: daily 
#tr.en: you have indeed served,

#tr.en: you have brought to me.

#tr.en: has indeed rejoiced over them.

#tr.en: to west

#tr.en: I have given you.

#tr.en: I have made resplendent,

#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ...

#tr.en: the city which at your command 
#tr.en: did not ...,

#tr.en: you cast fetters upon them.

#tr.en: ... are you.

#tr.en: no one 
#tr.en: can alter. 
#tr.en: My fate 
#tr.en: forever 
#tr.en: you have established.

#tr.en: having been decreed by him, 
#tr.en: in Nippur 
#tr.en: justice 
#tr.en: I(?) established,

#tr.en: and let them eat green plants.

#tr.en: I lifted from their necks, 
#tr.en: and in a secure abode I made them dwell.

#tr.en: per month 
#tr.en: (only) four days
