#tr.en: the mighty man, 
#tr.en: provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa, 
#tr.en: one who cares for 
#tr.en: the Ebabbar shrine, 
#tr.en: whom youthful Utu 
#tr.en: in his sacred heart 
#tr.en: has rightly 
#tr.en: chosen, 
#tr.en: Utu’s one who makes the foreign lands submit, 
#tr.en: one called a good name
#tr.en: by Iškur, 
#tr.en: the man who the throne 
#tr.en: of Larsa’s  
#tr.en: foundations keeps secure, 
#tr.en: and its scattered people 
#tr.en: did make return to their places. 
#tr.en: For Nanna, 
#tr.en: his master, 
#tr.en: Nur-Adad, 
#tr.en: the mighty man, 
#tr.en: farmer of Ur 
#tr.en: and king of Larsa, 
#tr.en: the great storehouse, 
#tr.en: a house fit for butter and cheese, 
#tr.en: for Nanna
#tr.en: and (his consort) Ningal,
#tr.en: in Ur 
#tr.en: he built. 
#tr.en: For Nanna, 
#tr.en: crown of heaven and earth, 
#tr.en: with a countenance full of allure, 
#tr.en: first-born son 
#tr.en: of Enlil, 
#tr.en: his master, 
#tr.en: Nur-Adad, 
#tr.en: the mighty man, 
#tr.en: provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa, 
#tr.en: who makes the first-fruits hasten 
#tr.en: into the Ekišnugal, 
#tr.en: who cares 
#tr.en: for the Ebabbar shrine, 
#tr.en: whom youthful Utu  
#tr.en: in his holy heart 
#tr.en: truly chose, 
#tr.en: given the scepter 
#tr.en: by Nanna, 
#tr.en: the one who makes the foreign lands submit 
#tr.en: of Utu, 
#tr.en: called a good name 
#tr.en: by Iškur, 
#tr.en: reverent youth
#tr.en: who attains his victories, 
#tr.en: when the inside of Ur   
#tr.en: he had made enjoyable, 
#tr.en: evil 
#tr.en: and appeals for justice 
#tr.en: he had removed from it, 
#tr.en: its scattered people 
#tr.en: he had returned to their places, 
#tr.en: and to Nanna 
#tr.en: his master 
#tr.en: his (proper) territory 
#tr.en: he had given,  
#tr.en: at that time 
#tr.en: a great oven 
#tr.en: that serves the food of Suen   
#tr.en: and lifts up the breads  
#tr.en: for all the gods, 
#tr.en: (also) a great cauldron(?)
#tr.en: which in its dining hall 
#tr.en: is faithfully and carefully tended 
#tr.en: and at the morning and evening meals 
#tr.en: roars loudly,
#tr.en: for his life
#tr.en: he constructed for him.
#tr.en: His lustration rites of old 
#tr.en: he restored for him.
#tr.en: Nur-Adad,
#tr.en: the shepherd of righteousness 
#tr.en: a life of long days
#tr.en: and a reign of abundance
#tr.en: from out of the Ekišnugal
#tr.en: may there come forth for him.
#tr.en: For Ningal, 
#tr.en: the holy spouse 
#tr.en: of Ašimbabbar, 
#tr.en: his beloved lady, 
#tr.en: Nur-Adad, 
#tr.en: the mighty man, 
#tr.en: provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa, 
#tr.en: who cares for 
#tr.en: the Ebabbar shrine,  
#tr.en: the young man whom Utu 
#tr.en: in his holy heart 
#tr.en: truly 
#tr.en: has chosen, 
#tr.en: given the scepter 
#tr.en: by Nanna, 
#tr.en: subjugator of the foreign lands 
#tr.en: of Utu, 
#tr.en: called a good name 
#tr.en: by Iškur, 
#tr.en: reverent youth 
#tr.en: who attains his victories, 
#tr.en: when the inside of Ur 
#tr.en: he had made enjoyable, 
#tr.en: evil and appeals for justice 
#tr.en: he had removed from it, 
#tr.en: the throne 
#tr.en: of Larsa's  
#tr.en: foundation 
#tr.en: making secure, 
#tr.en: and its scattered people 
#tr.en: having returned to their places, 
#tr.en: a sacred cella, 
#tr.en: her house of dressing, 
#tr.en: and the bedroom 
#tr.en: of the young man Suen, 
#tr.en: for his life 
#tr.en: he built for her. 
#tr.en: The cella as it was in the distant past  
#tr.en: he restored for her. 
#tr.en: Nur-Adad, 
#tr.en: the mighty man, 
#tr.en: the steadfast farmer of Ur, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa,
#tr.en: who the divine attributes of the Ebabbar shrine 
#tr.en: makes sacred - 
#tr.en: that city Eridu, which since olden days 
#tr.en: had been allowed to fall into ruin,
#tr.en: for my reign of justice 
#tr.en: I desired to rebuild it.
#tr.en: And as for the god Enki, 
#tr.en: his beloved sacred residence 
#tr.en: I built for him, 
#tr.en: and his ancient divine plan 
#tr.en: I restored. 
#tr.en: For the god Enki, 
#tr.en: the king of Eridu, 
#tr.en: his master, 
#tr.en: Nur-Adad, 
#tr.en: the mighty man, 
#tr.en: provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa, 
#tr.en: subjugator of the foreign lands of Utu, 
#tr.en: when Ur 
#tr.en: and Larsa 
#tr.en: he had restored, 
#tr.en: their scattered people 
#tr.en: he had secured in their residences,  
#tr.en: their captive peoples 
#tr.en: he had steadfastly ... the foundation   
#tr.en: of(?) Eridu ...,
#tr.en: at that time an evil-doer 
#tr.en: Enki ... 
#tr.en: did not let ... within it. 
#tr.en: Lord Nudimmud 
#tr.en: was agreeable to him/it.
#tr.en: Beside his ancient ... temple  
#tr.en: an Abzu, his temple which makes holy the divine attributes, 
#tr.en: he built for him anew. 
#tr.en: His throne, standard, 
#tr.en: and treasures of old 
#tr.en: into it 
#tr.en: he made enter. 
#tr.en: When the god Utu Larsa's 
#tr.en: fate had decreed, 
#tr.en: and the foundation of its throne 
#tr.en: to secure forever, 
#tr.en: its benevolent reign 
#tr.en: to make unceasing, 
#tr.en: its kingship 
#tr.en: to make come forth replendently, 
#tr.en: its scattered people 
#tr.en: to resettle in their places, 
#tr.en: and the ..., the pleasant residence, 
#tr.en: to rebuild, 
#tr.en: the youthful Utu
#tr.en: his unalterable word 
#tr.en: steadfastly 
#tr.en: had spoken, 
#tr.en: I, Nur-Adad, 
#tr.en: being a righteous shepherd  
#tr.en: in his remote heart 
#tr.en: truly
#tr.en: he chose me.
#tr.en: For my ...
#tr.en: he decreed a good fate for me. 
#tr.en: Of the city where I was born 
#tr.en: its shepherdship he gave to me. 
#tr.en: The providing for the shrine Ur, 
#tr.en: the care for the shrine Ebbbar, 
#tr.en: mounded grain heaps and ... grain heaps  
#tr.en: for Utu I stacked up. 
#tr.en: I enlarged the cattle pens and sheepfolds. 
#tr.en: I increased the fat and cheese. 
#tr.en: My people much food 
#tr.en: I let eat, 
#tr.en: and I let them drink abundant water. 
#tr.en: From their midst the robbers, wicked persons, 
#tr.en: and evildoers I obliterated. 
#tr.en: The weak, the widows and the destitute 
#tr.en: I improved their lives.
#tr.en: At the time of my good reign, 
#tr.en: each: 2 kor barley, 2 ban oil, 
#tr.en: 10 minas of wool,
#tr.en: 10 kor dates, 
#tr.en: at the market rate in my country  
#tr.en: one shekel silver
#tr.en: thusly could purchase.
#tr.en: At that time, the great wall of Larsa 
#tr.en: like a mountain range in a pure place I built.
#tr.en: The wages per man 
#tr.en: were each: 3 ban barley, 2 sila bread, 
#tr.en: 2 sila beer, 
#tr.en: 2 shekels oil; 
#tr.en: such for one day they received.   
#tr.en: In order to establish my name for eternity, 
#tr.en: for this great wall 
#tr.en: I sank the holy foundation pegs, 
#tr.en: and Utu His Victory
#tr.en: has Attained
#tr.en: I named it. 
#tr.en: By the righteous verdict of Utu, 
#tr.en: the city against which battle 
#tr.en: he had waged 
#tr.en: its walls I counted as ruined mounds.
#tr.en: Those of it that did not submit 
#tr.en: I made bend down to the feet of Utu my master.
#tr.en: The boundary mound of Utu 
#tr.en: my master 
#tr.en: I restored.
#tr.en: ...
#tr.en: (for) the lord, great lion, the decider of heaven and earth, 
#tr.en: wild bull who is set against the sky like a torch, 
#tr.en: steadfast youth ... of wide heaven, 
#tr.en: the ... judge
#tr.en: who attends to the living and the dead, 
#tr.en: who alone makes perfect those divine powers, 
#tr.en: the prince, youthful Utu, 
#tr.en: exalted ..., 
#tr.en: most suited for the holy crown, 
#tr.en: filled with compassion, who loves ex-votos,
#tr.en: who listens to prayers, 
#tr.en: for his master, 
#tr.en: Sin-iddinam, the mighty man, 
#tr.en: provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: faithful shepherd of Larsa, 
#tr.en: who the divine plan of Eridu  
#tr.en: did restore, 
#tr.en: who perfects the divine attributes of Lagaš 
#tr.en: and Girsu, 
#tr.en: mighty heir who gladdens the heart of his father, 
#tr.en: first-born son of Iškur, 
#tr.en: a silver standing statue of the father who begot him,  
#tr.en: Nur-Adad, 
#tr.en: the king of Larsa, 
#tr.en: with beautiful features,
#tr.en: set with inscriptions, 
#tr.en: he fashioned for him,
#tr.en: and for his life 
#tr.en: he dedicated to him. 
#tr.en: In the main courtyard of the shrine Ebabbar, 
#tr.en: the most wonderous place of the nation, 
#tr.en: in his exalted temple, for offerings  
#tr.en: most suitable,
#tr.en: he stood it up. 
#tr.en: I, Sin-iddinam, 
#tr.en: the mighty man, 
#tr.en: provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa, 
#tr.en: king of Sumer and Akkad, 
#tr.en: the king who the Ebabbar, the temple of Utu, 
#tr.en: did build, 
#tr.en: and who the divine plans of the temples of the gods 
#tr.en: did restore, 
#tr.en: when An, Enlil, Nanna and Utu 
#tr.en: a favorable reign of justice 
#tr.en: whose days have been prolonged 
#tr.en: did present to me, 
#tr.en: by means of my broad wisdom 
#tr.en: greatly established  
#tr.en: and pre-eminent,  
#tr.en: for my cities and land 
#tr.en: to produce good water
#tr.en: as well as the course and praise
#tr.en: of my heroism
#tr.en: today and afterwards 
#tr.en: to make highly resplendent, 
#tr.en: to An and Enlil 
#tr.en: I made pleasing words, 
#tr.en: and they to my righteous prayers  
#tr.en: having been agreeable, 
#tr.en: for the digging of the Tigris, 
#tr.en: and its restoring, 
#tr.en: also through long days of life
#tr.en: to establish my name, 
#tr.en: with their unalterable words
#tr.en: they issued orders to me. 
#tr.en: At that time, by the commands 
#tr.en: of An and Inanna 
#tr.en: with the agreement of Enlil and Ninlil, 
#tr.en: and of Iškur my (personal) god
#tr.en: my helper, 
#tr.en: and by the exalted power of Nanna and Utu, 
#tr.en: the Tigris, 
#tr.en: Utu’s river of abundance, 
#tr.en: by means of my triumph 
#tr.en: I dug there in a grand fashion. 
#tr.en: Up to the border territory, my chosen boundary mound, 
#tr.en: I brought its beginning, 
#tr.en: and into a marsh 
#tr.en: I directed it in a great fashion. 
#tr.en: (Thus) a constant water supply, 
#tr.en: a ceaseless abundance, 
#tr.en: to my city Larsa of the nation  
#tr.en: I established.
#tr.en: When the Tigris, the great river, 
#tr.en: I dug, 
#tr.en: the wages for one man were 
#tr.en: 1 kor barley each, 
#tr.en: 2 sila bread each, 
#tr.en: 4 sila beer each 
#tr.en: and 2 shekels oil each, 
#tr.en: in one day 
#tr.en: thusly they received it.
#tr.en: Either a man less wages, 
#tr.en: or a man more wages 
#tr.en: I did not let him take.
#tr.en: Through the strength of the land 
#tr.en: I completed that work. 
#tr.en: By means of the commands and divine decisions 
#tr.en: of the great gods 
#tr.en: the Tigris, the wide river, 
#tr.en: I returned to its former place,
#tr.en: and (so) for all future time 
#tr.en: I have indeed made my name stand forth. 
#tr.en: For Utu 
#tr.en: his master, 
#tr.en: Sin-iddinam, 
#tr.en: the mighty man, 
#tr.en: provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa 
#tr.en: and king of Sumer and Akkad, 
#tr.en: the Ebabbar, 
#tr.en: his beloved temple,
#tr.en: for his life 
#tr.en: he built for him. 
#tr.en: The divine attributes and divine plans 
#tr.en: of the office of en priest 
#tr.en: for all future days 
#tr.en: he made greatly resplendent for him. 
#tr.en: Sin-iddinam, 
#tr.en: the mighty man, 
#tr.en: provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa 
#tr.en: and king of Sumer and Akkad, 
#tr.en: in order to ..., 
#tr.en: to Utu my master 
#tr.en: I spoke pleasing words, 
#tr.en: and to the prayers of my heart’s desire
#tr.en: he was agreeable.
#tr.en: At that time, through the willingness 
#tr.en: of my master, 
#tr.en: the Ebabbar, his beloved temple, 
#tr.en: I built for him. 
#tr.en: Like a lifted up mountain range 
#tr.en: I raised up (its) top for him, 
#tr.en: and in his residence which pleases the heart 
#tr.en: I let Utu dwell.
#tr.en: For Utu, 
#tr.en: lord and judge of heaven and earth, 
#tr.en: learned in decision, 
#tr.en: who chooses the right, 
#tr.en: the king of the Ebabbar temple, 
#tr.en: his master, 
#tr.en: Sin-iddinam, 
#tr.en: the shepherd who provides everything in abundance  
#tr.en: for Nippur, 
#tr.en: the provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa, 
#tr.en: and king of Sumer and Akkad, 
#tr.en: the Ebabbar, 
#tr.en: his beloved temple, 
#tr.en: for his life 
#tr.en: he built for him. 
#tr.en: More than in past times 
#tr.en: he enlarged its residence. 
#tr.en: For that which was done   
#tr.en: may Utu 
#tr.en: rejoice over him,  
#tr.en: and a good life 
#tr.en: whose days will be made great 
#tr.en: as a gift 
#tr.en: may he allot to him. 
#tr.en: When Utu the shrine Ebabbar's 
#tr.en: fate did determine, 
#tr.en: to perfect the divine attributes and plans 
#tr.en: ...,
#tr.en: to enlarge its residence,
#tr.en: and greatly to ....
#tr.en: ... he having spoken(?), 
#tr.en: then it was towards me, Sin-iddinam, 
#tr.en: the mighty man, 
#tr.en: the provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: the king of Larsa 
#tr.en: and king of Sumer and Akkad, 
#tr.en: that youthful Utu, out of all the lands, 
#tr.en: did direct his steadfast eye.
#tr.en: To the shepherdship of Larsa 
#tr.en: he raised me up, 
#tr.en: its troops of numerous areas 
#tr.en: at my command he made dwell, 
#tr.en: and all the great orders for them 
#tr.en: he put fully into my hands. 
#tr.en: His residence which gladdens his heart 
#tr.en: to enlarge widely, 
#tr.en: in view of my reverence, 
#tr.en: regarding it he gave me orders.  
#tr.en: At that time, Utu my master, 
#tr.en: through my pleasing words (of prayer) 
#tr.en: (any cause for) complaint from my city  
#tr.en: he removed. 
#tr.en: The army of Larsa 
#tr.en: I having made dwell together as one,  
#tr.en: wages, food, ointment, 
#tr.en: (enough) to please the heart, 
#tr.en: to the men doing that work 
#tr.en: I did give.
#tr.en: During a single year 
#tr.en: the baked bricks for it 
#tr.en: I baked there, 
#tr.en: and the Ebabbar, his beloved temple,  
#tr.en: like a mountain range on a pure place 
#tr.en: its exalted high terrace
#tr.en: I built for him. 
#tr.en: When the Ebabbar shrine (itself) 
#tr.en: I had built, 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: The wages per person were: 
#tr.en: ... kor of barley each, 
#tr.en: 2 sila of dates each, 
#tr.en: 2 sila of cheese each, 
#tr.en: 2 sila of sesame bran each, 
#tr.en: 2 shekels of oil each, 
#tr.en: apart from the sheepfold edibles,
#tr.en: in one day
#tr.en: thus one received. 
#tr.en: In the days of my excellent reign, 
#tr.en: which Utu my master 
#tr.en: gave to me, 
#tr.en: 4 kor barely, 
#tr.en: 12 kur dates, 
#tr.en: 15 minas of wool, 
#tr.en: 3 ban oil, 
#tr.en: 5 ban of lard, 
#tr.en: at the market rate in Ur, 
#tr.en: Larsa, and in my land,
#tr.en: 1 shekel silver 
#tr.en: thusly did purchase.
#tr.en: Sin-iddinam, the great prince ..., 
#tr.en: who carried off the lower lands, 
#tr.en: at that time, (with) a shining countenance 
#tr.en: which gladdens the heart of my city, 
#tr.en: on the shrine Ebabbar 
#tr.en: its work I did finish,  
#tr.en: (and so) the hearts of Utu 
#tr.en: and (his consort) Šerda
#tr.en: I did please. 
#tr.en: For Utu, 
#tr.en: the lord, the big lion, 
#tr.en: who opens the bolt of heaven, 
#tr.en: judge of the upper and lower lands, 
#tr.en: king of the Ebabbar, 
#tr.en: his master, 
#tr.en: Sin-iribam, 
#tr.en: the mighty man, 
#tr.en: son of Ga'eš-rabi, 
#tr.en: provider of Ur,

#tr.en: and king of Sumer and Akkad,

#tr.en: he built for him.

#tr.en: may Utu rejoice, 
#tr.en: and may he ...

#tr.en: its days may he extend.

#tr.en: the lord of truth,

#tr.en: surpassing (all) the Anuna gods,
#tr.en: his master,

#tr.en: of his exalted ways 
#tr.en: to the distant future
#tr.en: he made greatly resplendent for him. 
#tr.en: Through the commands
#tr.en: of Nanna and Utu, 
#tr.en: in the Ebabbar 
#tr.en: and the Ekišnugal temples,
#tr.en: may Sin-iddinam,
#tr.en: one who fears the Anunna gods,
#tr.en: be one who makes perfect food offerings 
#tr.en: forever. 
#tr.en: Sin-iddinam, 
#tr.en: the mighty man, 
#tr.en: provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa, 
#tr.en: the king who the divine plans of Ur  
#tr.en: and Eridu  
#tr.en: did restore, 
#tr.en: the great storehous, 
#tr.en: since distant times 
#tr.en: no kings who went before him 
#tr.en: had ever restored, 
#tr.en: but at the command of Nanna 
#tr.en: my master, 
#tr.en: the Exalted Great Shrine of property
#tr.en: which is not equalled by the numerous peoples,
#tr.en: for the life of my father 
#tr.en: and my own life 
#tr.en: I built for him.
#tr.en: Sin-iddinam,
#tr.en: the mighty man, 
#tr.en: provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa 
#tr.en: and king of Sumer and Akkad, 
#tr.en: the man who the old boundary mound 
#tr.en: did restore, 
#tr.en: when the throne of Larsa’s 
#tr.en: foundation he had secured, 
#tr.en: its enemies with weapons 
#tr.en: he had subdued, 
#tr.en: and the Tigris, 
#tr.en: the river that pleased his heart, 
#tr.en: by means of the country’s strength
#tr.en: he hd dug, 
#tr.en: and a perpetual water supply, 
#tr.en: an unending abundance, 
#tr.en: for his city and land 
#tr.en: he had set up, 
#tr.en: because the prayers, his namšita and arazu supplications, 
#tr.en: had made Nanna,
#tr.en: the first-born son of Ninlil 
#tr.en: walk with him, 
#tr.en: through his broad wisdom 
#tr.en: and many beautiful words
#tr.en: within the land of Ur 
#tr.en: he set up his lofty name. 
#tr.en: His temple Enamunua
#tr.en: for Nanna 
#tr.en: he built.
#tr.en: For Nanna, 
#tr.en: the first-born son of Enlil, 
#tr.en: his master, 
#tr.en: Sin-iddinam,
#tr.en: the shepherd who heaps up everything 
#tr.en: for Nippur, 
#tr.en: provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa

#tr.en: a great copper statue 
#tr.en: for his life 
#tr.en: he had fashioned, 
#tr.en: and to the temple of Nanna, 
#tr.en: the (most) wonderous place of the country, 
#tr.en: he had it brought in.
#tr.en: His term of kingship, 
#tr.en: far away and to the remote future, 
#tr.en: he made greatly resplendent.
#tr.en: Sin-iddinam, 
#tr.en: the mighty man, 
#tr.en: provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: king of larsa, 
#tr.en: one who cares 
#tr.en: for the shrine Ebabbar, 
#tr.en: and who the foundation of the land
#tr.en: keeps secure 
#tr.en: of Utu, 
#tr.en: because of his justness 
#tr.en: and his rightful orders, 
#tr.en: Nanna at his supplications
#tr.en: walked with him, 
#tr.en: and those who acted evilly to him 
#tr.en: he put into his hands.
#tr.en: The rebel lands 
#tr.en: he bent down to his feet. 
#tr.en: The throne of Larsa’s
#tr.en: foundations he made secure for him, 
#tr.en: and a just reign 
#tr.en: he prepard perfectly for him. 
#tr.en: After the lands that rebelled against him
#tr.en: he had slain, 
#tr.en: and the weapons of his enemy 
#tr.en: he had broken apart, 
#tr.en: at that time, through the commands 
#tr.en: of Nanna and Ningal,
#tr.en: the great wall of Ur 
#tr.en: like a mountain range 
#tr.en: he built on a pure place.

#tr.en: provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa 
#tr.en: and king of Sumer and Akkad, 
#tr.en: the man who the Ebabbar, 
#tr.en: the temple of Utu, 
#tr.en: did build, 
#tr.en: who the divine powers and divine plans 
#tr.en: of the Anunna gods 
#tr.en: did restore, 
#tr.en: the man who the Tigris, 
#tr.en: the broad river, 
#tr.en: dug out, 
#tr.en: and fresh water, an abundance 
#tr.en: that cannot end, 
#tr.en: to his city and land 
#tr.en: he did establish, 
#tr.en: the son of Nur-Adad,
#tr.en: king of Larsa -
#tr.en: those of his land 
#tr.en: in order to settle them in peaceful residences, 
#tr.en: to make the wide workforce 
#tr.en: sleep sweetly, 
#tr.en: and unto distant times 
#tr.en: in order that his kingship 
#tr.en: be praised by the people, 
#tr.en: the great wall 
#tr.en: of Bad-tibira,
#tr.en: through his triumphs, 
#tr.en: he built in a grand fashion. 
#tr.en: Sin-iddinam, 
#tr.en: the shepherd of righteousness, 
#tr.en: the hearts of Utu and Dumuzi 
#tr.en: did please. 
#tr.en: May the time of his reign 
#tr.en: be an unchanging thing
#tr.en: for all time.
#tr.en: Iškur the lord, the furious storm ... great storm of heaven and earth,  
#tr.en: having confidence in his exaltedness, 
#tr.en: foremost one, with a creative word, the son of An,  
#tr.en: with a head clad in powerfulness, 
#tr.en: fierce chief lord, riding on a great storm that is unrivaled, 
#tr.en: who binds together the clouds,  
#tr.en: as he races within the north wind 
#tr.en: the earth trembles because of him. 
#tr.en: In the broad sky the sound confronts the great winds,  
#tr.en: its noise is abundance.
#tr.en: At his shrieking, the nation and the great mountain ranges 
#tr.en: turn(?) themselves away from him,  
#tr.en: Great hero, holding the shepherd's staff, 
#tr.en: with authority bound to his side, 
#tr.en: at his roaring sea water 
#tr.en: which covers the land  
#tr.en: huge hailstones and criss-crossed rains 
#tr.en: with their ... they stand before him. 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: Like reeds ..., 
#tr.en: for the rain, his abundance, 
#tr.en: the verdict(?) was lifted up for him.

#tr.en: the lord of abundance, who multiplies luxuries, 
#tr.en: who gives life to the nation 
#tr.en: the prince who sends back the heart, the totality of which is good,

#tr.en: who stands in battle with the troops at his side,

#tr.en: the powerful one of the Ebabbar 
#tr.en: whose word is agreeable, 
#tr.en: before Utu and (his consort) Šerda 
#tr.en: to make that one's oracular utterances bad,   
#tr.en: at(?) that time 
#tr.en: may he hold fast to that (low) person. 
#tr.en: May the god Big Fierce Man, 
#tr.en: who does not ..., 
#tr.en: when the person 
#tr.en: he has overturned(?), 
#tr.en: may he be (his) unchanging evil-working bailiff-demon 
#tr.en: forever. 
#tr.en: Stele of Warad-Sîn. 
#tr.en: I, Warad-Sîn, 
#tr.en: the mighty man, 
#tr.en: a shepherd of righteousness 
#tr.en: appointed by Enlil, 
#tr.en: provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa 
#tr.en: and king of Sumer and Akkad, 
#tr.en: son of Kudurmabuk 
#tr.en: and father of Emutbala -
#tr.en: in order to expand Ur 
#tr.en: and to acquire a great name 
#tr.en: humbly 
#tr.en: I addressed a plea about it, 
#tr.en: and Nanna my master 
#tr.en: was agreeable to me.
#tr.en: The great city wall raised up like a mountain range, which cannot be opposed,  
#tr.en: which came forth by itself, 
#tr.en: I built for him  
#tr.en: and made it encircle his city.  
#tr.en: Of that wall 
#tr.en: Nanna Keeps Secure the Foundation of the Nation 
#tr.en: is its name.
#tr.en: Warad-Sîn, 
#tr.en: the mighty man, 
#tr.en: provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa 
#tr.en: and king of Sumer and Akkad, 
#tr.en: son of Kudur-mabuk 
#tr.en: and father of Emutbala - 
#tr.en: in order to widen Ur, 
#tr.en: to expand its platform, 
#tr.en: and to acquire a great name, 
#tr.en: Nanna my master 
#tr.en: was agreeable to me. 
#tr.en: The great city wall, raised up like a mountain range 
#tr.en: which cannot be opposed, 
#tr.en: which came forth on its own,  
#tr.en: I built for him. 
#tr.en: Of that wall 
#tr.en: Nanna Keeps Secure the Foundation of the Nation 
#tr.en: is its name. 
#tr.en: For all the things I was able to do, 
#tr.en: O Nanna my master 
#tr.en: may you be happy with me. 
#tr.en: May a fate of life, 
#tr.en: a long reign, 
#tr.en: and a throne with a firm foundation 
#tr.en: as a gift 
#tr.en: be presented to me. 
#tr.en: I, Warad-Sîn, 
#tr.en: the mighty man, 
#tr.en: shepherd who makes justice blossom, 
#tr.en: beloved of Enlil, 
#tr.en: Nanna and Utu, 
#tr.en: who reveres the Ebabbar, 
#tr.en: provider of the Ekur, 
#tr.en: the man who pleases the heart of Nippur, 
#tr.en: the constant supporter of the Ekišnugal, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa 
#tr.en: and king of Sumer and Akkad, 
#tr.en: son of Kudur-mabuk  
#tr.en: and father of Emutbala -
#tr.en: Nanna my master, with my making excellent words, 
#tr.en: about widening Ur, 
#tr.en: expanding its platform  
#tr.en: more than any previous one, 
#tr.en: enlarging its grounds, 
#tr.en: and (so) making it acquire a great name,  
#tr.en: after I made (oracular) inquiries, 
#tr.en: I trod after him 
#tr.en: and humbly addressed pleas for it.
#tr.en:  Nanna my master was agreeable to me.
#tr.en: For my life and the life 
#tr.en: of Kudur-mabuk, the father who begot me, 
#tr.en: in the city, the mountain of life 
#tr.en: and place of abundance, 
#tr.en: the residence (where) the assembly of the gods  
#tr.en: determined his destiny, 
#tr.en: which like his name is surpassing, 
#tr.en: whose head reaches the sky, 
#tr.en: whose arms seeking with hands the place where inquiries are placed, 
#tr.en: whose wide shadow he therefore made to be over all the lands, 
#tr.en: at its base he multiplied the Black Headed People,  
#tr.en: they who betook their lives there,  
#tr.en: its great wall I built.
#tr.en: Like a verdant mountin range I made it grow upon a pure place. 
#tr.en: Like its name and majesty I raised up its top there. 
#tr.en: As a marvel of the nation I made it appear greatly resplendent. 
#tr.en: When I built the wall of Ur, 
#tr.en: the wages for one man were: 3 ban barley, 
#tr.en: 2 sila bread, 2 sila beer, 
#tr.en: and 2 shekels oil; 
#tr.en: one received this per one day.
#tr.en: Throughout my country I removed complaints.
#tr.en: With my shining brow and happiness of heart 
#tr.en: this work I joyfully and quickly finished.  
#tr.en: With my wide intelligence and wisdom I built it grandly. 
#tr.en: That wall Nanna Makes Firm the Foundation of the Country  
#tr.en: I named. 
#tr.en: For my deed, 
#tr.en: O Nanna my master, may you rejoice over me,  
#tr.en: and may days of happiness, a reign of abundance, 
#tr.en: a good life, years of plenty,
#tr.en: and a throne with a secure foundation  
#tr.en: be presented to me. 
#tr.en: To Dingir-Mardu, 
#tr.en: his god, 
#tr.en: for the life 
#tr.en: of Warad-Sîn 
#tr.en: the king of Larsa, 
#tr.en: Alla-rapi, 
#tr.en: son(?) of Uku'a, 
#tr.en: as(?) his servant,
#tr.en: dedicated it (this object). 
#tr.en: When An and Enlil 
#tr.en: the eternal princes, the fathers of the gods, 
#tr.en: they who decide the fates, 
#tr.en: to Nanna, the good son, 
#tr.en: the beloved of the Ekur - 
#tr.en: who daily, in humility, 
#tr.en: while prostrating himself  
#tr.en: standing before them, 
#tr.en: heeds what they say
#tr.en: and bows to their commands - 
#tr.en: they spoke to him happily. 
#tr.en: The counsel of heaven and earth,  
#tr.en: the good advice and divine decisions of the Anunna gods, 
#tr.en: they placed in his hands. 
#tr.en: In his city Ur, the demarcated territory of the gods,  
#tr.en: to exercise a good reign for the future, 
#tr.en: to raise high its dais(es), 
#tr.en: and all the assembly of living beings 
#tr.en: to make bear tribute
#tr.en: and set it down at his feet and his hands, 
#tr.en: their holy word, which cannot be altered, 
#tr.en: they firmly spoke. 
#tr.en: At that time, Ašimbabbar, 
#tr.en: wise as to decisions, the son of Ninlil, 
#tr.en: who before An and Enlil 
#tr.en: in beauty had come forth head held high, 
#tr.en: who soothes the land with his word, 
#tr.en: who has faithfully manifested it to the Black Headed People,  
#tr.en: and has shown compassion to its numerous people, 
#tr.en: in his city Ur, the weak(?) mother of the land, 
#tr.en: with his shining brow and happy heart
#tr.en: he(?) looked at her(?),
#tr.en: and having raised his head  
#tr.en: he made it acquire an exalted name. 
#tr.en: Letting it have the use of the abundance of the sea and mountains 
#tr.en: and (as well) making it rush into war and battle in the nation,   
#tr.en: he gave it as a gift.
#tr.en: To provide refuge for the living, 
#tr.en: to return what was their land to their control, 
#tr.en: to establish water therein, and (so) to prolong their lives 
#tr.en: by their word they brought him to do this. 
#tr.en: For this, Warad-Sîn, 
#tr.en: me, the wise one possessing intelligence, who loves what is right, 
#tr.en: me who was colored(?) in sacred fashion from the very womb of my mother, 
#tr.en: he (Nanna) placed me in the position of shepherd in his land. 
#tr.en: For my rectitude he gave me the scepter, 
#tr.en: bestowed upon me a happy reign, 
#tr.en: and made his numerous people dwell under my command.  
#tr.en: To renovate the Etemenniguru temple, 
#tr.en: to thicken the base(?) of the shrine Ebabbar, 
#tr.en: to rebuild the cities of the gods of the land, 
#tr.en: to ... their fallen ...
#tr.en: to raise high the old divine plans, 
#tr.en: to restore their forgotten lustration rites,
#tr.en: Nanna, the lord who perfects the divine attributes of heaen and earth, 
#tr.en: because of my reverence he ordered me to do this. 
#tr.en: My counsel for that(?) is a superior thing,  
#tr.en: my skillful care is a thing that cannot be disrupted. 
#tr.en: About lettiing my people know the ways of my kingship 
#tr.en: about making my greatness and majesty exist forever, 
#tr.en: about widening Ur,   
#tr.en: expanding its platform,
#tr.en: and greater than previously  
#tr.en: enlarging its grounds,  
#tr.en: after I had inquired about these (things), I trod after him 
#tr.en: and humbly I addressed pleas to him.
#tr.en: Nanna, my master, was agreeable to me. 
#tr.en: For my life and the life 
#tr.en: of Kudur-mabuk, the father who begot me - 
#tr.en: the city, the mountain of life and place of abundance, 
#tr.en: the residence and assembly (place) of the gods, 
#tr.en: whose destiny they (the gods) having decided, 
#tr.en: whose name is surpassing, 
#tr.en: with top reaching the heavens, 
#tr.en: whose arms seek with the hands the put inquiries, 
#tr.en: whose wide shadow covers foreign land as well as the nation, 
#tr.en: from whose good base the Black Headed People 
#tr.en: he has multiplied, those who betake their lives (there) -
#tr.en: the building of its wall he placed in my hands.  
#tr.en: In the middle of that, five months had not elapsed 
#tr.en: when I had baked its bricks.
#tr.en: I finished that great wall 
#tr.en: and raised up its parapets. 
#tr.en: Like a verdant mountain range I made it grow on a pure place. 
#tr.en: Its height I made surpassing and set free its awesome radiance. 
#tr.en: Commensurate with its name and greatness I raised up its top. 
#tr.en: As a marvel of the nation 
#tr.en: I made it grandly resplendent.  
#tr.en: In its foundations, for the foundation documents of my kingship 
#tr.en: I sought out the place. 
#tr.en: I raised the top of its main gate. 
#tr.en: I strengthened its demarcating levee, 
#tr.en: circled it with bricks, 
#tr.en: and dug its moat. 
#tr.en: I heaped up its ... 
#tr.en: When the wall of Ur 
#tr.en: I built, 
#tr.en: the wages for one man were: 3 ban barley, 
#tr.en: 2 sila bread, 2 sila beer, 2 shekels oil, 
#tr.en: in one day a man received thus. 
#tr.en: From the midst of my land 
#tr.en: I removed (cause for) complaint. 
#tr.en: With my shining brow and happy heart 
#tr.en: I finished this work quickly and joyfully. 
#tr.en: With my wide intelligence and wisdom I did the work in grand fashion. 
#tr.en: That wall: Nanna Makes Firm the Foundations of the Land 
#tr.en: I named it.
#tr.en: For my deeds, O Nanna my master, may you rejoice over me,  
#tr.en: and may days of happiness, a reign of abundance, 
#tr.en: a fate which cannot be overturned(?), years of plenty, 
#tr.en: a good life as (my) lot and kingship as (my) portion, 
#tr.en: be presented to me.
#tr.en: May my shepherdship in Nippur, Ur, and Larsa
#tr.en: never ever be altered. 
#tr.en: May I be the prince beloved of Nanna and Ningal. 
#tr.en: May my days be long. 
#tr.en: For Nininsina, 
#tr.en: the great lady, the mother of the nation, 
#tr.en: who creates the living things of the nation, 
#tr.en: first-born child of holy An, 
#tr.en: his mistress - 
#tr.en: Warad-Sîn, 
#tr.en: the mighty man, 
#tr.en: provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa 
#tr.en: and king of Sumer and Akkad, 
#tr.en: shepherd who perfects justice and the divine plans, 
#tr.en: the Plant of Life temple, 
#tr.en: the sacred dining hall, 
#tr.en: her place of relaxation -
#tr.en: her temple which in a past time 
#tr.en: had been built and had grown old - 
#tr.en: for his life
#tr.en: and the life 
#tr.en: of Kudur-mabuk 
#tr.en: the father who begot him, 
#tr.en: he rebuilt for her 
#tr.en: and restored for her. 
#tr.en: In her residence that gladdens the heart 
#tr.en: I caused her to dwell in grand fashion, 
#tr.en: and my royal name 
#tr.en: I put there everlastingly. 
#tr.en: For ever after today 
#tr.en: to cause the praising of me, 
#tr.en: foundation document(s) in praise of my princeliness 
#tr.en: into its foundation I buried, 
#tr.en: and a pure brick wall for it I placed upon it. 
#tr.en: For my deeds, 
#tr.en: O Nininsina 
#tr.en: my mistress, may you rejoice over me. 
#tr.en: May a fate of life, 
#tr.en: a long reign, years of abundance, 
#tr.en: and a throne with a secure foundation 
#tr.en: be presented to me.
#tr.en: In the shrine of Larsa, 
#tr.en: the city where I was created,  
#tr.en: may my days be long.
#tr.en: For Nergal, 
#tr.en: mighty lord of the netherworld, strong one, 
#tr.en: first-born son of Enlil, 
#tr.en: my master, 
#tr.en: I, Warad-Sîn, 
#tr.en: who takes care of the Ebabbar temple, 
#tr.en: provier of Ur, 
#tr.en: put in place by Enlil, 
#tr.en: beloved by Nanna and Utu, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa 
#tr.en: and king of Sumer and Akkad, 
#tr.en: son of Kudur-mabuk 
#tr.en: and father of Emutbala, 
#tr.en: a man who a favor for the Ebabbar
#tr.en: did repay, 
#tr.en: who most humbly before the great gods 
#tr.en: stands serving for his life's sake, 
#tr.en: (for) Nergal, 
#tr.en: through his ...
#tr.en: the helper of my weapon, 
#tr.en: in my having established a colleague status (with him), 
#tr.en: his old temple  
#tr.en: the sacred temple and residence which gladdens his heart, 
#tr.en: for my life 
#tr.en: and the life 
#tr.en: of Kudur-mabuk,  
#tr.en: the father who begot me, 
#tr.en: I built for him. 
#tr.en: like a distant mountain range 
#tr.en: I made it stand as a marvel to the numerous people. 
#tr.en: For the things I have done 
#tr.en: may Nergal my god 
#tr.en: rejoice over me. 
#tr.en: A fate of life, 
#tr.en: a long reign, 
#tr.en: and a secure throne 
#tr.en: may he present to me. 
#tr.en: For Zababa, 
#tr.en: lord, great hero, 
#tr.en: exalted son of Enlil, 
#tr.en: mighty god who goes in the van of battle, 
#tr.en: his helper of weapons, 
#tr.en: Warad-Sîn, 
#tr.en: provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa 
#tr.en: and king of Sumer and Akkad, 
#tr.en: son of Kudur-mabuk 
#tr.en: and father of Emutbala, 
#tr.en: shepherd of justice 
#tr.en: who made the wide peoples 
#tr.en: lie down in fine meadows - 
#tr.en: because in my place of Raised Hand prayers 
#tr.en: you stood by me, 
#tr.en: and my enemies 
#tr.en: you put fully into my hands, 
#tr.en: therefore 
#tr.en: for Zababa, 
#tr.en: the lord of my favorable signs, 
#tr.en: whereas I had established a colleague status (with him), 
#tr.en: his temple 
#tr.en: in Ur 
#tr.en: for my life 
#tr.en: I did indeed build for him. 
#tr.en: That house,
#tr.en: Temple - Residence that Cools the Heart
#tr.en: I named it.
#tr.en: For Nanna, 
#tr.en: his master, 
#tr.en: Warad-Sîn, 
#tr.en: provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: who reveres the Ebabbar temple, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa, 
#tr.en: when Nanna 
#tr.en: and Ningal 
#tr.en: I implored, 
#tr.en: in my place of Raised Hand prayer 
#tr.en: you stood by me: 
#tr.en: that the Nanna Rejoices canal 
#tr.en: I shall dig 
#tr.en: and restore. 
#tr.en: For Ningublaga, 
#tr.en: wise in battle,  
#tr.en: ..., 
#tr.en: who splits the big ..., 
#tr.en: ... of Enlil,   
#tr.en: guardian angel of the Ekišnugal 
#tr.en: in Ur, 
#tr.en: his helper in kingship - 
#tr.en: I, Warad-Sîn, 
#tr.en: the mighty man, 
#tr.en: provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa 
#tr.en: and king of Sumer and Akkad,
#tr.en: son of Kudur-mabuk 
#tr.en: and father of Emutbala, 
#tr.en: when Ningublaga my master 
#tr.en: had brought his instructions:  
#tr.en: that I shall make the people who are hostile to me submit to me 
#tr.en: and settle the kings who hated me under my command, 
#tr.en: because of this, 
#tr.en: while I was making beautiful words (of prayer),  
#tr.en: the Egabura temple,  
#tr.en: with cattle pens for butterfat and cheese, a mountain of abundance, 
#tr.en: his sacred dining hall with things required for a deity,  
#tr.en: and with all kinds of water, I built 
#tr.en: and restored. 
#tr.en: The greatness of my kingship 
#tr.en: I let be seen throughout the nation, 
#tr.en: and my great name
#tr.en: I established there forever.
#tr.en: For Inanna, 
#tr.en: clad in great fearsomeness, 
#tr.en: who clasps myriad divine powers, 
#tr.en: great child of Suen, 
#tr.en: his mistress, 
#tr.en: I, Warad-Sîn, 
#tr.en: the obedient prince of Nippur, 
#tr.en: provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: who tends to Girsu 
#tr.en: and the whole state of Lagaš,
#tr.en: who reveres the Ebabbar, 
#tr.en: the king of Larsa 
#tr.en: and king of Sumer and Akkad, 
#tr.en: the youth who seeks out the (divine) instructions
#tr.en: and perfects the divine plans, 
#tr.en: who the temples of the gods
#tr.en: renovated 
#tr.en: and who who great statues 
#tr.en: that demonstrate his kingship  
#tr.en: did erect in grand fshion, 
#tr.en: who its dilapidated cities 
#tr.en: and its walls rebuilt, 
#tr.en: by whom the ones of his wide land 
#tr.en: were made to dwell in peaceful houses, 
#tr.en: reverent one who ...  
#tr.en: who returned the troops to (my) control - 
#tr.en: the wide wisdom 
#tr.en: to fashion eternal works, 
#tr.en: having been given to me by the god Enki, 
#tr.en: therefore, in order that Inanna my mistress, 
#tr.en: as I was making beautiful words, 
#tr.en: the Dilmun Temple, 
#tr.en: her relaxing residence  
#tr.en: of happiness 
#tr.en: might experience, 
#tr.en: whose interior is full of jubilation - 
#tr.en: when more than before 
#tr.en: its Ešusiga
#tr.en: I had widened, 
#tr.en: for far future days  
#tr.en: for my life I built it 
#tr.en: and raised up its top 
#tr.en: and made it grow forth like a mountain range. 
#tr.en: For these things that I have done 
#tr.en: may Inanna my mistress 
#tr.en: rejoice over me. 
#tr.en: Long days (of life), years of abundance, 
#tr.en: a throne with a secure foundation,  
#tr.en: and a scepter which makes the people bow down  
#tr.en: may she present to me.

#tr.en: a reign of justice and years of abundance 
#tr.en: may he/she present to me. 
#tr.en: May my invoked name not ..., 
#tr.en: and in the ... Ekišnugal 
#tr.en: may it be present before them.

#tr.en: For Nanna 
#tr.en: his master, 
#tr.en: Warad-Sîn, 
#tr.en: governor 
#tr.en: of Utu, 
#tr.en: son of Kudur-mabuk,
#tr.en: father of the Amorite land, 
#tr.en: dedicated it (this eyestone).
#tr.en: Bodily features of Şillī-Eštar, 
#tr.en: the Man of Maškan-šapir, 
#tr.en: enemy of Larsa, 
#tr.en: who harbors evil against Emutbala, 
#tr.en: whom in front of Nanna and Utu 
#tr.en: by their destruction 
#tr.en: they made tremble(?), 
#tr.en: (and also of) Kudur-mabuk, 
#tr.en: the king who to the man who has been good to him 
#tr.en: returned greatness, 
#tr.en: who by the command of Enlil, Ninurta, 
#tr.en: Nanna, and Utu, 
#tr.en: conquered it/them with his hands 
#tr.en: and placed his feet upon it/them, 
#tr.en: (also) the neck stock of a captive,  
#tr.en: in the main courtyard of the Gagiššua, 
#tr.en: the temple of Ninlil, 
#tr.en: (he striding) with his knees opened,  
#tr.en: a foot planted on the head. 
#tr.en: Incription: Şillī-Eštar 
#tr.en: Kudur-mabuk, 
#tr.en: father of Emutbala, 
#tr.en: son of Simti-šilḫak, 
#tr.en: against Larsa and Emutbala 
#tr.en: he committed no sin, 
#tr.en: and that which was not pleasing to Šamaš 
#tr.en: he did not do. 
#tr.en: With the wise understanding 
#tr.en: that the god gave him 
#tr.en: he searched wisely, 
#tr.en: and in a place 
#tr.en: where access was barred 
#tr.en: a house of baked bricks, 
#tr.en: a pure residence, 
#tr.en: a standing-place for a stele 
#tr.en: and for, daily 
#tr.en: within it,  
#tr.en: regular offerings, 
#tr.en: for all future days  
#tr.en: he built, and 
#tr.en: he established his name as important. 
#tr.en: For future generations 
#tr.en: he set up a ... 
#tr.en: Whenever 
#tr.en: in future times 
#tr.en: he who that baked brick structure,  
#tr.en: when it has gotten old, 
#tr.en: does not strengthen it, 
#tr.en: and its foundation structure 
#tr.en: he does not repair, 
#tr.en: who removes its door, 
#tr.en: carries away(?) its threshold, 
#tr.en: or its drain work, when it falls down, 
#tr.en: to its (former) place 
#tr.en: does not return it, 
#tr.en: who with an intent 
#tr.en: of evil 
#tr.en: destroys it and 
#tr.en: its foundation to the sun 
#tr.en: exposes, 
#tr.en: and into a field of wild growth 
#tr.en: turns it, 
#tr.en: that man, whether a king or an en priest, 
#tr.en: may Nergal, 
#tr.en: the god who created myself, 
#tr.en: angrily in his rage 
#tr.en: remove his sense, 
#tr.en: and may Šamaš, the lord of heaven 
#tr.en: and earth, 
#tr.en: with a grievous curse 
#tr.en: curse him. 
#tr.en: For the god(dess) ..., 
#tr.en: his master/mistress, 
#tr.en: Kudur-mabuk, 
#tr.en: don of Simti-šilḫak, 
#tr.en: for his life 
#tr.en: he dedicated it (this pendant). 
#tr.en: For Iškur,  
#tr.en: lord, hero, son of An, 
#tr.en: clad in an exalted awesome radiance, 
#tr.en: who by using his voice   
#tr.en: gathers the thick(!) clouds 
#tr.en: and opens the teat of heaven, 
#tr.en: who multiplies everywhere plentiful yields and abundance, 
#tr.en: his master, 
#tr.en: Rīm-Sîn, 
#tr.en: prince who reveres Nippur, 
#tr.en: provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa 
#tr.en: and king of Sumer and Akkad, 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ...
#tr.en: the temple ..., 
#tr.en: a residence of relaxation, 
#tr.en: a fitting ornament for his divinity, 
#tr.en: for his life 
#tr.en: and for the life 
#tr.en: of Kudur-mabuk, 
#tr.en: the father who begot him, 
#tr.en: he built for him for future days. 
#tr.en: For this,  
#tr.en: Iškur, his master, 
#tr.en: after he has rejoiced over him, 
#tr.en: for the days of his reign, whose years will be long, 
#tr.en: rains of abundance  
#tr.en: and furrows, the life of the country, 
#tr.en: may he present to him.
#tr.en: For Inanna, the mistress of everything, 
#tr.en: who makes good(?) all the divine powers, 
#tr.en: who holds in her hands the (divine) instructions of the nation, 
#tr.en: the great daughter of Sīn, 
#tr.en: their mistress, 
#tr.en: Kudur-mabuk, 
#tr.en: the father of Emutbala 
#tr.en: and son of Simti-šilḫak, 
#tr.en: and Rīm-Sîn his son, 
#tr.en: the prince who reveres Nippur, 
#tr.en: provider of Ur,  
#tr.en: king of Larsa 
#tr.en: and king of Sumer and Akkad - 
#tr.en: the Temple That Gathers the Divine Powers,
#tr.en: her beloved residence, 
#tr.en: for their lives 
#tr.en: they built for her. 
#tr.en: They raised up its top there 
#tr.en: and made it grow like a mountain range. 
#tr.en: Because of this, 
#tr.en: Inanna, the queen of heaven and earth, 
#tr.en: may she rejoice at them, 
#tr.en: and lives with exalted days, 
#tr.en: long years, a secure reign, 
#tr.en: the unifying of the nation  	
#tr.en: and the exercising of the kingship forever 
#tr.en: from the midst of all the great gods
#tr.en: may she determine as destiny for them.
#tr.en: For Nanaia,  
#tr.en: lady adorned with allure, 
#tr.en: whose beauty is surpassingly great, 
#tr.en: the good daughter of great An, 
#tr.en: their mistress - 
#tr.en: Kudur-mabuk, 
#tr.en: father of Emutbala 
#tr.en: and son of Simti-šilḫak, 
#tr.en: also Rīm-Sîn his son,

#tr.en: her beloved residence, 
#tr.en: for their lives 
#tr.en: they built for her. 
#tr.en: Its top they raised up high there 
#tr.en: and like a mountain range they made it grow. 
#tr.en: For this, 
#tr.en: may Nanaia, 
#tr.en: queen of the female guardian angels, 
#tr.en: rejoice at them,  
#tr.en: and a kingship of happiness, 
#tr.en: a reign of goodness, 
#tr.en: and a responsive(?) guardian angel 
#tr.en: from An and Inanna 
#tr.en: may she request from them. 
#tr.en: For Dumuzi, 
#tr.en: lord of offerings, 
#tr.en: beloved spouse of Inanna, 
#tr.en: shepherd who in the broad steppe 
#tr.en: is fit to bring in (all the animals), 
#tr.en: his master,

#tr.en: a man who reveres Nippur, 
#tr.en: provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa

#tr.en: for his life
#tr.en: and the life 
#tr.en: of Kudur-mabuk,

#tr.en: For this, 
#tr.en: may Dumuzi his master, 
#tr.en: when he has rejoiced over him, 
#tr.en: in the cattle pens and sheepfolds 
#tr.en: multiply the cattle and sheep. 
#tr.en: For Nergal, the exalted lord  
#tr.en: who possesses great strength,  
#tr.en: adorned with fearsomeness and divine radiance, 
#tr.en: foremost one who exerts a ruinous hand against hostile foreign lands, 
#tr.en: heaping up rebel lands into stacks, 
#tr.en: his god, 
#tr.en: Rīm-Sîn, 
#tr.en: the prince who reveres Nippur, 
#tr.en: provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa 
#tr.en: and king of Sumer and Akkad, 
#tr.en: the Temple That Breaks the Enemy 
#tr.en: his residence of heroism, 
#tr.en: which was made suitable for dwelling in, 
#tr.en: for his life
#tr.en: and the life 
#tr.en: of Kudur-mabuk, 
#tr.en: the father who begot him, 
#tr.en: he built for the distant future.
#tr.en: For this, 
#tr.en: Nergal,
#tr.en: the god who engendered him, 
#tr.en: having directed his shining eye at him,   
#tr.en: on the battleground
#tr.en: (with) his steadfast arm   
#tr.en: may he press down together with him,    
#tr.en: and the foreign land that rebels against him   
#tr.en: may he let him conquer. 
#tr.en: For Enki, 
#tr.en: the lord who determines the great destinies, 
#tr.en: who issues all the instructions, 
#tr.en: the all-knowing one, lord, counselor
#tr.en: of the great gods, 
#tr.en: who provides good counsel and understanding,  
#tr.en: great prince whose pronouncements cannot be altered, 
#tr.en: whose word is powerful, 
#tr.en: who multiplies abundance, 
#tr.en: who fills the people with joy 
#tr.en: and apportions the shares to living beings,  
#tr.en: his master - 
#tr.en: Rīm-Sîn, 
#tr.en: the prince who reveres Nippur,

#tr.en: who cares for

#tr.en: who shows fear of the Ebabbar,

#tr.en: the man who renovated the temples of the gods, 
#tr.en: who, having correctly performed their great divine plans and lustration rites, 
#tr.en: daily stands serving at the šita and arazu prayers -

#tr.en: his beloved residence, 
#tr.en: he built for him.
#tr.en: More than previously 
#tr.en: he expanded the Ešusega house,

#tr.en: which ... Enlil

#tr.en: its ebony ...
#tr.en: booty and ...
#tr.en: he brought into Larsa. 
#tr.en: Ninlil, his mistress, 
#tr.en: at his making words beautiful, 
#tr.en: listened to his prayers
#tr.en: and was agreeable to his Raised Hand entreaties. 
#tr.en: At that time, the Temple Worthy of its Lady, 
#tr.en: her belovd residence, 
#tr.en: for his life 
#tr.en: he built for her. 
#tr.en: More than previously 
#tr.en: its Ešusiga house he widened(!), 
#tr.en: raised up its top, 
#tr.en: and made it grow for her like a mountain range. 
#tr.en: For Ningšzida, 
#tr.en: hero with a radiance which inspires fear, whose brow destroys(?) in rage, 
#tr.en: chair-bearer who ... the ki’an, counselor of the netherworld, 
#tr.en: steadfast god who cares for the Ekišnugal, who perfects the princely divine powers, 
#tr.en: my master, 
#tr.en: I, Rīm-Sîn, 
#tr.en: the mighty man,

#tr.en: Isin, Babylon, 
#tr.en: Rapiqum, and Sutium
#tr.en: I struck with weapons, 
#tr.en: and in that battle I captured ARADnene, the king of Uruk, 
#tr.en: through the word of An the king of the gods, 
#tr.en: through the exalted utterance of Enlil my master, 
#tr.en: through Ninlil my mistress, 
#tr.en: through Ninurta the mighty hero, my one who goes at the right side, 
#tr.en: through Nuska the chief minister and father of my palace, 
#tr.en: through the wisdom given me by Enki, 
#tr.en: through Ninhursag, the one who puts goodness on the earth, 
#tr.en: through the favorable (lunar) signs of Nanna, 
#tr.en: through the authority of Utu my master, 
#tr.en: through the positive instructions of Iškur, 
#tr.en: through the power of Nergal, the god who begot me, 
#tr.en: through Inanna, the mistress of my battles, 
#tr.en: through Nininsina, the mistress of my military forces, 
#tr.en: through Ninšenšena my one who shines for me -  
#tr.en: when the various cities of the land of Uruk I had struck down, 
#tr.en: and the booty and property, however much it was, 
#tr.en: to Larsa 
#tr.en: I had brought in, 
#tr.en: at that time, to Ningišzida 
#tr.en: my master 
#tr.en: while I was making beautiful words (of prayer) 
#tr.en: the Temple of Righteousness, 
#tr.en: his beloved residence, 
#tr.en: I built for him for my life. 
#tr.en: I raised up its top 
#tr.en: and made it grow up like a mountain range. 
#tr.en: For Nanna, 
#tr.en: the great lord who raises his head in an aura of fearsome splendor 
#tr.en: and appears resplendently in heaven and earth, 
#tr.en: who makes grow broad awesome brilliance and radiance 
#tr.en: and generates light for the numerous peoples, 
#tr.en: powerful prince whose divine powers are praiseworthy and mighty,  
#tr.en: everything of whom is most holy,

#tr.en: prince beloved by the Ekur temple,

#tr.en: did renovate,

#tr.en: has carried out most perfectly,

#tr.en: stands serving daily -

#tr.en: the residence where she can relax,
#tr.en: for his life
#tr.en: he built for her.

#tr.en: he widened its Ešusiga house, 
#tr.en: raised up its top 
#tr.en: and colored it in a grand manner.

#tr.en: great lord who measures out all the divine powers, 
#tr.en: who well knows the essence of making fine words (of prayer),

#tr.en: whose utterances take precedence, 
#tr.en: his master -

#tr.en: they put into my hand,

#tr.en: through my making fine words (of prayer),  
#tr.en: the Temple That Gives Instructions,  
#tr.en: his beloved residence, 
#tr.en: for my life 
#tr.en: I built for him.

#tr.en: and gives responses to all the great gods,

#tr.en: the youth who heeds the Great Mountain (Enlil),

#tr.en: who makes perfect the divine powers and plans of Eridu, 
#tr.en: the faithful farmer and provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: who shows fear of the Ebabbar, 
#tr.en: who tends to Girsu and the whole area of Lagaš, 
#tr.en: whose finely wrought words (of prayer) are lofty, 
#tr.en: who makes the Ebabbar very great, 
#tr.en: who makes unceasing the food offerings 
#tr.en: to Lugalgudua 
#tr.en: and brings regular offerings to the Eanna (in Uruk), 
#tr.en: the king of Larsa 
#tr.en: and king of Sumer and Akkad - 
#tr.en: when An, Enlil, Enki 
#tr.en: and all the great gods 
#tr.en: Uruk, the ancient city, 
#tr.en: they put fully into my hands, 
#tr.en: for this, 
#tr.en: for Ninšubur my master, 
#tr.en: at my establishing colleagueship (with him), 
#tr.en: the Temple Which Raises its Top Within All the Divine Powers, 
#tr.en: the residence worthy of his divinity, 
#tr.en: for my life 
#tr.en: I built. 
#tr.en: More than previously 
#tr.en: I widened its Ešusiga house, 
#tr.en: and foundation documents showing my name and kingship, 
#tr.en: I put there for future days. 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ... their lots, 
#tr.en: having requested ...,  
#tr.en: Enanedu, 
#tr.en: the beloved en priestess of Inanna,  
#tr.en: ... chosen by (her) sacred heart, 
#tr.en: daughter of Kudur-mabuk, 
#tr.en: to whom Enki wisdom 
#tr.en: did give, 
#tr.en: gathered up the divine powers from the Ekišnugal temple, 
#tr.en: and the canal ..., the canal which brings abundance, 
#tr.en: ...
#tr.en: ... Great Mountain (Enlil) ...,
#tr.en: the city ..., 
#tr.en: the city Bīt-Šu-Sîn, 
#tr.en: the city Imgur-Gibil, 
#tr.en: Dũrum, 
#tr.en: Kisurra, 
#tr.en: and Uruk - their kings 
#tr.en: and all their lands -
#tr.en: when he had conquered them, 
#tr.en: over them(!) he ..., 
#tr.en: and he demolished their walls. 
#tr.en: Because of this, 
#tr.en: ...
#tr.en: When An, Enlil, Enki, and Ninmah
#tr.en: directed a righteous eye towards me, 
#tr.en: and when for Larsa, their beloved leveled place, 
#tr.en: they determined its destiny.  
#tr.en: and with their unalterable word they commanded its creation, 
#tr.en: and a reign of abundance with unceasing water 
#tr.en: they presented to me. 
#tr.en: Everlasting water as the portion of the nation, 
#tr.en: water which the Tigris and Euphrates 
#tr.en: since ancient times had always brought forth
#tr.en: and at no time ever ceases, 
#tr.en: half of it the Mamišarrat Canal, the canal of abundance of the nation,  
#tr.en: whose waters were from the Tigris and the Euphrates, 
#tr.en: when it had taken them away from there 
#tr.en: it poured them into the Sea. 
#tr.en: Lord Nunamnir, whose utterances create with great care, 
#tr.en: turned towards the shepherd who pleased him 
#tr.en: and, having spoken joyously, determined for him a good fate: 
#tr.en: (namely) to dig canals in order into Sumer and Akkad    
#tr.en: to bring waters of abundance, 
#tr.en: to make the speckled barley grow on its great agricultural tracts, 
#tr.en: to make its irrigated orchards richly produce date syrup and grapes, 
#tr.en: to make its marshes joyfully provide fish and birds,  
#tr.en: Great Mountain Enlil issued the great orders.   
#tr.en: I who am the (god-)fearing shepherd who walks beside Enlil,  
#tr.en: I, Rīm-Sîn, who am the man of Great Mountain Enlil,  
#tr.en: one who possesses wisdom and perfects true intelligence, 
#tr.en: I, Rīm-Sîn, the faithful shepherd of the Blacked Headed (People),  
#tr.en: when the wide wisdom given to me by Enki  
#tr.en: he improved(?) regarding it, to dig the canal 
#tr.en: he inspired me. 
#tr.en: When Enlil(?) had inspired(?) me to do it, 
#tr.en: that canal alongside the Mama-šarrat canal, the canal of abundance of the nation, 
#tr.en: ... I dug, 
#tr.en: ...
#tr.en: and skillfully I executed the plans ... 
#tr.en: When the numerous peoples whose shepherding Enlil gave to me 
#tr.en: from below and above I had brought together, 
#tr.en: by my mighty strength I did the task.
#tr.en: When I had built its two levees like a mountain range, I filled them up with divine radiance. 
#tr.en: After I had secured abundant water at its intake,  
#tr.en: I continued extending its outlet. 
#tr.en: Upon its banks I multiplied luxuriant sweet-smelling grasses. 
#tr.en: That canal - the Tuqmat-Erra Canal 
#tr.en: they named it. 
#tr.en: The everlasting waters of both the Tigris and the Euphrates  
#tr.en: I restored.
#tr.en: I, Rīm-Sîn, the king of Larsa 
#tr.en: and king of Sumer and Akkad, 
#tr.en: I made secure the foundations of my wide country. 
#tr.en: I restored its cities and settlements. 
#tr.en: For my numerous people I established food to eat and water to drink. 
#tr.en: When I had unified harmoniously Sumer and Akkad, 
#tr.en: I indeed pleased the heart of Enlil. 
#tr.en: For this, may An, Enlil, Enki and Ninmah 
#tr.en: give to me a long life,  
#tr.en: and a reign of abundance, a throne with a firm foundation 
#tr.en: may they present to me. 
#tr.en: When I have had foundation documents inscribed to praise my royal revealed name, 
#tr.en: the numerous peoples will praise me forever. 
#tr.en: For Ninegal, 
#tr.en: the great lady who holds all the divine powers in her hands,  
#tr.en: who sees the numerous peoples,  
#tr.en: exalted counselor, overseer of the Black Headed (People) 
#tr.en: whose ways are unrivaled, 
#tr.en: authoritative one of the assembly, whose utterance takes precedence, 
#tr.en: whose name is ... for praise, 
#tr.en: steadfast goddess from the father who engendered her, 
#tr.en: whose speech is favorable,
#tr.en: great daughter of Suen,  
#tr.en: her mistress, 
#tr.en: Simat-Ištar, 
#tr.en: beloved wife 
#tr.en: of Rīm-Sîn 
#tr.en: the king of Larsa,  
#tr.en: daughter of Warad-Nanna - 
#tr.en: when Ninegal her mistress 
#tr.en: called her good name, 
#tr.en: the Temple That Assembles All the Instructions, 
#tr.en: the residence worthy of her divinity, 
#tr.en: in order that the life of Rīm-Sîn 
#tr.en: might exist forever, 
#tr.en: and for her own life, 
#tr.en: she built.
#tr.en: More than previously 
#tr.en: she widened its Ešusiga house, 
#tr.en: and foundation documents revealing her queenly name 
#tr.en: she placed there for all future time.
#tr.en: For Ninegal, 
#tr.en: the great lady, who all the Black Headed (People)   
#tr.en: An, Enlil, and Enki 
#tr.en: filled into her hands, 
#tr.en: who correctly delivers verdicts and decisions, 
#tr.en: the all-knwing counselor and inquirer, 
#tr.en: the one who among all the great gods  
#tr.en: whose august spoken words cannot be altered, 
#tr.en: where her bright eye roams in the wide heavens, 
#tr.en: in the place where she directs her righteous eye 
#tr.en: a trusty protective genie 
#tr.en: she provides, 
#tr.en: goddess with far-reachng mercy, whose compassion is sweet, 
#tr.en: who listens to prayers and entreaties, 
#tr.en: great daughter of the god Suen, 
#tr.en: who assembles the commands of heaven and earth, 
#tr.en: her lady - 
#tr.en: Simat-Eštar,  
#tr.en: beloved spouse 
#tr.en: of Rīm-Sîn, 
#tr.en: the youth who listens to Enlil, 
#tr.en: and looks to An, chosen by the pure heart, 
#tr.en: king beloved of the great gods, 
#tr.en: whose šuila-prayers are agreeable, 
#tr.en: shepherd who makes the tribute sparkle for Nippur, 
#tr.en: who perfects the divine powers and plans of Eridu, 
#tr.en: reliable farmer, provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: who reveres the Ebabbar temple, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa  
#tr.en: and king of Sumer and Akkad: 
#tr.en: (Simat-Eštar), the humble woman, 
#tr.en: ornament befitting the king,  
#tr.en: whose lofty finely-crafted words   
#tr.en: are for Ninegal, 
#tr.en: when Ninegal, her lady,  
#tr.en: faithfully spoke her good name, 
#tr.en: the Temple That Assembles All the Instructions,   
#tr.en: the residence befitting her divinity, 
#tr.en: she raised up its top like a mountain,  
#tr.en: and so that the life of Rīm-Sîn 
#tr.en: would exist forever,  
#tr.en: and for her own life,  
#tr.en: she built it for him, 
#tr.en: and foundation documents revealing the name 
#tr.en: of her queenliness 
#tr.en: for future days she put there. 
#tr.en: For Ninsiana, 
#tr.en: goddess whose (astral) station shines forth from pure heaven, 
#tr.en: whose light appears resplendently, 
#tr.en: exalted one who fills the great dining hall, 
#tr.en: whose speech is favorable, 
#tr.en: authoritative one, whose Amen in the assembly is weighty, 
#tr.en: who goes at the fore of the great gods, 
#tr.en: foremost heroine who makes perfect the artful divine powers, 
#tr.en: who establishes discernment and understanding in heaven, 
#tr.en: exalted judge and councelor 
#tr.en: who reckons what is true and what is false, 
#tr.en: goddess full of compassion, who for the person who fears her 
#tr.en: a protective genie of well-being, a guardian angel with a holy exterior, 
#tr.en: and a tremendously long life 
#tr.en: she will bring about for that one, 
#tr.en: my 'master', 
#tr.en: I, Rīm-Sîn, 
#tr.en: the mighty man, 
#tr.en: whose meal offerings are great 
#tr.en: for the shrine Nippur, 
#tr.en: who makes perfect the divine powers and plans of Eridu, 
#tr.en: the provider of Ur, 
#tr.en: one who shows fear of the Ebabbar temple, 
#tr.en: the king of Larsa,  
#tr.en: Uruk, and Isin, 
#tr.en: king of Sumer and Akkad - 
#tr.en: when Ninsiana 
#tr.en: my enemies 
#tr.en: put fully into my hand, 
#tr.en: because of this 
#tr.en: for Ninsiana my 'master'  
#tr.en: as I had established colleagueship (with her), 
#tr.en: the Temple of True (Oracular) Decisions,  
#tr.en: as befits her divinity, 
#tr.en: the residence that gladdens her heart, 
#tr.en: on a pure place I built. 
#tr.en: On the door jambs 
#tr.en: and architraves of the temple,  
#tr.en: for the distant future, 
#tr.en: I inscribed my name. 
#tr.en: For Amagula, 
#tr.en: great lady who everywhere is mighty (...), 
#tr.en: whose divine radiance is powerful,   
#tr.en: powerful goddess with an opressive, fierce, great fearsomeness,  
#tr.en: whose fearsomeness covers the country, 
#tr.en: wife of the mighty hero 
#tr.en: lord Nergal, 
#tr.en: who exercises her ladyship on the battlefield, 
#tr.en: steadfast goddess of the person who makes a colleagueship (with her), 
#tr.en: but who (also) uproots life, 
#tr.en: my mistress - 
#tr.en: Rīm-Sîn, 
#tr.en: the mighty man, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa, 
#tr.en: Uruk, and Isin,
#tr.en: and king of Sumer and Akkad, 
#tr.en: when Isin, 
#tr.en: the city of kingship, 
#tr.en: she put fully into my hands, 
#tr.en: because of this 
#tr.en: for Amagula my mistress 
#tr.en: the ... (temple), 
#tr.en: ..., 
#tr.en: her residence of relaxation, 
#tr.en: ... I built there. 
#tr.en: Like a risen up mountain I lifted it up,   
#tr.en: and upon ... 
#tr.en: ... I made it grow forth.
#tr.en: Enanedu, 
#tr.en: en priestess of Nanna, 
#tr.en: having the great fate of the en office from the womb on, a nobility of heaven, 
#tr.en: beloved of (her) heart, the brightness(?) of the en office set upon her body by Ningal's own hand,  
#tr.en: fitting one of the Ekišnugal temple, the rival of high heaven, 
#tr.en: ornament of the agrun cella, burning light coming forth for the nation, 
#tr.en: sacredly suited for the crown of the en office, 
#tr.en: properly chosen for the divine plans and lustrations of the en office, 
#tr.en: reverent princess who serves at the lustrations for the exalted platform of the royal house, 
#tr.en: I, Enanedu, 
#tr.en: the en priestess who may look upon Nanna and Ningal 
#tr.en: (in) Ur, the foremost city of Sumer, 
#tr.en: where zanaru instruments are played for Ašimbabbar, 
#tr.en: a person most fitting for the gipar built on a pure place for its office of en - 
#tr.en: when Nanna and Ningal 
#tr.en: having looked (at me) with their shining brows, and life 
#tr.en: and a joyous regard they gave to me,  
#tr.en: and in the shrine Ekišnugal, the residence of their divinity, 
#tr.en: they having exalted my name,  
#tr.en: having placed in my pure mouth prayers of life,
#tr.en: and my correctly guiding hand - in order that the life of Rīm-Sîn, 
#tr.en: my twin(!) brother, 
#tr.en: could be extended - they, togther with him, did exert it,  
#tr.en: and so his foreign enemies 
#tr.en: they having put fully into his hands -
#tr.en: at that time, the sacred gipar, my residence of the en office, 
#tr.en: its bricks no longer lying against(?) its base, 
#tr.en: I, Enanedu, 
#tr.en: en priestess, truly named with an exalted name, 
#tr.en: the daughter of Kudur-mabuk, 
#tr.en: I laid correctly fitting bricks against the old base of the sacred gipar. 
#tr.en: I covered with plaster its inner walls fitted to (within) a finger-length. 
#tr.en: I created that house anew. 
#tr.en: At that time, the Hall That Has Brought Bitterness, the cleared land of 'fates' 
#tr.en: (where) the old en priestesses were, 
#tr.en: that place was not encircled with a wall, and its entrances and its .. had collapsed. 
#tr.en: No watch was set up and that place was no longer pure. 
#tr.en: I, by my great wisdom, 
#tr.en: sought out a place for (going to one's) fate forever afterward.  
#tr.en: Surpassing the resting place of the old en priestesses 
#tr.en: I established a broad sacred area. 
#tr.en: I surrounded that collapsed place with a big wall,
#tr.en: set there a strong watch, and I purified that place. 
#tr.en: To show my name chosen for the office of en,  
#tr.en: I did indeed restore this work. 
#tr.en: Foundation documents in praise of my office of en I had inscribed 
#tr.en: and had it laid there for whatsoever time it may exist.  
#tr.en: I named that wall: May the One Who Shows Fear of Me Be Praised.

#tr.en: her mistress, 
#tr.en: for the life 
#tr.en: of Rīm-Sîn, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa, 
#tr.en: Iltani, 
#tr.en: daughter of Ilum-bāni, 
#tr.en: (this) dish
#tr.en: for her life 
#tr.en: she presented.

#tr.en: For Inanna, 
#tr.en: the angry goddess, with head held high in the throne room, 
#tr.en: exalted one, brightest in all the lands, 
#tr.en: whose face is full of radiance, 
#tr.en: steadfast goddess whose proud heart is good,  
#tr.en: she of far-reaching compassion who those in straights and sickness  
#tr.en: she knows well how to take in hand, 
#tr.en: my lady - 
#tr.en: for the life 
#tr.en: of Rīm-Sîn, 
#tr.en: king of Larsa, 
#tr.en: and of Lirīš-gamlum his daughter, 
#tr.en: I, Rīm-Sîn-Šala-bāštašu, 
#tr.en: beloved wife of Rīm-Sîn,
#tr.en: daughter of Sîn-māgir,
#tr.en: the humble woman, 
#tr.en: ornament worthy of kingship -  
#tr.en: when my lady by a beautiful name 
#tr.en: truly called me, 
#tr.en: for this, to Inanna, 
#tr.en: as I made fine words (of prayer), 
#tr.en: a vessel of diorite stone
#tr.en: suitable for pure touching-water - 
#tr.en: something which previously no queen who came before me 
#tr.en: had ever fashioned - 
#tr.en: when I had fashioned it, 
#tr.en: at the sacred gate of the main courtyard of the Emeurur temple 
#tr.en: a place of marvel of the nation 
#tr.en: I happily set it up . 
#tr.en: In order from evil-doers and violent men  
#tr.en: to keep Lirīš-gamlum away,  
#tr.en: and the asakku or ašbur diseases that may be in her body 
#tr.en: to give over (instead) to that which knows not fear, 
#tr.en: to remove the šahal from within her eye, 
#tr.en: and to act as guardian for her life, 
#tr.en: for the life of Lirīš-gamlum my daughter 
#tr.en: and for my own life, 
#tr.en: I, the servant who has fear of her (Inanna),
#tr.en: dedicated it (this object) to her.
#tr.en: For ever after today,  
#tr.en: a person who may efface the work I have made, 
#tr.en: who shall remove it from its standing place 
#tr.en: and stand it up in another place, 
#tr.en: who shall erase its inscription 
#tr.en: and inscribe his own name upon it, 
#tr.en: or because of this curse 
#tr.en: shall incite a stranger to it,  
#tr.en: upon that person may Inanna, queen of all the lands, 
#tr.en: with her angry heart and fury  
#tr.en: wreak upon him a grievous curse.

#tr.en: the mighty king,

#tr.en: when Utu my master  
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: the ... 
#tr.en: to widen   
#tr.en: when he told me, 
#tr.en: I heeded him.   
#tr.en: He spoke to me joyously 
#tr.en: and gave me that order. 
#tr.en: At that time, 
#tr.en: to increase food, 
#tr.en: in a flooded agricultural tract 
#tr.en: when I had put up levees,  
#tr.en: on top of that 
#tr.en: the wall of a cloister
#tr.en: I built.

#tr.en: the Aia is Abundance canal 
#tr.en: I dug out,

#tr.en: I let flow in it. 
#tr.en: Because of this, 
#tr.en: may Aia,

#tr.en: rejoice over me,

#tr.en: may she present them to me. 
#tr.en: When Šamaš, 
#tr.en: the great lord 
#tr.en: of heavan and earth, 
#tr.en: king of the gods, 
#tr.en: at me, Hammurapi, 
#tr.en: his favorite prince, 
#tr.en: with his shining face, 
#tr.en: happily 
#tr.en: he looked, 
#tr.en: and everlasting kingship 
#tr.en: and a reign of long days 
#tr.en: he presented to me, 
#tr.en: and the foundation of the nation, 
#tr.en: which to rule 
#tr.en: he gave me, 
#tr.en: he made firm for me, 
#tr.en: in order the people of Sippar 
#tr.en: and Babylon 
#tr.en: in peaceful residences 
#tr.en: to settle, 
#tr.en: with his pure mouth, 
#tr.en: which cannot be altered, he spoke, 
#tr.en: and the wall of Sippar 
#tr.en: to build 
#tr.en: and its top to raise up, 
#tr.en: he greatly commanded me. 
#tr.en: At that time, 
#tr.en: Hammurapi, 
#tr.en: the mighty king, 
#tr.en: king of Babylon, 
#tr.en: the reverent one who heeds Šamaš, 
#tr.en: the beloved of Aia, 
#tr.en: who pleases the heart 
#tr.en: of Marduk, his lord, I, 
#tr.en: by the supreme power 
#tr.en: which Šamaš gave me, 
#tr.en: with a levy 
#tr.en: of the army of my land, 
#tr.en: the foundations of the wall of Sippar 
#tr.en: with earth 
#tr.en: like a big mountain 
#tr.en: I raised their top, 
#tr.en: and the great wall I did indeed build. 
#tr.en: That which since a distant time 
#tr.en: any kings among kings 
#tr.en: none had never built, 
#tr.en: for Šamaš my lord 
#tr.en: I did indeed build in a grand manner. 
#tr.en: That wall: 
#tr.en: By the Command of Šamaš 
#tr.en: May Hammurapi 
#tr.en: Have No Equal 
#tr.en: is its name. 
#tr.en: In the fine reign 
#tr.en: which Šamaš ordered, 
#tr.en: (for) Sippar, 
#tr.en: the ancient city of Šamaš, 
#tr.en: its people from corvée service 
#tr.en: for Šamaš I removed. 
#tr.en: I dug its canal 
#tr.en: and for its land 
#tr.en: everlasting water 
#tr.en: I did establish. 
#tr.en: Plenty and abundance 
#tr.en: I heaped up. 
#tr.en: For the people of Sippar 
#tr.en: I established joy. 
#tr.en: For my life 
#tr.en: they indeed pray. 
#tr.en: What to Šamaš my lord 
#tr.en: and Aia my lady 
#tr.en: was pleasing I truly accomplished. 
#tr.en: My fine name, 
#tr.en: to have it daily 
#tr.en: spoken like (that of) a god 
#tr.en: so that forever 
#tr.en: it may not be forgotten, 
#tr.en: in the mouths of the people 
#tr.en: indeed I put. 
#tr.en: When Utu, 
#tr.en: great lord of heaven and earth, 
#tr.en: king of the gods, 
#tr.en: at me, Hammurapi, 
#tr.en: the prince agreeable to him, 
#tr.en: with his shining eyes 
#tr.en: happily 
#tr.en: looked, 
#tr.en: and an everlasting kingship 
#tr.en: and a reign of long days 
#tr.en: he presented to me; 
#tr.en: and the foundation of the land, 
#tr.en: to exercise the lordship over which 
#tr.en: he gave to me, 
#tr.en: he made secure for me; 
#tr.en: of Sippar 
#tr.en: and Babylon their people 
#tr.en: to settle in peaceful habitations 
#tr.en: with his holy word that cannot be altered 
#tr.en: he commanded me, 
#tr.en: and the wall of Sippar 
#tr.en: to build 
#tr.en: and its top to raise up 
#tr.en: he gave me the great order. 
#tr.en: At that time, 
#tr.en: I, Hammurapi, 
#tr.en: the mighty king, 
#tr.en: king of Babylon, 
#tr.en: (god-)fearing one 
#tr.en: who heeds Utu, 
#tr.en: who is the beloved of Šerda, 
#tr.en: who pleases the heart of Marduk 
#tr.en: his master - 
#tr.en: by the exalted strength which Utu 
#tr.en: gave me, 
#tr.en: through a troop levy 
#tr.en: of my land 
#tr.en: the foundation of the wall of Sippar 
#tr.en: with earth like a huge mountain 
#tr.en: its top I raised up, 
#tr.en: and the great wall I built. 
#tr.en: That which since olden days 
#tr.en: among all the kings 
#tr.en: no king 
#tr.en: had ever built, 
#tr.en: for Utu my master 
#tr.en: I built in a grand manner. 
#tr.en: That wall: 
#tr.en: By the Command of Utu 
#tr.en: May Hammurapi 
#tr.en: Have No Equal 
#tr.en: is its name. 
#tr.en: In my favorable reign 
#tr.en: which Utu 
#tr.en: called, 
#tr.en: for Sippar, 
#tr.en: the ancient city 
#tr.en: of Utu, 
#tr.en: its men from corvēe work 
#tr.en: for Utu I removed. 
#tr.en: Its canal 
#tr.en: I dug, 
#tr.en: and in its emplacements 
#tr.en: perpetual water 
#tr.en: I established. 
#tr.en: Abundance and plenty 
#tr.en: I established everywhere there. 
#tr.en: For the people of Sippar 
#tr.en: I produced joy, 
#tr.en: and (so) for my life 
#tr.en: they indeed prayed. 
#tr.en: What for the well-being of Utu my master 
#tr.en: and Aia my mistress 
#tr.en: was good I did. 
#tr.en: That my good name 
#tr.en: daily 
#tr.en: might be revealed like (that of) a god, 
#tr.en: and that forever 
#tr.en: it may not be forgotten, 
#tr.en: I put it in the mouths of the people. 
#tr.en: For Enlil, 
#tr.en: great lord 
#tr.en: of heaven and earth, 
#tr.en: king of the gods, 
#tr.en: my lord, 
#tr.en: Hammurapi, 
#tr.en: prince favored by Enlil,

#tr.en: to exercise lordship 
#tr.en: he gave to me, (and) the lead-rope of them 
#tr.en: into my hand 
#tr.en: he put, 
#tr.en: at that time, in Babylon 
#tr.en: his beloved city, 
#tr.en: a storehouse, 
#tr.en: a delight of his heart, I built. 
#tr.en: What was on an inscription of the Enamtila temple 
#tr.en: of Hammurapi the king. Rēmūt-Gula, 
#tr.en: descendant of Ša-rēš-s,ābim, the apprentice merchant and junior musician, wrote (it) 
#tr.en: (and) for his life, happiness, and the hearing of his prayers, 
#tr.en: put it in Ezida, the temple beloved of Nabû.

#tr.en: the canal (named) Hammurapi is the Abundance of the People, 
#tr.en: which brings the waters of abundance 
#tr.en: to the lands of Sumer 
#tr.en: and Akkad, I did indeed dig. 
#tr.en: Both its banks 
#tr.en: I turned into cultivated fields, 
#tr.en: and piles of grain 
#tr.en: I heaped up again and again. 
#tr.en: Perpetual water 
#tr.en: for the lands of Sumer 
#tr.en: and Akkad I did indeed establish, 
#tr.en: and of the lands of Sumer 
#tr.en: and Akkad 
#tr.en: their scattered peoples 
#tr.en: I did indeed gather, 
#tr.en: and pastures and watering places 
#tr.en: I established for them. 
#tr.en: In abundance and plenty 
#tr.en: I did indeed shepherd them, 
#tr.en: and in peaceful habitations 
#tr.en: I caused them to dwell. 
#tr.en: At that time, 
#tr.en: Hammurapi 
#tr.en: the mighty king, 
#tr.en: favored one of the great gods, I - 
#tr.en: through the mighty powers 
#tr.en: which Marduk gave to me, 
#tr.en: a high walled-fortress, 
#tr.en: with much earth, 
#tr.en: whose tops 
#tr.en: were like a mountain, I raised up. 
#tr.en: At the intake of the Hammurapi is the Abundance of the People canal 
#tr.en: I built it. 
#tr.en: That fortress:

#tr.en: the Father Who Engendered Me 
#tr.en: throughout the world quarters 
#tr.en: I truly made manifest.

#tr.en: his grandfather,

#tr.en: he made famous.

#tr.en: king of the gods, 
#tr.en: great lord 
#tr.en: of the lands, 
#tr.en: at Šamaš with his features 
#tr.en: excellent 
#tr.en: looked, and

#tr.en: into their residence 
#tr.en: sacred 
#tr.en: in joy 
#tr.en: and rejoicing to let enter, 
#tr.en: with his utterance which cannot 
#tr.en: be altered 
#tr.en: he commanded, 
#tr.en: at that time, 
#tr.en: the hero, youthful Šamaš - 
#tr.en: for the great destinies 
#tr.en: which Enlil 
#tr.en: for Sippar 
#tr.en: and the Ebabbar had decreed 
#tr.en: joyfylly 
#tr.en: having been established for him - 
#tr.en: Samsu-iluna, 
#tr.en: the king, the creation 
#tr.en: of his hand, me, 
#tr.en: he gladly called, and 
#tr.en: that order 
#tr.en: he gave me. 
#tr.en: At that time, the totality 
#tr.en: of the land of Sumer 
#tr.en: and Akkad, 
#tr.en: which had become hostile to me, 
#tr.en: within 
#tr.en: one year 
#tr.en: eight times 
#tr.en: I indeed slaughtered with weapons. 
#tr.en: The cities of those hostile to me 
#tr.en: into mounds and ruins 
#tr.en: I indeed turned. 
#tr.en: The foundations of the enemies and evil ones 
#tr.en: in the country I tore out. 
#tr.en: The whole country 
#tr.en: under my command 
#tr.en: I made to dwell. 
#tr.en: Since the distant day 
#tr.en: when the brickwork of the Ebabbar 
#tr.en: had been constructed, 
#tr.en: among former kings 
#tr.en: no king 
#tr.en: had been favored by Šamaš and so 
#tr.en: the wall of Sippar 
#tr.en: did not build for him, but 
#tr.en: Samsu-iluna, 
#tr.en: the beloved of Šamaš and Aia, 
#tr.en: the mighty king, 
#tr.en: king of Babylon 
#tr.en: and king of the world quarters 
#tr.en: four, 
#tr.en: the king whose decrees 
#tr.en: with Šamaš and Aia 
#tr.en: find favor, I - 
#tr.en: at the command of Šamaš 
#tr.en: and Marduk 
#tr.en: by a levy 
#tr.en: of the army of my land 
#tr.en: in the middle 
#tr.en: of that year 
#tr.en: its bricks I formed, 
#tr.en: and the wall of Sippar 
#tr.en: like a great mountain 
#tr.en: I raised up. 
#tr.en: The Ebabbar I renovated, 
#tr.en: their ziggurrat's 
#tr.en: high terrace 
#tr.en: exalted 
#tr.en: its top like heaven 
#tr.en: I raised. 
#tr.en: Šamaš, Iškur and Aia 
#tr.en: into their residence 
#tr.en: sacred 
#tr.en: in joy and rejoicing 
#tr.en: I caused to enter. 
#tr.en: To the Ebabbar its guardian genius 
#tr.en: favorable 
#tr.en: I returned. 
#tr.en: That which to Šamaš, 
#tr.en: Iškur, and Aia 
#tr.en: was pleasing I did. 
#tr.en: The command of Šamaš 
#tr.en: and Marduk 
#tr.en: I well executed. 
#tr.en: That wall: Šamaš 
#tr.en: to Samsu-iluna 
#tr.en: Has Given 
#tr.en: Dominion, Power 
#tr.en: and Life is its name. 
#tr.en: For this, Šamaš, 
#tr.en: the one who upholds 
#tr.en: his kingship, 
#tr.en: life, happiness 
#tr.en: of heart 
#tr.en: everlasting, 
#tr.en: a kingship which a rival 
#tr.en: will not have, 
#tr.en: a scepter of justice 
#tr.en: that makes the land secure, 
#tr.en: a strong weapon 
#tr.en: that slays the enemies, 
#tr.en: and rule over the four world 
#tr.en: quarters 
#tr.en: to exercise forever, 
#tr.en: as his gift 
#tr.en: he gave to him. 
#tr.en: The year had not reached the middle, when 
#tr.en: Rīm-Sîn,

#tr.en: When Anum and Enlil, 
#tr.en: the kings of heaven and earth, 
#tr.en: at Marduk, 
#tr.en: the first-born son of Ea, 
#tr.en: looked happily 
#tr.en: and the rule over the four world quarters 
#tr.en: did give to him, 
#tr.en: among the Anunnaku 
#tr.en: did call him by an exalted name, 
#tr.en: (and) Babylon's 
#tr.en: foundation like heaven and earth 
#tr.en: did make secure for him - 
#tr.en: then Marduk 
#tr.en: the Enlil of his land, 
#tr.en: the divine creator of wisdom, 
#tr.en: to Samsu-iluna, 
#tr.en: the king of his delight, me - 
#tr.en: the totality of the lands 
#tr.en: he gave me for shepherding, 
#tr.en: (and) to make his land lie down in riverine meadows 
#tr.en: (and) his wide-spread people 
#tr.en: in well-being 
#tr.en: to lead forever 
#tr.en: he ordered me grandly. 
#tr.en: Samsu-iluna, 
#tr.en: the mighty king, 
#tr.en: king of Babylon, 
#tr.en: the king who makes harmonious 
#tr.en: the world quarters 
#tr.en: the four, I - 
#tr.en: by my own power 
#tr.en: (and) by my great intelligence 
#tr.en: the fort Dimat-Enlil, 
#tr.en: for Ninmah 
#tr.en: the mother who created me, 
#tr.en: the fort Pada 
#tr.en: for Iškur my helper, 
#tr.en: fort Lagaba
