#tr.en: fort Iri-Iabušum 
#tr.en: for Šar-ṣarbatim 
#tr.en: who magnifies my kingship, 
#tr.en: fort Iri-Gulaba 
#tr.en: and the fort Uṣi-ana-Erra 
#tr.en: for Nergal, 
#tr.en: the smiter of my enemies, 
#tr.en: these six great forts 
#tr.en: which Sūmû-la-Il, 
#tr.en: my great forefather, 
#tr.en: my forefather 
#tr.en: of the fifth (generation), had built, 
#tr.en: (but) which in their old age 
#tr.en: of ther own accord 
#tr.en: had fallen into ruin, 
#tr.en: within two months 
#tr.en: their bricks I had made 
#tr.en: and I rebuilt them in a grand fashion. 
#tr.en: Their tops I raised up like mountains, 
#tr.en: (and so) I secured the foundations of the totality of the lands. 
#tr.en: The name of Babylon 
#tr.en: I made supreme, 
#tr.en: and in the four world quarters 
#tr.en: I indeed made it pre-eminent. 
#tr.en: The fearsomeness of the divine radiance of my kingship 
#tr.en: the borders of heaven and earth 
#tr.en: did indeed cover. 
#tr.en: For this, the great gods 
#tr.en: with their shining faces 
#tr.en: indeed looked at me, 
#tr.en: (and) life, which like that of Sîn 
#tr.en: is monthly 
#tr.en: renewed; 
#tr.en: the shepherding of the four world quarters 
#tr.en: in peace 
#tr.en: to exercise forever; 
#tr.en: the desire of my heart 
#tr.en: to attain, like a god; 
#tr.en: (and) daily with a high head 
#tr.en: in joy 
#tr.en: and happiness 
#tr.en: to walk, 
#tr.en: for a gift 
#tr.en: they did indeed present to me. 
#tr.en: ... fired long tablet 
#tr.en: (which) ... from its top 
#tr.en: he wrote ... 
#tr.en: When An and Enlil, 
#tr.en: the kings of heaven and earth, 
#tr.en: toward Marduk, the first-born son 
#tr.en: of Enki, 
#tr.en: their joyful eyes 
#tr.en: did direct, 
#tr.en: the rule of the four world quarters 
#tr.en: did give to him, 
#tr.en: before the Anunna gods 
#tr.en: his exalted name did call, 
#tr.en: and Babylon's 
#tr.en: foundation, like that of heaven and earth 
#tr.en: did make firm for him - 
#tr.en: then Marduk, 
#tr.en: the Enlil of his land, 
#tr.en: the god who wisdom 
#tr.en: creates, 
#tr.en: to me, Samsu-iluna, 
#tr.en: who is the king his delight, 
#tr.en: of all those lands 
#tr.en: to exercise their shepherding 
#tr.en: he did give me, 
#tr.en: and his country 
#tr.en: to make lie down in riverine meadows, 
#tr.en: and his wide-spread people 
#tr.en: to lead forever in well-being, 
#tr.en: he issued to me (these) great instructions. 
#tr.en: I, Samsu-iluna, 
#tr.en: the mighty king, 
#tr.en: king of Babylon, 
#tr.en: king who among the four world quarters 
#tr.en: established harmony, 
#tr.en: by my own power

#tr.en: the fort Lagaba

#tr.en: the fort Iri-Iabušum

#tr.en: because my kingship 
#tr.en: he had made very great, 
#tr.en: the fort Iri-Gulaba 
#tr.en: and the fort Uṣi-ana-Erra 
#tr.en: for Nergal 
#tr.en: because the smiting of my foes 
#tr.en: he did accomplish, 
#tr.en: these six great fortressess 
#tr.en: which Sūmû-la-Il, 
#tr.en: my forefather 
#tr.en: my fifth(-generation) ancestor, 
#tr.en: did build, 
#tr.en: but which in their old age by themselves 
#tr.en: did collapse, 
#tr.en: within two months 
#tr.en: their bricks I had made, 
#tr.en: and I rebuilt them in a grand fashion. 
#tr.en: Their tops I raised up like mountains, 
#tr.en: (and thus) of the whole of the lands 
#tr.en: their foundations I made secure. 
#tr.en: Babylon's 
#tr.en: name I made supreme, 
#tr.en: and within the four world quarters I truly made it pre-eminent. 
#tr.en: The fearsomeness of the divine radiance 
#tr.en: of my kingship 
#tr.en: truly covered the edges of heaven and earth. 
#tr.en: For this, 
#tr.en: the great gods 
#tr.en: their shining faces 
#tr.en: they directed towards me, 
#tr.en: and life, which like (the moon-god) Nanna 
#tr.en: waxes month after month, 
#tr.en: shepherdship of the four world quarters 
#tr.en: to exercise in well-being forever, 
#tr.en: the desire of my heart 
#tr.en: to attain like a god, 
#tr.en: (and) daily with an uplifted head 
#tr.en: to walk in joy and happiness 
#tr.en: they presented to me as a gift. 
#tr.en: Samsu-iluna, 
#tr.en: the mighty king, 
#tr.en: king 
#tr.en: of Babylon, 
#tr.en: king 
#tr.en: of Kiš, 
#tr.en: king 
#tr.en: of the four world quarters, 
#tr.en: the ziggurrat, the lofty residence 
#tr.en: of Zababa 
#tr.en: and Inanna 
#tr.en: in Kiš
#tr.en: he renovated, 
#tr.en: and its top (as high) as the sky 
#tr.en: he raised up there. 
#tr.en: Enlil, whose lordship 
#tr.en: is the greatest among the gods, 
#tr.en: the shepherd who determines the destinies, 
#tr.en: Zababa and Ištar, 
#tr.en: the warriors among the Igigi gods, 
#tr.en: with his pure face 
#tr.en: he regarded them, and 
#tr.en: the city Kiš, the foremost cult site, 
#tr.en: their exalted residence, 
#tr.en: to built its wall, 
#tr.en: and its top more than before 
#tr.en: to raise up, 
#tr.en: his heart truly moved him. 
#tr.en: And Enlil, the great lord, 
#tr.en: whose utterance 
#tr.en: cannot be overturned - 
#tr.en: the destiny which he determines 
#tr.en: cannot be altered - 
#tr.en: at Zababa his heir, 
#tr.en: the mighty, 
#tr.en: who achieves his victories, 
#tr.en: (and) Inanna, the daughter 
#tr.en: whom he loves, 
#tr.en: the lady whose divinity 
#tr.en: is unrivaled, 
#tr.en: with his face of happiness 
#tr.en: he regarded them, and 
#tr.en: words of heart-felt happiness 
#tr.en: he spoke with them: 
#tr.en: Samsu-iluna, 
#tr.en: my envoy, mighty 
#tr.en: and untiring, 
#tr.en: who how the desire of my heart 
#tr.en: to accomplish 
#tr.en: does know, 
#tr.en: his shining light 
#tr.en: may you both be. 
#tr.en: May your omen 
#tr.en: be favorable 
#tr.en: for him. 
#tr.en: Kill his enemies, 
#tr.en: his foes into his hands 
#tr.en: put fully, that 
#tr.en: the city Kiš's wall he may build. 
#tr.en: Let him make it greater than ever before 
#tr.en: (and so) in a residence of heart-felt happiness 
#tr.en: may he let you both dwell. 
#tr.en: Zababa and Ištar, 
#tr.en: the most perfect lords 
#tr.en: the most powerful among the gods, 
#tr.en: at the words which their father 
#tr.en: Enlil 
#tr.en: had spoken to them 
#tr.en: their hearts 
#tr.en: rejoiced wholeheartedly, and 
#tr.en: to Samsu-iluna, 
#tr.en: the mighty king, 
#tr.en: the heroic shepherd, 
#tr.en: the creation of their hands, 
#tr.en: their faces of life 
#tr.en: they raised shiningly to him and 
#tr.en: spoke joyfully with him: 
#tr.en: O Samsu-iluna, 
#tr.en: eternal seed of the gods, 
#tr.en: one fit for kingship, 
#tr.en: Enlil your destiny 
#tr.en: has magnified. 
#tr.en: Guardianship over you in well-being 
#tr.en: to exercise 
#tr.en: he has instructed us. 
#tr.en: At your right side 
#tr.en: we will go, 
#tr.en: we will kill your enemies, 
#tr.en: and your foes into your hands 
#tr.en: we will put fully. 
#tr.en: The city Kiš, our awe-inspiring cult site, 
#tr.en: built its wall! 
#tr.en: More than before 
#tr.en: make it greater! 
#tr.en: Samsu-iluna, 
#tr.en: the capable king, 
#tr.en: one who heeds the great gods, 
#tr.en: the word which Zababa 
#tr.en: and Ištar had spoken to him 
#tr.en: he trusted completely, and 
#tr.en: his weaponry 
#tr.en: for the killing of his enemies 
#tr.en: he prepared. 
#tr.en: On a campaign to slay 
#tr.en: his enemies 
#tr.en: he set forth. 
#tr.en: The year was not half over 
#tr.en: when Rīm-Sîn, 
#tr.en: who had caused to rebel 
#tr.en: Emutbala, 
#tr.en: (and) who to the kingship of Larsa 
#tr.en: had been elevated, 
#tr.en: he slew, and 
#tr.en: in the territory of Kiš 
#tr.en: he heaped up a burial mound over him. 
#tr.en: Twenty-six rebel kings, 
#tr.en: his foes, he slew; 
#tr.en: he slaughtered them all. 
#tr.en: Iluni, the king of Ešnunna, 
#tr.en: who did not heed his words, 
#tr.en: he defeated, 
#tr.en: in a neck-stock 
#tr.en: he led him away, and 
#tr.en: his life 
#tr.en: he devoured. 
#tr.en: The totality of the country of Sumer and Akkad 
#tr.en: he caused to be of one mind. 
#tr.en: The four world quarters 
#tr.en: under his command 
#tr.en: he caused to dwell. 
#tr.en: At that time, 
#tr.en: Samsu-iluna, the mighty, 
#tr.en: through the strength of his army 
#tr.en: built the city of Kiš. 
#tr.en: He dug its canal, 
#tr.en: surrounded it with a reed marsh, 
#tr.en: (and) with much earth 
#tr.en: made its foundations as firm as a mountain. 
#tr.en: He had the bricks for it formed 
#tr.en: and built its wall. 
#tr.en: Within one year its top 
#tr.en: he raised up more than before. 
#tr.en: For this, 
#tr.en: Zababa and Ištar 
#tr.en: to Samsu-iluna, 
#tr.en: their prince and close brother 
#tr.en: well-being and life, 
#tr.en: which like Sîn 
#tr.en: and Šamaš is eternal, 
#tr.en: for a gift 
#tr.en: may they bestow upon him, 
#tr.en: and as a present 
#tr.en: may they present to him. 
#tr.en: Enlil, whose kingship
#tr.en: of all the gods 
#tr.en: is the greatest, 
#tr.en: the shepherd who determines the destinies, 
#tr.en: because Zababa and Inanna 
#tr.en: among the great (divine) princes
#tr.en: were the most heroic, 
#tr.en: he looked at them with his holy eyes. 
#tr.en: The city Kiš,  
#tr.en: their foremost cult site 
#tr.en: and exalted residence, 
#tr.en: to build its wall 
#tr.en: and to raise up its top more than before 
#tr.en: his heart truly moved him. 
#tr.en: And Enlil, the great lord,  
#tr.en: whose utterance cannot be overturned  
#tr.en: and a fate which he determines 
#tr.en: cannot be altered, 
#tr.en: To him (Zababa) who his victories
#tr.en: achieves, 
#tr.en: and Inanna, the daughter 
#tr.en: whom he loves, 
#tr.en: the lady whose divinity 
#tr.en: is unrivaled, 
#tr.en: his joyful eyes he directed towards them, and
#tr.en: words of heart-felt happiness 
#tr.en: he spoke with them. 
#tr.en: Samsu-iluna, 
#tr.en: my envoy, mighty 
#tr.en: and untiring, 
#tr.en: who the desire of my heart 
#tr.en: knows how to put in place, 
#tr.en: may you both be his shining light.
#tr.en: (Zababa and Ištar) the most majestic of the gods, 
#tr.en: at the words that their father Enlil 
#tr.en: had spoken to them, 
#tr.en: their hearts rejoiced full of delight.
#tr.en: To Samsu-iluna, 
#tr.en: the mighty king, the shepherd and hero, 
#tr.en: their accomplishment, 
#tr.en: their countenances of life 
#tr.en: they lifted shiningly towards him,   
#tr.en: and joyfully they conversed with him. 
#tr.en: O Samsu-iluna, 
#tr.en: eternal seed of kingship, 
#tr.en: one fitting for kingship, 
#tr.en: Enlil 
#tr.en: has magnified your destiny. 
#tr.en: To act with well-being as (your) guardian genies 
#tr.en: he has commanded us. 
#tr.en: When we shall have gone at your right side
#tr.en: the persons who hate you 
#tr.en: we shall smite, 
#tr.en: and your foes 
#tr.en: we shall put into your hands. 
#tr.en: The city Kiš, our [awe-inpiring] cult site, 
#tr.en: build its wall! 
#tr.en: Make it greater than what was there before!
#tr.en: Samsu-iluna, 
#tr.en: Iluni, the king of Ešnunna, 
#tr.en: who did not heed his words, 
#tr.en: he held onto. 
#tr.en: With his neck held in a neck-stock  
#tr.en: he brought him in, 
#tr.en: and his life he slew with a knife. 
#tr.en: All of Sumer and Akkad
#tr.en: he caused to be of one mind.
#tr.en: The four world quarters 
#tr.en: under his command he caused to dwell.

#tr.en: He dug its canal, 
#tr.en: and with much earth its foundation

#tr.en: When two months had passed, 
#tr.en: the people of the land of Idamaraz

#tr.en: and the Țaban rivers 
#tr.en: were dwelling

#tr.en: that they may have no persons terrifying them,

#tr.en: did transmit to me,

#tr.en: is its name.

#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: that I raise up my head 
#tr.en: (and) that against my rule 
#tr.en: no leader rise up, 
#tr.en: they decreed by their sacred word. 
#tr.en: Šamaš and Marduk, 
#tr.en: who love my reign, 
#tr.en: my kingship 
#tr.en: in the four world quarters 
#tr.en: they made the greatest, 
#tr.en: the Black Headed People 
#tr.en: in the rule over them 
#tr.en: they gave me complete control. 
#tr.en: I provided justice for Sumer and Akkad. 
#tr.en: The wide-spread people in peaceful habitations 
#tr.en: I made dwell. 
#tr.en: I made content the heart of my land. 
#tr.en: At that time, 
#tr.en: through the expertise 
#tr.en: which Enki 
#tr.en: had given me, 
#tr.en: that he people of my land should become widely spread, 
#tr.en: that the people through trustworthy food to eat and water to drink 
#tr.en: might be shepherded in confidence,

#tr.en: Ipiq-Adad, 
#tr.en: king of the world,

#tr.en: for the life 
#tr.en: of Ipiq-Adad, 
#tr.en: king of Ešnunna, 
#tr.en: Ammar-ilam the engraver,  
#tr.en: son of Hadum, 
#tr.en: presented it (this cylinder). 
#tr.en: To the god Mīšar 
#tr.en: of Dũr-Rīmuš,
#tr.en: for the life 
#tr.en: of Ipiq-Adad, 
#tr.en: king of the world, 
#tr.en: son of Ibāl-pî-El,

#tr.en: son of Kabzum,

#tr.en: the mighty king, 
#tr.en: king of Ešnunna, 
#tr.en: beloved of Tišpak, 
#tr.en: son of Ipiq-Adad.

#tr.en: of the city ..., 
#tr.en: Narām-Sîn, 
#tr.en: son of Ipiq-Adad, 
#tr.en: for his life 
#tr.en: presented (this amulette). 
#tr.en: Iqīš-Tišpak, 
#tr.en: servant of Tišpak, 
#tr.en: governor 
#tr.en: of Ešnunna, 
#tr.en: son of Ibni-Erra. 
#tr.en: Dāduša, 
#tr.en: son of Ipiq-Adad, 
#tr.en: king of Ešnunna, 
#tr.en: to Inibšina,  
#tr.en: his daughter, he presented (this duck weight). 
#tr.en: Ibāl-pî-El, 
#tr.en: the mighty king, 
#tr.en: king of Ešnunna, 
#tr.en: beloved of Tišpak, 
#tr.en: son of Dāduša. 
#tr.en: Palace of Ibāl-pî-El. 
#tr.en: Ibāl-pî-El,  
#tr.en: the mighty king, 
#tr.en: king of Ešnunna, 
#tr.en: king who reveres the god ... (or Anum),  
#tr.en: beloved of Tišpak, 
#tr.en: son of Dāduša. 
#tr.en: Şillī=Sîn, 
#tr.en: servant of Tišpak, 
#tr.en: governor 
#tr.en: of Ešnunna, 
#tr.en: son of ...-Šērum.
#tr.en: Iaḫdun-Līm, 
#tr.en: son of Iaggid-Līm, 
#tr.en: king of Mari, 
#tr.en: Tuttul 
#tr.en: and the land of Hana, 
#tr.en: the mighty king, 
#tr.en: controller 
#tr.en: of the banks of the Euphrates - 
#tr.en: Dagan 
#tr.en: called my kingship, 
#tr.en: and a mighty weapon 
#tr.en: that strikes down 
#tr.en: the kings my enemies 
#tr.en: he gave me. 
#tr.en: Seven kings, 
#tr.en: elders of Hana 
#tr.en: who fought against me, 
#tr.en: I defeated them. 
#tr.en: Their land 
#tr.en: I annexed. 
#tr.en: The ...  
#tr.en: of the banks of the Euphrates 
#tr.en: I removed, 
#tr.en: and my land in peaceful 
#tr.en: residences I caused to dwell. 
#tr.en: Canals 
#tr.en: I opened up, 
#tr.en: and the drawing of water 
#tr.en: in my land 
#tr.en: I ended. 
#tr.en: I built the wall of Mari 
#tr.en: and dug its moat. 
#tr.en: The wall of Terqa I built 
#tr.en: and dug its moat. 
#tr.en: Further, in a desert, 
#tr.en: a region  
#tr.en: of thirst, 
#tr.en: where since days of yore 
#tr.en: no king 
#tr.en: had ever built a city, 
#tr.en: I the desire 
#tr.en: did get, and 
#tr.en: I built a city. 
#tr.en: I dug its moat,  
#tr.en: and Fort Iaḫdun-Līm  
#tr.en: I called its name. 
#tr.en: Further, I opened a canal for it, and 
#tr.en: Canal Destined by Iaḫdun-Līm 
#tr.en: I called its name. 
#tr.en: I enlarged my land, 
#tr.en: the foundations of Mari 
#tr.en: and my land I made secure, and so 
#tr.en: for future days  
#tr.en: I established my name. 
#tr.en: The one who my foundation deposits 
#tr.en: shall remove, and 
#tr.en: his foundation deposits 
#tr.en: shall place there, 
#tr.en: that person,  
#tr.en: whether a king or a governor, 
#tr.en: may Anum and Enlil 
#tr.en: with an evil curse 
#tr.en: curse him. 
#tr.en: May Šamaš his weapon 
#tr.en: and the weapon 
#tr.en: of his army
#tr.en: break. 
#tr.en: May Ašnan and Šakkan 
#tr.en: impoverish his land. 
#tr.en: May the gate of his land 
#tr.en: be blocked up by hostilities, 
#tr.en: and may battle keep raging 
#tr.en: in his land. 
#tr.en: As long as he lives may his rule  
#tr.en: daily by calamity  
#tr.en: be confronted.  
#tr.en: May Anum and Enlil be his guardians for evil 
#tr.en: forever. 
#tr.en: To Šamaš, king of heaven  
#tr.en: and earth, 
#tr.en: judge of the gods and humanity, 
#tr.en: whose office is justice  
#tr.en: and to whom truth for a gift  
#tr.en: has been presented, 
#tr.en: shepherd of the Black Headed Ones, 
#tr.en: manifest god, 
#tr.en: judge of those endowd with life, 
#tr.en: who is agreeable to petition, 
#tr.en: listens to prayer, 
#tr.en: accepts supplication, 
#tr.en: gives a happy life  
#tr.en: of long days  
#tr.en: to one who reveres him,  
#tr.en: (namely) he who is Mari's ruler,  
#tr.en: Iaḫdun-Līm, 
#tr.en: son of Iaggid-Līm, 
#tr.en: king of Mari and the land of Hana, 
#tr.en: who opens canals, 
#tr.en: who builds walls, 
#tr.en: who erects stelas bearing (his) name,  
#tr.en: who establishes abundance 
#tr.en: and plenty for his people,  
#tr.en: who produces every sort of things  
#tr.en: in his land, 
#tr.en: the mighty king and splendid youth - 
#tr.en: when Šamaš to his petitions
#tr.en: did agree, 
#tr.en: and listened to what he said,  
#tr.en: Šamaš to Iaḫdun-Līm
#tr.en: hastened  
#tr.en: to walk at his side.
#tr.en: Since olden times 
#tr.en: when the God built Mari,  
#tr.en: no king residing in Mari 
#tr.en: had reached the sea, 
#tr.en: nor the mountains of cedar and boxwood, 
#tr.en: the great mountains, had he ever reached  
#tr.en: and cut down their trees. 
#tr.en: (But) Iaḫdun-Līm, 
#tr.en: the son of Iaggid-Līm, 
#tr.en: the powerful king, a wild bull of kings, 
#tr.en: by his own power 
#tr.en: and overwhelming strength
#tr.en: to the shore of the sea 
#tr.en: he went, and 
#tr.en: to the sea an offering for his kingship, 
#tr.en: a big one, he offered,  
#tr.en: and his troops in the sea  
#tr.en: washed themselves with water. 
#tr.en: (Then) into the mountains of cedat and boxwood,  
#tr.en: the great mountains, he entered, and 
#tr.en: boxwood, cedar, cypress, 
#tr.en: and elammaku, 
#tr.en: these trees he cut down. 
#tr.en: He made a commemorative monument (RIME), 
#tr.en: established his name, 
#tr.en: and made his power known. 
#tr.en: That land on the shore of the sea 
#tr.en: he made submit, 
#tr.en: caused it to live subject to (his) decree, 
#tr.en: and made it follow after him. 
#tr.en: A permanent tribute 
#tr.en: he imposed upon them, 
#tr.en: and their tribute is still being brought to him.
#tr.en: In that same year, 
#tr.en: La'um, king of Samānum 
#tr.en: and the land of the Ubrabium, 
#tr.en: Baḫlukullim, king of Tuttul 
#tr.en: and the land of the Amnānum, 
#tr.en: Aiālum, king of Abattum 
#tr.en: and of the land of the Rabbum - 
#tr.en: these kings 
#tr.en: rebelled against him, 
#tr.en: and to their assistance    
#tr.en: the troops of Sūmû-Epuḫ
#tr.en: of the land of Iamḫad  
#tr.en: came, and
#tr.en: in the city of Samānum 
#tr.en: the main contingent of Mār Mîm
#tr.en: gathered together against him, and
#tr.en: with heavy weaponry  
#tr.en: these three kings 
#tr.en: of Mār Mîm he defeated. 
#tr.en: Their troops and their auxiliary troops he slew.  
#tr.en: He inflicted a defeat upon them 
#tr.en: and piled up their corpses.
#tr.en: Their walls he broke down, and 
#tr.en: into ruined mounds and ruin heaps 
#tr.en: he made them. 
#tr.en: The city of Haman of the main contingent of Hana, 
#tr.en: which all the elders of Hana had built,  
#tr.en: he destroyed, and 
#tr.en: to ruin mounds and ruin heaps he made them. 
#tr.en: Further, he defeated their king Kaşuri-Hāla.
#tr.en: He deported their population and 
#tr.en: took control of the banks of the Euphrates.  
#tr.en: For his own life, the temple of Šamaš his lord, 
#tr.en: a temple whose construction was perfect and
#tr.en: completed with masterly craftsmanship, 
#tr.en: a thing befitting his divinity, he built for him. 
#tr.en: In his majestic residence 
#tr.en: he settled him. The name of that temple 
#tr.en: he called: Egirizalanki 
#tr.en: (that is) Temple - Delight of Heaven  
#tr.en: and Earth.
#tr.en: Šamaš, who resides in that temple, 
#tr.en: to Iaḫdun-Līm the builder of his temple, 
#tr.en: the king beloved of his heart, 
#tr.en: a mighty weapon 
#tr.en: which conquers the foe, 
#tr.en: a long reign 
#tr.en: of happiness, 
#tr.en: and years of joyous abundance, 
#tr.en: forever,  
#tr.en: may he grant to him.
#tr.en: (But) the one who that temple 
#tr.en: shall destroy, 
#tr.en: to evil 
#tr.en: and no good shall ... to it,  
#tr.en: who does not strengthen its foundation, 
#tr.en: who does not erect again what has fallen down, 
#tr.en: or who the regular offering meals 
#tr.en: shall cut off from it, 
#tr.en: who shall efface my inscription  
#tr.en: or shall cause it to be effaced   
#tr.en: (and) shall write his own name which had not been written there, 
#tr.en: or shall cause it to be written,
#tr.en: or because of the curse 
#tr.en: shall procure another (to do it) -  
#tr.en: that man, whether he be a king,  
#tr.en: or a viceroy, 
#tr.en: or a mayor, 
#tr.en: or just a common man, 
#tr.en: that man  
#tr.en: may Enlil, the judge of the gods, 
#tr.en: make his rule the shortest  
#tr.en: among all kings. 
#tr.en: May Sîn, the eldest brother 
#tr.en: among the gods his brothers 
#tr.en: curse him with a great 
#tr.en: curse. 
#tr.en: May Nergal, the lord of weapons, 
#tr.en: break his weapon, so that
#tr.en: he cannot withstand warriors(?). 
#tr.en: May Ea, the king of destiny, 
#tr.en: determine for him an evil destiny. 
#tr.en: May the daughter-in-law Aia, 
#tr.en: the great lady, 
#tr.en: speak badly of him 
#tr.en: before Šamaš forever. 
#tr.en: May Bunene the cheif vizier of Šamaš 
#tr.en: cut his throat. 
#tr.en: May he pluck up his seed, and 
#tr.en: may his offspring and progeny 
#tr.en:: not walk in the presence of Šamaš. 
#tr.en: Iasmaḫ-Addu, 
#tr.en: appointed by Enlil,  
#tr.en: son of Šamšī-Adad, 
#tr.en: for Šamaš 
#tr.en: his lord, 
#tr.en: Within 
#tr.en: the city of Mari,  
#tr.en: which he loves, 
#tr.en: he had it (this statue) fabricated 
#tr.en: and dedicated (it). 
#tr.en: He who my inscribed 
#tr.en: name 
#tr.en: shall remove and 
#tr.en: shall have his own name inscribed, 
#tr.en: may Šamaš my lord 
#tr.en: his foundation 
#tr.en: tear out, 
#tr.en: and his seed 
#tr.en: may he pluck up.
#tr.en: To Ištar, queen of heaven and earth, 
#tr.en: who resides in the Ešabanna temple, 
#tr.en: she who listens to prayers, his mistress,  
#tr.en: Iasmaḫ-Addu,  
#tr.en: son of Šamšī-Adad, 
#tr.en: made a (vow) dedication to her.
#tr.en: Two silver gifts(?) 
#tr.en: that by the craftsmen 
#tr.en: were perfectly fashioned 
#tr.en: he dedicated. 
#tr.en: To Mullil, who listens 
#tr.en: prayers, who dwells  
#tr.en: in Tuttul, 
#tr.en: Iasmaḫ-Addu,
#tr.en: son of Šamšī-Adad, 
#tr.en: when on the bank of the Euphrates 
#tr.en: (To Ištar) she who ..., 
#tr.en: and who listens to prayers, 
#tr.en: her mistress, 
#tr.en: Izamu, the kezertum priestess, 
#tr.en: who well executes  
#tr.en: the Raised Hand prayers of her lord  
#tr.en: Iasmaḫ-Addu - 
#tr.en: when my lady Eštar 
#tr.en: my prayer 
#tr.en: did hear, 
#tr.en: and my petition  
#tr.en: did accept, 
#tr.en: her statue 
#tr.en: I dedicated to her. 
#tr.en: A statue which by 
#tr.en: the craftsmen 
#tr.en: was made perfectly 
#tr.en: I dedicated to her.
#tr.en: governor of Terqa, 
#tr.en: the reliable city 
#tr.en: of his lord Iasmaḫ-Addu  
#tr.en: the son of Šamšī-Adad,

#tr.en: ...
#tr.en: ...

#tr.en: in crossing over Mount Saggar 
#tr.en: with an army of his own soldiers 
#tr.en: and ... hundred Ḫaneans he went, and 
#tr.en: inflicted a defeat. 
#tr.en: Also he sent back his herds.
#tr.en: He defeated ... hundred (soldiers).
#tr.en: ... thousand cattle, 30 thousand sheep, 
#tr.en: through the gate of Ekallātum 
#tr.en: the men of Suḫû brought up. 
#tr.en: On ... thousand, 2 hundred and sixty,    
#tr.en: a defeat 
#tr.en: of Yasmaḫ-Addu 
#tr.en: at Tizraḫ he inflicted.

#tr.en: of the king of Babylon, 
#tr.en: to Babylon returned.

#tr.en: they(?) did ... in ..., and

#tr.en: ... hundred troops he slew. 
#tr.en: ... Dilmun 
#tr.en: Zimrī-Līm,  
#tr.en: the mighty king, 
#tr.en: who had performed 
#tr.en: the work

#tr.en: an ice-house 
#tr.en: in Terqa, 
#tr.en: (the city) beloved of Dagān, he built.
#tr.en: Itūr-Šamaš, 
#tr.en: chief 
#tr.en: of the Rabbeans, 
#tr.en: son of Iddin-Ilum, 
#tr.en: governor 
#tr.en: of Kisurra, 
#tr.en: beloved of Šamaš  
#tr.en: and Annunītum. 
#tr.en: Ašdũni-iarīm, 
#tr.en: the mighty man, 
#tr.en: beloved of Ištar, 
#tr.en: favored by Zababa, 
#tr.en: king of Kiš, 
#tr.en: when 
#tr.en: the world quarters  
#tr.en: four  
#tr.en: became hostile to me, 
#tr.en: for eight 
#tr.en: years 
#tr.en: battle 
#tr.en: I waged, and 
#tr.en: in the eighth 
#tr.en: year 
#tr.en: my opponent 
#tr.en: to clay 
#tr.en: indeed turned. 
#tr.en: My army 
#tr.en: into three 
#tr.en: hundred (men) 
#tr.en: was turned. 
#tr.en: When 
#tr.en: my lord Zababa 
#tr.en: gave judgment for me, 
#tr.en: and my lady Ištar 
#tr.en: to my assistance 
#tr.en: came, then 
#tr.en: some food to eat 
#tr.en: I took, and 
#tr.en: on a campaign 
#tr.en: for one day 
#tr.en: I went. 
#tr.en: So for forty days 
#tr.en: the land 
#tr.en: which was hostile  
#tr.en: I made submit. 
#tr.en: I did it anew: 
#tr.en: the wall of Inũh-Ilum 
#tr.en: I did indeed build.
#tr.en: Also the Imgur-Eštar canal 
#tr.en: I indeed dug. 
#tr.en: At that harvest time  
#tr.en: the world quarters  
#tr.en: four 
#tr.en: became hostile to me, and so 
#tr.en: the outer wall of Kiš 
#tr.en: I did indeed build.
#tr.en: Further, the Nundi canal 
#tr.en: in two days 
#tr.en: I dammed up. 
#tr.en: Ašdũni-iarīm, 
#tr.en: the mighty man,

#tr.en: when

#tr.en: of Kiš 
#tr.en: I did indeed build. 
#tr.en: Ga/ba-ni/ir-ma-bi-de-e, 
#tr.en: son of Masalum, 
#tr.en: mayor  
#tr.en: of his city quarter, 
#tr.en: by his (own) power

#tr.en: son of ..., 
#tr.en: ... chief  
#tr.en: of Batir, 
#tr.en: for his life 
#tr.en: the temple of the goddess Batirītum
#tr.en: he built. 
#tr.en: Ipiq-Eštar, king 
#tr.en: appointed by Enki and Damkina,  
#tr.en: king of Malgium, 
#tr.en: son of Apil-ilīšu - 
#tr.en: when Anum, Enlil, Bēlet-ilī, 
#tr.en: and Ea, my king, 
#tr.en: had taken counsel about the land, 
#tr.en: he who dwells in the apsû(?), the lord of every secret, 
#tr.en: made it known to his wife, 
#tr.en: the pure Damkina, 
#tr.en: (saying) Quickly! Take away the offence! 
#tr.en: Avert misfortune! 
#tr.en: Into the future  
#tr.en: may its foundation be secure, 
#tr.en: that of Malgium, your city! 
#tr.en: May the kingship and rule last long, 
#tr.en: may it never cease in the Temple of Life!
#tr.en: At that time, the land came down 
#tr.en: in its entirety, all of it; 
#tr.en: it set up a great clamor  
#tr.en: and caused trouble. 
#tr.en: It desecrated the sanctuary, 
#tr.en: the residence of great Bēlet-ilī, 
#tr.en: and cut down the awe-inspiring protection, her grove.  
#tr.en: Ipiq-Eštar, the pious king, 
#tr.en: the creation of his hand, 
#tr.en: of Ea, namely I - 
#tr.en: from the very first, Ea and Damkina 
#tr.en: desired that I serve them;  
#tr.en: I made and built the house 
#tr.en: for Bēlet-ilī my mother. 
#tr.en: I planted for her a sacred garden, 
#tr.en: one befitting her divinity.
#tr.en: I set up regular offerings of fruit 
#tr.en: before her, forever. 
#tr.en: I named the house Temple - Residence of Intelligence.
#tr.en: I returned to her (her) former dais 
#tr.en: and founded well her residence. 
#tr.en: Whoever shall remove my foundation documents, 
#tr.en: with a great curse may Bēlet-ilī  
#tr.en:: curse him!
#tr.en: Takil-ilissu, 
#tr.en: the mighty king, 
#tr.en: king of Malgium, 
#tr.en: son of Ištaran-asu - 
#tr.en: when Ea 
#tr.en: and Damkina 
#tr.en: to the shepherdship of Malgium 
#tr.en: called me by name, 
#tr.en: (and) my lord Ea 
#tr.en: with his sacred mouth  
#tr.en: spoke to me, 
#tr.en: at that time, the Enamtila temple, 
#tr.en: its entire outside 
#tr.en: with a great supporting wall 
#tr.en: of baked bricks,  
#tr.en: of which, like heaven,  
#tr.en: the foundation was firm, 
#tr.en: I surrounded. 
#tr.en: (Thus) the eternal name 
#tr.en: of my kingship 
#tr.en: I did indeed establish. 
#tr.en: The one who my inscribed name 
#tr.en: shall erase and 
#tr.en: shall write his own name (on it), 
#tr.en: may he quickly be removed, and 
#tr.en: may his inscribed name 
#tr.en: not be restored.  
#tr.en: That person, whether a king or a lord, a gudu priest, 
#tr.en: or one who among humanity  
#tr.en: may be called by a name, 
#tr.en: may Ea and Damkina 
#tr.en: tear out his foundation 
#tr.en: and pluck up his seed. 
#tr.en: May Usmû, the chief minister of Ea, 
#tr.en: be his evil demon,  
#tr.en: unalterably, 
#tr.en: forever. 
#tr.en: Takil-ilissu, 
#tr.en: the mighty king, 
#tr.en: king of Malgium, 
#tr.en: son of Ištaran-asu - 
#tr.en: when Anum  
#tr.en: to the shepherdship of Malgium 
#tr.en: called me by name, 
#tr.en: for great Anum, 
#tr.en: who keeps secure the throne 
#tr.en: of my kingship, his temple 
#tr.en: which over many years had fallen into disrepair, 
#tr.en: I inspected and renovated. 
#tr.en: An  ... offering meal,   
#tr.en: his sacred food,  
#tr.en: and  his praised(?) water, 
#tr.en: on the day of the new moon and the 15th day  
#tr.en: I established for him on a continual basis. 
#tr.en: Also for Ninšubur, 
#tr.en: a portion for his office of chief minister
#tr.en: from the offering meal 
#tr.en: of great Anum,  
#tr.en: endlessly,  
#tr.en: I indeed had set up for him. 
#tr.en: For Ulmaššītum, 
#tr.en: she who called my name, 
#tr.en: the Emaš temple, the seat of her veil, 
#tr.en: the great courtyard, 
#tr.en: home of the numerous people, 
#tr.en: his temple of exultation and courtyard of joy  
#tr.en: where she and Ninšubur 
#tr.en: the joys of abundance 
#tr.en: and festivals of happiness of heart 
#tr.en: therein 
#tr.en: do regularly celebrate. 
#tr.en: With a great terrace 
#tr.en: its foundations in/with ...
#tr.en: I did ... 
#tr.en: frontings(?) of baked brick 
#tr.en: ... a courtyard 
#tr.en: befitting her divinity 
#tr.en: and youthfulness.  
#tr.en: Dãn-bītim and Rašub-bītim,
#tr.en: the lions her envoys, 
#tr.en: they who go at her side 
#tr.en: at the place of royal libations 
#tr.en: and burning-flour offerings of the numerous people, 
#tr.en: I did indeed install. 
#tr.en: I inspected the temple, and its routines 
#tr.en: I put in order.
#tr.en: Holy sasqû offering-flour,  
#tr.en: a kulmašītu priestess, 
#tr.en: two hundred female tigū-instrument players,  
#tr.en: great music -  
#tr.en: an appropriate clangor -   
#tr.en: which for her great divinity 
#tr.en: was suitable, 
#tr.en: in that temple I did indeed set in place. 
#tr.en: Whoever removes my foundation document 
#tr.en: (or) my inscribed name 
#tr.en: makes disappear 
#tr.en: (and) writes his name (on it) 
#tr.en: let him examine the temple(?), 
#tr.en: renew the ... 
#tr.en: (and) build up the terrace. 
#tr.en: He who the name of king Takil-ilissu  
#tr.en: does not restore to its place, 
#tr.en: that person, whether a king,  
#tr.en: or a governor, a gudu priest,  
#tr.en: or any one among humanity 
#tr.en: called by name, 
#tr.en: may Anum, king of the great gods, 
#tr.en: look with disfavor and his kingship's 
#tr.en: foundation tear out. 
#tr.en: and may his kinghip in wailing 
#tr.en: be ended.
#tr.en: May Annunītum, 
#tr.en: who loves my reign, 
#tr.en: destroy him, 
#tr.en: and a great pain 
#tr.en: put in his body, 
#tr.en: a punishment which has never before existed 
#tr.en: among the people. 
#tr.en: May Ulmašītum, 
#tr.en: who called my name, 
#tr.en: the advising of his obliteration,   
#tr.en: the verdict of non-life for him 
#tr.en: forever, may she speak.
#tr.en: May Ninšubur, the vizier of Anum, 
#tr.en: his forehead 
#tr.en: strike, and 
#tr.en: confuse his mind. 
#tr.en: May Dãn-bītim and Rašub-bītim 
#tr.en: with Annunītum 
#tr.en: and Ulmašītum
#tr.en: make bad 
#tr.en: their omens 
#tr.en: forever. 
#tr.en: (of) the palace - 
#tr.en: Imgur-Sîn, 
#tr.en: the mighty king, 
#tr.en: king of Malgium,

#tr.en: When his brothers rebelled against Abba-il, their lord,

#tr.en: of his own free will the city of Alalah 
#tr.en: he gave. Further, at that time Iarim-Līm,

#tr.en: (of) Lu-Baba, 
#tr.en: from month “Gazelle feast,” 
#tr.en: to month “Harvest,” 
#tr.en: it is 12 months; 
#tr.en: year “En-unugal-Inanna was installed.” 
#tr.en: Abbakalla,
#tr.en: son of Ur-mes.
#tr.en: When Enlil, 
#tr.en: the king of the gods, 
#tr.en: the great lord of all the lands, 
#tr.en: towards Utu his gracious eyes 
#tr.en: did direct, 
#tr.en: and of Sippar, 
#tr.en: his ancient city and cult site, 
#tr.en: its wall to build, 
#tr.en: the Ebabbar temple 
#tr.en: to restore, 
#tr.en: of his ziggurrat and lofty high terrace 
#tr.en: its top to raise as high as the sky, 
#tr.en: and Utu and (his consort) Šerda 
#tr.en: into their sacred residence 
#tr.en: to introduce amidst very happy rejoicing, 
#tr.en: with his word which cannot be altered 
#tr.en: he spoke to him - 
#tr.en: At that time, 
#tr.en: for the hero, youthful Utu, 
#tr.en: a great destiny that by Enlil 
#tr.en: regarding Sippar and the Ebabbar temple 
#tr.en: had been decreed 
#tr.en: happily 
#tr.en: was set in place for him. 
#tr.en: To me, Samsu-iluna, 
#tr.en: the king created by him, 
#tr.en: he spoke happily, 
#tr.en: and he issued to me the order for it. 
#tr.en: At that time, 
#tr.en: all of Sumer and Akkad 
#tr.en: whose people had become hostile to me, 
#tr.en: within one year 
#tr.en: eight times 
#tr.en: I struck them with weapons. 
#tr.en: The various cities of my enemies 
#tr.en: I turned into mounds and ruins. 
#tr.en: The enemies 
#tr.en: and evil-doers 
#tr.en: I tore out from the country their foundations, 
#tr.en: and the whole land 
#tr.en: I made dwell under my command. 
#tr.en: From the time long ago 
#tr.en: when the brickwork of the Ebabbar temple 
#tr.en: had been constructed, 
#tr.en: among the kings who had gone before 
#tr.en: no king 
#tr.en: had been favored by Utu 
#tr.en: and so the wall of Sippar 
#tr.en: he had not built. 
#tr.en: (But) I, Samsu-iluna, 
#tr.en: one loved by Utu 
#tr.en: and Šerda, 
#tr.en: the mighty king, 
#tr.en: king of Babylon, 
#tr.en: king of the four world quarters, 
#tr.en: the king whose utterances 
#tr.en: with Utu 
#tr.en: and Šerda have found favor, 
#tr.en: at the commands of Utu 
#tr.en: and Marduk, 
#tr.en: through an army levy 
#tr.en: of my land 
#tr.en: in the middle of that year 
#tr.en: its bricks for it I had formed, 
#tr.en: and the wall of Sippar 
#tr.en: I raised up like a great mountain. 
#tr.en: I renovated the Ebabbar, 
#tr.en: their exalted high terrace of the ziggurrat 
#tr.en: I raised up its top like the sky, 
#tr.en: and Utu, Iškur 
#tr.en: and Šerda 
#tr.en: into their sacred residence 
#tr.en: amidst very happy rejoicing 
#tr.en: I introduced. 
#tr.en: To the Ebabbar 
#tr.en: I returned its favorable guardian genius. 
#tr.en: That which to the welfare of Utu, Iškur, 
#tr.en: and Šerda 
#tr.en: was pleasing I did, 
#tr.en: and that commanded by Utu 
#tr.en: and Marduk 
#tr.en: I put in place. 
#tr.en: Of that wall: Utu 
#tr.en: to Samsu-iluna 
#tr.en: Authority, Might, 
#tr.en: and Life 
#tr.en: Has Presented as a Gift 
#tr.en: is its name. 
#tr.en: Because of this, Utu, 
#tr.en: who his throne 
#tr.en: has therefore supported, 
#tr.en: life, an enduring happy heart, 
#tr.en: kingship which has no rival, 
#tr.en: a scepter of justice 
#tr.en: that keeps the country secure, 
#tr.en: a mighty weapon which pounds the foreigners, 
#tr.en: and rule over the four world quarters 
#tr.en: to exercise forever, as his gifts he gave to him.

#tr.en: If a man . . . 
#tr.en: he will always have . . . 
#tr.en: he will go through life . . . 
#tr.en: If a man . . . 
#tr.en: he will always have [. . .] 
#tr.en: If a man always carries . . . 
#tr.en: . . . 
#tr.en: If a man's . . . are turned back, a creditor 
#tr.en: he will become. 
#tr.en: . . . 
#tr.en: If a man . . .: he is a liar. 
#tr.en: If a man . . . like the spawn of the stars . . . 
#tr.en: Shulpa'e . . . 
#tr.en: . . . stands. 
#tr.en: If a man’s nails are long, he will not be talkative. 
#tr.en: If a man’s nails are short: he will be noisy. 
#tr.en: If a man is perfected by (his) beautiful hair: 
#tr.en: his days are near. 
#tr.en: If the hair on a man’s chest turns toward him 
#tr.en: (and) it looks at his chin: he will become a slave. 
#tr.en: If the hair on a man’s shoulder is coiled: 
#tr.en: women will love him. 
#tr.en: If the scrotum of a man’s testicles is large, 
#tr.en: but his testicles are . . .: 
#tr.en: he will be close to a woman. 
#tr.en: If a man’s ankles are large, he will be worried. 
#tr.en: If a man has no ankles: worry 
#tr.en: will not approach him. 
#tr.en: If a man remains silent (lit. silence falls to him) entirely on his own: 
#tr.en: the wrath of the gods will be relieved 
#tr.en: If a man who has seen a dream does not retain it, 
#tr.en:  his god will be angry with him. 
#tr.en: If a man’s bed continually throws him off: 
#tr.en: that man will experience . . . 
#tr.en: If a man has anointed himself (and) his body is like . . . oil: 
#tr.en: evil will seize him and his companion. 
#tr.en: If a man anoints himself with oil, and in his body 
#tr.en: he has no desire: his god and his goddess will not approach him. 
#tr.en: If a man laughs in his sleep: 
#tr.en: he will get very sick. 
#tr.en: If a man grinds his teeth in his sleep: 
#tr.en: he will worry. 
#tr.en: If a man weeps in his sleep: 
#tr.en: his . . . will decide his fate. 
#tr.en: If a man speaks in his sleep: [. . .] 
#tr.en: If a man’s garment is . . . and very . . .: 
#tr.en: there will be a diminution in his household. 
#tr.en: If a man’s garment constantly hangs down: 
#tr.en: confusion will come into existence. 
#tr.en: If a man’s garment has fallen down and it is spotted with white specks: 
#tr.en: it is a garment of diminished circumstances. 
#tr.en: If a man’s garment does not stay put on his body and 
#tr.en: moves around a great deal: that man . . . 
#tr.en: If a man always makes everything unclear: his deity is angry with him and he will not receive mercy. 
#tr.en: If a man constantly forgets the essence of what he wants to say: this household will . . . 
#tr.en: If a man, when he is looking at someone, does not recognize him (viz. even though he knows him): 
#tr.en: this man will be entrusted to the hands of death. 
#tr.en: If a man recognizes another man at a distance of 1 USH to thirty GAR: 
#tr.en: that man’s personal god will always be with him. 
#tr.en: If a man, when he looks at someone, his eyes loose their focus and 
#tr.en: do not emerge (viz. from this state), that man’s mind will be deranged. 
#tr.en: If a man, when he looks at someone, his eyes are fixed: 
#tr.en: internal confusion will be inflicted on him. 
#tr.en: If a man’s gaze is off-center, viz. he has lazy eye, he will die a death of constriction. 
#tr.en: If a man’s gaze is straight ahead: 
#tr.en: his personal god will always be with him in a positive way, 
#tr.en: he will go through life in truth. 
#tr.en: If a man, when he looks at someone, his right eye twitches, 
#tr.en: he will suffer hardship. 
#tr.en: If a man, when he looks at someone, his left eye twitches, 
#tr.en: he will live in a righteous way. 
#tr.en: If both of a man’s eyes twitch, 
#tr.en: he has been struck on the top of his head; like the top of his head 
#tr.en: his mind will be. 
#tr.en: If a man’s eyebrows cover his eyes: 
#tr.en: food will be given to him along with the gods. 
#tr.en: If a man has no eyebrows, 
#tr.en: as for that man, . . . will not be given to him. 
#tr.en: If a man’s hair is red like wool dyed red: 
#tr.en: that man will go through life without any joy. 
#tr.en: If a man’s hair is black like black paste: 
#tr.en: as for that man, the food of his deity will be given to him to eat. 
#tr.en: If a man’s hair is spotted with white and 
#tr.en: it is like flames: 
#tr.en: that man will go through life in good health. 
#tr.en: If the flesh of a man’s trunk is completely covered with white spots, 
#tr.en: with nuqdu-spots scattered about, 
#tr.en: that man will be rejected by both his god 
#tr.en: and mankind. 
#tr.en: If a man’s flesh is greasy as if (it had been anointed) with oil 
#tr.en: (and) it stays that way constantly: 
#tr.en: as for that man, . . . will be given to him. 
#tr.en: If a man is extensively covered with black halu-moles: 
#tr.en: the position . . . . 
#tr.en: If a man is speckled with isolated black halu-moles: . . . 
#tr.en: If a man’s face, chest, 
#tr.en: stomach, hands and feet are evenly covered with black halu-moles: . . . 
#tr.en: . . . 
#tr.en: If a man is covered with umsatu-moles: he will have food to eat even during a famine. 
#tr.en: If a man is covered with cracked or split umsatu-moles: no joy (in his life). 
#tr.en: If a man is covered with extremely soft umsatu-moles: that man, in his youth, 
#tr.en: will experience famine, but in his old age he will have food. 
#tr.en: If a man is covered with bruised umsatu-moles: 
#tr.en: even in difficult situations, he will have food to eat. 
#tr.en: If a man’s navel is . . ., he will constantly be getting rich without even trying. 
#tr.en: If a man’s hair . . . the thigh . . .: 
#tr.en: famine will seize him. 
#tr.en: If the sinews of a man’s feet are constantly moving . . .: 
#tr.en: it is . . . 
#tr.en: If the sinews of a man’s feet 
#tr.en: are always frozen, viz. standing still, he will suffer from . . . 
#tr.en: If the sinews of a man’s feet are . . . 
#tr.en: for two or three months . . . 
#tr.en: they are this way: 
#tr.en: that man will die within two years. 
#tr.en: If a man, when he sleeps, viz. dreams, a city repeated falls upon him 
#tr.en: and he shrieks, but there is no one to hear him: 
#tr.en: as for that man, lamassu- and shedu-spirits will be attached to his body. 
#tr.en: If a man, when he sleeps, viz. dreams, 
#tr.en: a city repeatedly falls upon him 
#tr.en: and he shrieks, but there is someone who hears him: 
#tr.en: an evil shedu-spirit to his body 
#tr.en: will be attached. 
#tr.en: Water from the mountain destined. 
#tr.en: Flood water from the mountain destined. 
#tr.en: In the mountain, from the mountain’s stomach destined. 
#tr.en: The mountain, the pure place, destined. 
#tr.en: The unreturning poplars destined. 
#tr.en: Of the ram—its twisted horns destined. 
#tr.en: The plant, its split horns destined. 
#tr.en: Outside the shrine, its wild bull horns destined. 
#tr.en: From the ... the runners(?) carried. 
#tr.en: On the silver harbor, the king, son of his god, 
#tr.en: then purified and brightened. 
#tr.en: The evil tongue being, verily stepped out. 
#tr.en: It is an incantation of water cleansing.

#tr.en: king of the universe, 
#tr.en: son of Kurigalzu,

#tr.en: in future 
#tr.en: days

#tr.en: the governors,

#tr.en: lands

#tr.en: fields

#tr.en: will place, 
#tr.en: all the great gods, whose name 
#tr.en: on this 
#tr.en: stela 
#tr.en: is invoked,

#tr.en: and whose (altar) bases 
#tr.en: are recognizable,

#tr.en: to remove

#tr.en: negligent;

#tr.en: field,

#tr.en: like water 
#tr.en: may he pour out.

#tr.en: of Esikilla. 
#tr.en: May the 17 emblems 
#tr.en: of the great gods 
#tr.en: be the adversary 
#tr.en: of him who raises a claim. 
#tr.en: The name of the stela is: 
#tr.en: “Nabû is the protector of the kudurru 
#tr.en: of the fields.” 
#tr.en: At that time 
#tr.en: Kašakti-Šugab, son of Aḫu-bani, 
#tr.en: a clay stela 
#tr.en: wrote and 
#tr.en: erected before his god. 
#tr.en: During the reign 
#tr.en: of Marduk-apla-iddina, 
#tr.en: king of the universe, son of Meli-Šipak, 
#tr.en: king of Babylon, 
#tr.en: on this stela 
#tr.en: a wall collapsed and it was broken. 
#tr.en: Šuḫuli-Šugab, 
#tr.en: son of Nibi-Šipak, 
#tr.en: a new stela of stone, 
#tr.en: a copy of its original, 
#tr.en: wrote and 
#tr.en: set up.

#tr.en: set this up. 
#tr.en: (Property of) the palace of Assurnasirpal (II), vice-regent of Assur, chosen of Enlil and Ninurta, beloved of Anu and Dagan, destructive weapon of the great gods, strong king, king of the universe, king of Assyria, son of Tukulti-Ninurta (II), great king, strong king, king of the universe, 
#tr.en: king of Assyria, son of Adad-nerari (II), great king, strong king, king of the universe, king of Assyria, valiant man who acts with the support of Assur, his lord, and has no rival among the princes of the four quarters, marvelous shepherd, 
#tr.en: fearless in battle, mighty flood-tide which has no opponent, the king who subdues those insubordinate to him, he who rules all peoples, strong male who treads 
#tr.en: upon the necks of his foes, trampler of all enemies, he who breaks up the forces of the rebellious, the king who acts with the support of the great gods, his lords, and has conquered all lands, over all the highlands 
#tr.en: has gained dominion and received their tribute, capturer of hostages, he who is victorious over all countries. When 
#tr.en: Assur, the lord who called me by name (and) made my sovereignty supreme, placed his merciless weapon in my lordly arms, the extensive troops of the Lullumu 
#tr.en: I felled in battle. With the help of the Šamaš and Adad, the gods my supporters, the troops of the lands Nairi, the land Ḫabḫu, the land Šubaru, and the land Nibur, like Adad 
#tr.en: the devastator, I thundered over them. The king who subdued (the territory stretching) from the opposite bank of the Tigris to Mount Lebanon and the Great Sea, the entire land Laqu (and) the land Suḫu including the city Rapiqu. 
#tr.en: He conquered from the source of the river Subnat to the land Urartu. (The territory stretching) from the passes of mount Kirruri to the land Gilzanu, from the opposite bank of the Lower Zab 
#tr.en: to the city Til Bari which is upstream from the land Zaban, from the city Til-ša-Abtāni to the city Til-ša-Zabdāni, the cities of Ḫirimu, Ḫarutu, (which are) fortresses 
#tr.en: of Karduniaš, I brought (those lands) within the boundaries of my land. I accounted (the people) from the passes of Mount Babitu to Mount Ḫaszmar as people of my land. In the lands over which I gained dominion I always appointed my governors. 
#tr.en: They entered servitude. Assurnasirpal (II), attentive prince, worshipper of the great gods, ferocious dragon, conqueror of cities and the entire highlands, king of lords, encircler 
#tr.en: of the obstanate, crowned with splendor, fearless in battle, merciless hero, he who stirs up strife, praiseworthy king, shepherd, protection of the (four) quarters, the king whose command disintegrates mountains 
#tr.en: and seas, the one who by his lordly conflict has brought under one authority ferocious (and) mericeless kings from east to west: The city of Kalḫu 
#tr.en: of old, which Shalmaneser, king of Assyria, a prince who preceded me, had built—this city had become dilapidated, it lay dormant. I took people which I had conquered from the lands 
#tr.en: over which I gained dominion, from the land Suḫu, (from) the entire land of Laqu, (from) the city Sirqu which is at the crossing fo the Euphrates, (from) the entire land of Zamua, from Bit-Adini, and the land Ḫatti 
#tr.en: and from Lubarna, the Patinu. I settled them therein. I cleared away the old ruin hill (and) dug down to water level. Down to a depth of 120 layers of brick 
#tr.en: I sank (the foundation pit). A palace of cedar, cypress, daprānu-juniper, boxwood, meskannu-wood, terebinth, and tamarisk, 
#tr.en: as my royal residence (and) for my lordly leisure for eternity, I founded (it) therein. Beasts of montains and seas in white limestone 
#tr.en: and parutu(-alabaster), I made (replicas of them) (and) stationed (them) at their doors.I decorated it in a splendid fashion; I surrounded it with knobbed nails of bronze. Doors of cedar, cypress, 
#tr.en: daprāni-juniper, (and) meskannu-wood, I hung in its doorways. Silver, gold, tin, bronze, iron, booty from the lands 
#tr.en: over which I gained dominion, I took in great quantities and put therein.
#tr.en: Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, provider
#tr.en: of Esagila and Ezida, eldest son 
#tr.en: of Nabopolassar, king of Babylon.

#tr.en: inspections

#tr.en: are here; 
#tr.en: year: “Ḫarsi was destroyed.” 
#tr.en: ..., 
#tr.en: king 
#tr.en: of Kish. 
#tr.en: Schoolboy, where have you been going so long? 
#tr.en: To the school I have been going. 
#tr.en: In school, what were you doing? 
#tr.en: My tablet I recited, my lunch I ate; 
#tr.en: my tablet I prepared, wrote, finished, 
#tr.en: my ‘standing’ lines they set out for me, 
#tr.en: during afternoon meal my hand-tablet they prepared for me, 
#tr.en: when school was released, home I used to go, 
#tr.en: home I entered, my father was sitting there; 
#tr.en: to my father about my hand-tablet I spoke, 
#tr.en: my tablet I recited to him, my father was happy. 
#tr.en: In the presence of my father I stood, indeed, 
#tr.en: being thirsty, “Water let me drink!” 
#tr.en: being hungry, “Bread give me!” 
#tr.en: “My feet wash, my bed set up, I would lie down!” saying. 
#tr.en: “In the morning wake me up, 
#tr.en: that the morning not pass, my teacher will hit me. 
#tr.en: In the morning at my rising, 
#tr.en: (on) my mother my eye I placed, and 
#tr.en: “My lunch give me, to school I wish to go” I said to her; 
#tr.en: my mother two breads ... gave me, from her presence eating I left, 
#tr.en: “My lunch give me, to school I am going.” 
#tr.en: In school the man on term: “Why did the morning pass?” asked me, with fear my gut was torn; 
#tr.en: into the presence of my teacher I enter, a place I took, 
#tr.en: my school-father my tablet to me recited, 
#tr.en: “... they cut it of” saying, beats me; 
#tr.en: lunch ...; lunch ...; 
#tr.en: the teacher, the instructions of the school checking, 
#tr.en: the beater in the house and the street looked: “Your breast garment you do not tie?” saying, beating me. 
#tr.en: My school-father my tablet brought me. 
#tr.en: The man of the courtyard “Write!” said, ...; 
#tr.en: my tablet I received, ...; 
#tr.en: my tablet I write ...; 
#tr.en: its unchecked places to words of mine I do not understand. 
#tr.en: The man of ...: “Why, in my absence, do you talk?” asking, beats me. 
#tr.en: The man of the switch: “Why, in my absence, the ‘true-neck’ did you not raise?” asking, beats me. 
#tr.en: The man of the floorplan: “Why, in my absence, do you ...?” asking, beats me. 
#tr.en: The man of the gate: “Why, in my absence, do you go out?” asking, beats me. 
#tr.en: The man of the whip: “Why, in my absence, do you ... receive?” asking, beats me. 
#tr.en: The man of Sumerian: “Sumerian you call that?” asking, beats me. 
#tr.en: My teacher: “Your hand is not at all pretty” saying, beats me. 
#tr.en: Scribal art I neglected, scribal art I let fall. 
#tr.en: My teacher his words has not .... with you 
#tr.en: in scribal art his strength he ... me; 
#tr.en: the ‘edge’ of your words of scribal art ..., 
#tr.en: the ‘edge’ of brotherhood, school ...; 
#tr.en: his gift give, that he many times over give, 
#tr.en: that he from the account-recitation release me; 
#tr.en: of all the words that are in the school, 
#tr.en: all the schoolboys counting, may he count me. 
#tr.en: In what the schoolboy(s) had said, his father responded; 
#tr.en: the teacher from school was brought round; 
#tr.en: after the house he entered, in the “zamula” he sat; 
#tr.en: the schoolboy bowed down, before him standing, 
#tr.en: of scribal art what he had learned 
#tr.en: into his father’s hand he gave. 
#tr.en: His father from the joy of his gut 
#tr.en: to the school-fathers friendly words speaks: 
#tr.en: “My little one, his hand opening, into silver-knowledge you let him enter, 
#tr.en: of scribal art, all its tricks, you reveal for him; 
#tr.en: the gut of the tablet, the calculation of accounts, to its solutions you fill his eyes. 
#tr.en: Of writing the covered places he lights up for him; 
#tr.en: like good beer, oil and fragrances for him pour, the table set out for him; 
#tr.en: good oil on his back and his gut like water offering, 
#tr.en: “With a garment I will clad, a gift I will give him, a ring on his hand I will put!” 
#tr.en: Like good beer, oil and fragrances for him he pours, the table he puts out for him, 
#tr.en: good oil on his back and his gut like water he offers, 
#tr.en: with a garment he clad, a gift he gave him, a ring on his hand he put. 
#tr.en: The teacher in joy of gut a blessing spoke to him: 
#tr.en: “The little one my words not having neglected, did not do let fall; 
#tr.en: of the art of writing its head, to the very edge of its side, completed, 
#tr.en: nothing shall be an obstacle for you, who into my hands gave, 
#tr.en: to a gift that, in additional effort placed, heft you added, 
#tr.en: may Nisaba, the lady of the protective deities, be your protective deity! 
#tr.en: A pretty stylus may she place for you! 
#tr.en: and if they of your tablet sing, “Bad!,” 
#tr.en: of your ‘brothers’ may you their leader be! 
#tr.en: Of your friends may you their hero be! 
#tr.en: Exalted-schoolboy may you be! 
#tr.en: passing by the house of the king, gut ...; 
#tr.en: little one, father knows best; I am the one following him. 
#tr.en: The blessing brought to you, your fate having been decided, 
#tr.en: your god and father, with their words true hand may they set for you. 
#tr.en: To Nisaba, your lady, as if your own god, blessings, offerings, prayers you will set, 
#tr.en: your teacher, as if your own father, will bless you; 
#tr.en: suchlike, the art of teaching, at the forehead of ‘big brothers,’ 
#tr.en: good hand your having placed, 
#tr.en: when your ... may they set; 
#tr.en: to the instructions of the school light went out, making a man of wisdom; 
#tr.en: Nisaba, lady of the place of wisdom, his greatness proclaimed; 
#tr.en: Nisaba, praise! 
#tr.en: The princely lord, the princely lord came forth from the house. 
#tr.en: Enlil, the princely lord, came forth from the house. 
#tr.en: The princely lord came forth royally from the house. 
#tr.en: Enlil lifted his glance over all the lands, 
#tr.en: and the lands raised themselves to Enlil. 
#tr.en: The four corners of heaven became green for Enlil like a garden. 
#tr.en: Keš was positioned there for him with head uplifted, 
#tr.en: and as Keš lifted its head among all the lands, 
#tr.en: Enlil spoke the praises of Keš. 
#tr.en: Nisaba was its decision-maker (?); 
#tr.en: with its words she wove it intricately like a net. 
#tr.en: Written on tablets it was held in her hands: 
#tr.en: House, platform of the Land, important fierce bull! 
#tr.en: House Keš, platform of the Land, important fierce bull! 
#tr.en: Growing as high as the hills, embracing the heavens, 
#tr.en: growing as high as E-kur, lifting its head among the mountains! 
#tr.en: Rooted in the abzu, verdant like the mountains! 
#tr.en: Will anyone else bring forth something as great as Keš? 
#tr.en: Will any other mother ever give birth to someone as great as its hero Ašgi? 
#tr.en: Who has ever seen anyone as great as its lady Nintur? 
#tr.en: The 1st house. 
#tr.en: Good house, built in a good location, house Keš, 
#tr.en: built in a good location, 
#tr.en: floating in the heavens like a princely barge, 
#tr.en: like a holy barge furnished with a SI gate, 
#tr.en: like the boat of heaven, the platform of all the lands! 
#tr.en: ...... from the riverbank like a ...... boat cabin! 
#tr.en: House roaring like an ox, bellowing loudly like a breed-bull! 
#tr.en: House in whose interior is the power of the Land, 
#tr.en: and behind which is the life of Sumer! 
#tr.en: House, great enclosure, reaching to the heavens, 
#tr.en: great, true house, reaching to the heavens! 
#tr.en: House, great crown reaching to the heavens, 
#tr.en: house, rainbow reaching to the heavens! 
#tr.en: House whose diadem extends into the midst of the heavens, 
#tr.en: whose foundations are fixed in the abzu, 
#tr.en: whose shade covers all lands! 
#tr.en: House founded by An, praised by Enlil, 
#tr.en: given an oracle by mother Nintur! 
#tr.en: House Keš, green in its fruit! 
#tr.en: Will anyone else bring forth something as great as Keš? 
#tr.en: Will any other mother ever give birth to someone as great as its hero Ašgi? 
#tr.en: Who has ever seen anyone as great as its lady Nintur? 
#tr.en: The 2nd house. 
#tr.en: House, 10 šar2 area at its upper end, 5 šar2 area at its lower end; 
#tr.en: house, 10 bur3 area at its upper end, 5 bur3 area at its lower end! 
#tr.en: House, at its upper end a bison, at its lower end a stag; 
#tr.en: house, at its upper end a wild sheep, at its lower end a deer; 
#tr.en: house, at its upper end a dappled wild sheep, at its lower end a beautiful deer! 
#tr.en: House, at its upper end green as a snake-eater bird, at its lower end floating on the water like a pelican! 
#tr.en: House, at its upper end rising like the sun, at its lower end spreading like the moonlight; 
#tr.en: house, at its upper end a warrior mace, at its lower end a battle-axe; 
#tr.en: house, at its upper end a mountain, at its lower end a spring! 
#tr.en: House, at its upper end threefold indeed: 
#tr.en: Will anyone else bring forth something as great as Keš? 
#tr.en: Will any other mother ever give birth to someone as great as its hero Aszgi? 
#tr.en: Who has ever seen anyone as great as its lady Nintur? 
#tr.en: The 3rd house. 
#tr.en: It is indeed a city, it is indeed a city! Who knows its interior? 
#tr.en: The house Keš is indeed a city! Who knows its interior? 
#tr.en: The heroes make their way straight into its interior 
#tr.en: and perform its oracle rites perfectly. 
#tr.en: Frisking cattle are gathered at the house in herds. 
#tr.en: The house consumes many cattle; 
#tr.en: the house consumes many sheep. 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: Those who sit on daises bow their necks before it. 
#tr.en: It wears a crown to vie with the boxwood tree, 
#tr.en: it spreads out to vie with the poplar 
#tr.en: It is as green as the hills! 
#tr.en: Will anyone else bring forth something as great as Keš? 
#tr.en: Will any other mother ever give birth to someone as great as its hero Aszgi? 
#tr.en: Who has ever seen anyone as great as its lady Nintur? 
#tr.en: The 4th house. 
#tr.en: House given birth by a lion, whose interior the hero has embellished (?)! 
#tr.en: House Keš, given birth by a lion, whose interior the hero has embellished (?)! 
#tr.en: The heroes make their way straight into its interior. 
#tr.en: Ninḫursag sits within like a great dragon. 
#tr.en: Nintur the great mother assists at births there. 
#tr.en: Šulpa’e the ruler acts as lord. 
#tr.en: Ašgi the hero consumes the contents of the vessels (?). 
#tr.en: Urumaš, the great herald of the plains, dwells there too.

#tr.en: Will any other mother ever give birth to someone as great as its hero Aszgi?

#tr.en: The 5th house.

#tr.en: and behind which is the life of Sumer 
#tr.en: at whose gate is a lion reclining on its paws, 
#tr.en: at whose gate is the ruler who decides cases (?)!

#tr.en: Tablet of inscriptions 
#tr.en: from three tablets, statues  
#tr.en: of Šū-Sîn 
#tr.en: and two socles belonging to them. 
#tr.en: For Nanna, 
#tr.en: the lord, the great lion of heaven and earth, 
#tr.en: his master, 
#tr.en: Ibbi-Sîn, 
#tr.en: the god of his country, 
#tr.en: the sovereign who, how every sort of divine attribute 
#tr.en: should be properly performed, knows fully, 
#tr.en: the mighty king, 
#tr.en: king of Ur 
#tr.en: and king of the four world quarters, 
#tr.en: when in Susa, 
#tr.en: Adamšaḫ, 
#tr.en: (and) the land of Awan 
#tr.en: he roared like a storm, 
#tr.en: made them submit in a single day, 
#tr.en: and took their lord(s) into captivity, 
#tr.en: because Nanna 
#tr.en: had brought them back in his great arm, 
#tr.en: and had taken away their heavy gold and dark(?) silver, 
#tr.en: Ibbi-Sîn, 
#tr.en: the prince with great power, clad in fearsomeness, 
#tr.en: with wide intelligence - 
#tr.en: a golden seven-teat jar, 
#tr.en: whose openings let out honeyed water(?), 
#tr.en: whose golden (drinking) reed 
#tr.en: is a channel running majestically, 
#tr.en: a thing fit for the first-fruits offerings, 
#tr.en: whose copper sickles(?) 
#tr.en: are strong multiple reed ..., 
#tr.en: a mountain range growing pure clean junipers, 
#tr.en: with breasts making things numerous 
#tr.en: for(?) youthful Suen 
#tr.en: which are unceasing - 
#tr.en: for his life 
#tr.en: he dedicated it to him. 
#tr.en: A person who the order of an evil thing  
#tr.en: shall issue regarding it, 
#tr.en: and from the exalted platform of the (divine) dining hall 
#tr.en: and the festival place 
#tr.en: of Nanna 
#tr.en: shall cause it to be held back, 
#tr.en: may the great gods of heaven and earth 
#tr.en: curse him. 
#tr.en: O Enlil with exalted utterances, your judgments being high and wide, 
#tr.en: issuing divine decisions, whose word cannot be altered, with ... planning placed in his hands, 
#tr.en: Išme-Dagan, the strong young man with the muscles and body of a lion, strong youth possessing fearsomeness, 
#tr.en: who alone is exalted, lord whose called good name is demonstrated in all lands, 
#tr.en: under his sway he has made the living creatures numerous, 
#tr.en: and into whose hand were given the Black Headed People in their shelters where the people reside, 
#tr.en: They prepared correctly for him the first-fruit offerings of the land. 
#tr.en: They are not (merely?) left to him in his good palace. 
#tr.en: At that time, Išme-Dagan, the youth, the hero of the runners, 
#tr.en: to Nippur, being the city where the seed of the myriad people sprang up, where the living were born, 
#tr.en: the reverent(?) runner who serves night and day without ceasing, 
#tr.en: who daily brings everything (needed), made a great resolution. 
#tr.en: When he rises up it is gigantic, a flood bringing a wind in its fury, 
#tr.en: With his arms swinging open over and over, he flashes across distant miles 
#tr.en: like a fierce lion of the steppe going with strength and youthfulness. 
#tr.en: opening wide his knees on the highway, striding towards battle and combat, 
#tr.en: like a horse ... on the highway with its tail extended, 
#tr.en: like a buck when racing around inspiring fear ... 
#tr.en: whose his knees when set free are untiring ..., 
#tr.en: the son who brings everything for Enlil, 
#tr.en: and also that which gladdens the heart of Ninlil, 
#tr.en: the king cares unceasingly for the lapis lazuli shrine. 
#tr.en: At that time, Išme-Dagan, a copper statue which inspires fear as it races against the storm, 
#tr.en: in the temple clad in fearsomeness, upon his most precious dais, 
#tr.en: he set it up and colored it brilliantly. 
#tr.en: The great prince of the whole heaven, the lord whose utterance cannot be altered, 
#tr.en: his shining brow and raised righteous eyes 
#tr.en: may he let be upon him, directed towards the faithful shepherd whom he has engendered. 
#tr.en: But a king who orders a wicked thing, 
#tr.en: and erases this inscription and writes his own name upon it, 
#tr.en: or because of this curse incites another person to do it, 
#tr.en: may Enlil my master and Ninli my mistress curse that person. 
#tr.en: May Enki, Iškur, Ezinu, and Šakan, the lords of abundance, 
#tr.en: after locking up abundance in heaven and earth, ... him evilly. 
#tr.en: For Ninlil, the exalted queen,  
#tr.en: most resplendant of of the Anuna gods, 
#tr.en: ... in heaven and earth 
#tr.en: like ... 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: ... 
#tr.en: their daises ...
#tr.en: for kingship ...
#tr.en: he the one given the crown and scepter,
#tr.en: for the great mother of the Anuna gods, 
#tr.en: the mistress of the Ki'ur ...,
#tr.en: the exalted shrine Ekur's 
#tr.en: divine attributes to select, 
#tr.en: the Nippur shrine Duranki's 
#tr.en: ritual lustrations to cleanse, 
#tr.en: to make the divine rites that had fallen away 
#tr.en: reappear magnificently,
#tr.en: and Nippur, the bellwether of the nation,
#tr.en: to restore to its previous state,
#tr.en: it was Ur-Ninurta,
#tr.en: the one serving the Ekur,
#tr.en: upon whom Enlil, the king of all the lands,
#tr.en: out over the broad population
#tr.en: did lift his eye
#tr.en: and did rightly choose.
#tr.en: (for) An, Enlil, (and) Ninlil
#tr.en: I removed evil,
#tr.en: and (in) the shining Ekur temple in the city ... 
#tr.en: I set them up for them.
#tr.en: (Further,) copper figures whose bodily features  
#tr.en: were made to resemble me, 
#tr.en: with an offering kid,
#tr.en: were made in miniature(?), 
#tr.en: and, set up for (the delivering of) my prayers, 
#tr.en: as the main courtyard of the Gagiššua's  
#tr.en: ornament, I fashioned for her (Ninlil), 
#tr.en: and for my life
#tr.en: I dedicated them to her.
#tr.en: A person who an order of wickedness  
#tr.en: shall issue against it,
#tr.en: and my creation 
#tr.en: shall efface,
#tr.en: by the exalted command of Enlil
#tr.en: ... may his revealed name   
#tr.en: be revoked from within the Ekur.
#tr.en: May Ninurta, the mighty warrior of Enlil, 
#tr.en: be the inseparable bailiff for this
#tr.en: for an eternity of days!
#tr.en: To Enlil, the king of all the lands, 
#tr.en: his master, 
#tr.en: Enlil-bāni,
#tr.en: the mighty king, king of Isin 
#tr.en: and king of Sumer and Akkad, 
#tr.en: beloved of Enlil 
#tr.en: and Nininsina,
#tr.en: a thing ...
#tr.en: For Ninlil, 
#tr.en: queen of the gods, 
#tr.en: king Iddin-Dagān  
#tr.en: fashioned two big copper statues 
#tr.en: but did not bring them to Nippur. 
#tr.en: From (the hands of) Iddin-Dagān 
#tr.en: until king Enlil-bāni 
#tr.en: it was 117 years 
#tr.en: that they stood in Isin. 
#tr.en: Ninlil, with a happy heart 
#tr.en: desired it and gave command, and so  
#tr.en: Enlil-bāni, the strong king, 
#tr.en: king of Isin, king of Sumer and Akkad, 
#tr.en: beloved of Enlil and Ninlil, 
#tr.en: those two big copper statues 
#tr.en: from within Isin 
#tr.en: to Nippur he had brought. 
#tr.en: In the great courtyard of the Gageššua temple 
#tr.en: before Ninlil his mistress he set them up. 
#tr.en: Because of this, Ninlil 
#tr.en: the life of Enlil-bāni, 
#tr.en: from (her) place (beside) Enlil, she lengthened its days.

#tr.en: may Enlil my master and Ninlil my mistress
